Hotel_Name: Radisson Blu Hotel, Marrakech Carre Eden
Review_Date: Jane M wrote a review Mar 17
Review_Text: Big busy hotel. Really busy. Great location that is walking distance to many shops/attractions in the new part of Marrakesh. Adjacent to a shopping mall. There is a starbucks next door also a McDonald's. If you want to feel that you are in any big city then stay here. Not a Morrocan experience. Staff was friendly and helpful multilingual. Room was nice pool area is very nice and the pool itself was very nice. Food was good. Breakfast buffet was huge and very comprehensive for all types of food. A bit hectic at breakfast at peak times but the staff keeps food trays filled and tables cleared.

Hotel_Name: Radisson Blu Hotel, Marrakech Carre Eden
Review_Text: Returned to the Radisson after pandemic this quality hotel still has its high standards with all the staff being friendly and helpful thanks to AOSSAM at the reception also the pool attendant HICHAM for his friendly manner and always having time for you even though at times he was run off his feet and finally MOHAMED in the dining room for his complete attentiveness and making meal times more enjoyable a quiet but professional employe

Hotel_Name: Radisson Blu Hotel, Marrakech Carre Eden
Review_Text: Large well-appointed bedroom and bathroom with all necessary amenities including luxury bath products. Very comfortable beds. Bathtub. Well situated close to stores and tourist sites. We enjoyed our stay. Bicee view over heated swimming pool.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Hotel_Name: Radisson Blu Hotel, Marrakech Carre Eden
Review_Text: In fact it was a very nice experience The hotel is located in the city center and close to all amenities all the staff are smiling and helpful I would also like to thank Mohamed the graphic designer for helping us and for the chocolate Thanks Radisson Blu

Hotel_Name: Radisson Blu Hotel, Marrakech Carre Eden
Review_Title: The Pool Is Covered Over and Not in Use
Review_Text: We selected this hotel specifically for its heated pool. We arrived at the hotel to find the very small reception totally overcrowded with a large group. After check in we had an incredibly long walk to our OK room. We then found a message on the room TV saying that the pool had a leak and was out of use. We double checked and there was no information on the hotel web site or any other booking sites saying the pool was closed. The hotel does offer an alternative visit to another hotel with a pool but you have to give notice etc etc and it is at least a 10 minute taxi ride away. The breakfast is in the most dimly lit restaurant I have been in. It was virtually impossible to see the food. We had booked for several nights but checked out after 1. The reason for the three stars is that the reception staff were incredibly nice and apologetic about the pool otherwise the review would have had less stars
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Hotel_Name: Radisson Blu Hotel, Marrakech Carre Eden
Review_Text: We were warmly welcomed from the moment we arrived. The reception staff are all fabulous very polite and friendly and very helpful. We had a slight issue with payment of our stay (we had prepaid as part of a package booking but for some reason it wasn't showing on the reservation. We had to wait jntil the next morning to get this confirmed but even then on check out we had the same issue and needed to wait to get it resolved). The staff were very helpful and polite throughout this.  The location is great for exploring Marrakech not far from the hotel and walking distance to many good attractions.  The room was perfect for our needs the bathroom being impressively huge! We were on the first floor and did find that in the evenings you could hear a lot of noise from the downstairs bar and outside area - great if you want to enjoy from a far on your balcony but not so good if you want a quiet night in or an early night.  Breakfast was plentiful and varied and we ordered food in rhe evening too which was really tasty!  All in all a great trip and thank you to Aissam and Sara on reception for all their help.

Hotel_Name: Radisson Blu Hotel, Marrakech Carre Eden
Review_Date: Erkan B wrote a review Jan 2023
Review_Title: Very modern hotel with great service with a smile
Review_Text: The hotel is centrally located and within easy reach of most landmarks. The rooms are spacious and beds very comfortable and the balcony a real plus. All staff greet with a smile and are always on hand to assist and help. The breakfast buffet is plentiful with lots of choice hot and cold. I used the spa for a massage and would recommend it if you are looking for a bit of pampering. An added bonus to the hotel is that is has a small shopping mall next to it.

Hotel_Name: Radisson Blu Hotel, Marrakech Carre Eden
Review_Text: Fantastic location within walking distance if restaurants and shopping. Excellent breakfast buffet with local as well as international selections. Nice sized gym and spa although I didn‚Äôt have time to use them. Had dinner there on New Years‚Äô eve. Menu was limited but meals were tasty. Lively bar area with dj the 3 nights we stayed between Christmas and New Years‚Äô.

Hotel_Name: Radisson Blu Hotel, Marrakech Carre Eden
Review_Title: Worst Hotel We Have Ever Been To
Review_Text: Not sure where to start. This is not anywhere close to a 5 star hotel. Maybe 2 stars at best. Avoid at all costs if you are looking for a luxury (or even clean) experience. We were due to stay six nights but could only tolerate three nights and checked out early.    Just a few areas to point out:    1. Very unhelpful at check in - rude and aggressive  2. Filthy dirty hotel overall - stains all over the carpets chairs dirt and dust - just very unhygienic  3. Bed is like sleeping on a rock  4. Kids club is dirty and everything is broken  5. Breakfast walking into a war zone    Stay anywhere but here in Marrakech.

Hotel_Name: Radisson Blu Hotel, Marrakech Carre Eden
Review_Date: Robert M wrote a review Dec 2022
Review_Text: The hotel is great for business and for pleasure. After a long day of working or touring it‚Äôs nice to be greeted by friendly management especially the Pool Manager Hicham. I highly recommend this hotel.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Hotel_Name: Radisson Blu Hotel, Marrakech Carre Eden
Review_Date: daniel d wrote a review Dec 2022
Review_Text: Warm friendly and helpful staff made our stay unforgettable!!  They definitely know the meaning of hospitality! üá≤üá¶  Great food! The drinks were cold  tea was hot and a smile on everyone‚Äôs face!    Some of the friendliest people we have ever encountered we highly recommend staying!

Hotel_Name: Radisson Blu Hotel, Marrakech Carre Eden
Review_Date: Amal M wrote a review Nov 2022
Review_Text: Me and my friend stayed here earlier this month. It was wonderful experience staff were friendly and attentive especially Hasan at the reception he was amazing and gave us a lot of great recommendations which we really appreciate it. I definitely recommend this hotel absolutely beautiful. I can‚Äôt wait to return soon. ‚ù§Ô∏è

Hotel_Name: Radisson Blu Hotel, Marrakech Carre Eden
Review_Date: Monet N wrote a review Nov 2022
Review_Title: Thank you Hasan - you made us feel welcomed
Review_Text: My friends and I stayed at Radisson Blu Carre Eden and it was an excellent choice. the location was close to everything and the staff was amazing. Kudos and many thanks to Hasan the Night Supervisor he was very friendly with a warm personality. He gave us advice and tips about must see places to visit in the city tips to maneuver the medina (market) restaurants and bars that we could check out. I would definitely recommend this hotel. It's a true sample of excellent hospitality. Thank you again Hasan for going over and above to make us feel at welcome.

Hotel_Name: Radisson Blu Hotel, Marrakech Carre Eden
Review_Date: David R wrote a review Nov 2022
Review_Text: Very comfortable and modern hotel but beware many of the rooms are a very very long way from the only set of elevators. The rooms have been nicely refurbished with lots of electric points but they seem to have been signed off for solo male travellers with no need to sit before a mirror.

Hotel_Name: Radisson Blu Hotel, Marrakech Carre Eden
Review_Date: Mark P wrote a review Nov 2022
Review_Title: A good corporate hotel with great outside spaces.
Review_Text: The hotel is a good corporate hotel the staff are attentive and efficient. They willingly swapped our room when there was an issue with the drains.  The pool attendant Hichon was particularly helpful and professional ensuring we wanted for nothing.

Hotel_Name: Radisson Blu Hotel, Marrakech Carre Eden
Review_Text: Well situated hotel. Rooms are lovely. I would recommend a pool view priority suite. Balcony is a welcome addition to this level rooms. Breakfast is lovely. Pool is great. Service is warm and friendly with a lot of security. Fitness room is ok and spa and massages were wonderful! Highly recommend this 4+ star hotel.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Hotel_Name: Radisson Blu Hotel, Marrakech Carre Eden
Review_Date: Marcin W wrote a review Oct 2022
Review_Text: Very good hotel with a pool in the center of Marrakesh. Next to a shopping mall and caf√©s and restaurants. There even a Starbucks next door. Nice hotel bar with life music and great service. Taha was outstanding! Very professional and personable.

Hotel_Name: Radisson Blu Hotel, Marrakech Carre Eden
Review_Title: Location tick, other aspects not so good
Review_Text: First the good bits: the hotel is well-located on top of the Carre Eden mall. A number of small boutiques may not be all that useful but the laundry/dry cleaner and the supermarket certainly were for us. The supermarket makes good sushi to order and salads.  The other good bit is that the room has a fridge for storing drinks or other cold produce bought in the supermarket.    Sorry that‚Äôs the good bits finished. So now the bad bits.    Firstly the maintenance:    We paid for early check in from 11.00 and arrived at 11.30. The room was ready but we weren‚Äôt able to do anything until 14.00 but sit around in the room wondering whether to unpack or change rooms whilst a succession of maintenance people came to fix the aircon (which initially would not come on at all) and identify and fix the leak from our sink (they never managed and we were instead supplied with extra towels for the side of the sink and the floor below it). They did manage to get the lights by the bed working (loose connection) but they never managed to fix the shaving mirror which stayed resolutely pointing at the floor throughout our stay. To give the hotel some minor credit I only had to ask once whether they thought it would be appropriate to remove the early check-in charge from the bill which they presented to me at check out.    Secondly the design    There is no separate bathroom. There is a large shower cubicle with an opaque door and a toilet also with an opaque door but no lock. There is nowhere to do anything in privacy from your roommate. As a long-time couple we could manage with that but many other guests may not feel so comfortable. And that leaky sink is actually in the bedroom.    Thirdly the noise    The bar has live music until 23.00 daily. We were two floors higher up and not directly above it despite which our room ‚Äúshook‚Äù with the bass of the music for several hours. The volume is extraordinary and the bar keeps its doors to the pool open plus on one night the hotel also fired up the outside speakers. We‚Äôd paid for a pool view room ‚Äì and it was a much nicer view than street-facing would have been ‚Äì but this noise was the price.    Fourthly the gym    Aircon is kept off in the gym and a request to turn it on was met with a promise to get someone to do it but it never happened. The thermostat on the gym wall read 29 degrees. I managed 20 minutes on the cross-trainer. My wife gave up after 10 minutes finding it hard to breathe.    Fifth the air conditioning in the bedroom    Once maintenance got it working we found that it had two functions only: off; or artic gale. There is no fan speed adjustment available and it is set to high/fierce and the thermostat is located in the warmest part of the room well behind the aircon fan outlet. So even with the a/c thermostat set to 28 degrees the icy blast just continues    Sixth and final bad bit    It is a conference hotel. Of course many city centre hotels are conference hotels. But in this case there does not appear to be a dedicated conference area and the conference took place along our corridor of the fourth floor. The delegates and the conference hosts all seemed courteous but we did have to squeeze past them in the narrow corridors to get to and from our room; plus the corridors were made even narrower by the large amount of signage for the conference including one particularly big sign directly adjacent to our door. Certainly not a relaxing environment.    In summary then a really poor choice of hotel by us. Luckily this was the mid part of our stay in Marrakech as we started with three nights at a very pleasant Riad in the Medina then the three nights at the Radisson Blu in Gueliz and finally five nights at a very nice leisure hotel out of town. So at least the rotten Radisson was sandwiched by two much better choices.

Hotel_Name: Radisson Blu Hotel, Marrakech Carre Eden
Review_Text: I arrived late after a delayed flight from Gatwick to the hotel which has an interesting layout. After being made welcome and shown where reception was (2nd floor) I was met by lovely and friendly reception staff who were very helpful. I was then shown my room which was basically outstanding. Clean spacious and with an extremely comfy bed it felt like home. I felt very refreshed after my first nights sleep and when I had a couple of questions the staff again couldn't do enough to help me. I'm here for a conference which starts tomorrow and not only am I looking forward to that but also the rest of my stay.

Hotel_Name: Radisson Blu Hotel, Marrakech Carre Eden
Review_Date: farhan m wrote a review Oct 2022
Review_Text: Stayed in this hotel from 20-27 September and I genuinely can not fault the hotel. The rooms were perfect and clean location is perfect right next to the care Eden shopping mall. I have to point out the staff this is what realy makes the hotel worth staying at. From day 1 the staff were amazing and helpful. The customer service provided was above and beyond expectation. From check in to check out everything was perfect. A special mention for staff wassima and basra who made sure our stay was perfect. The customer service provided by these 2 was above and beyond. Nothing but praise for this place and hope to return at some point

Hotel_Name: Radisson Blu Hotel, Marrakech Carre Eden
Review_Title: Not great; thermostat fell off the wall
Review_Text: Aircon didn‚Äôt work on arrival. When I tried to adjust the thermostat it fell off the wall. Out of four calls made for service two died without anyone picking up. Still waiting for someone to fix the aircon and give me some air (and water as they ran out of drinking water in the room)

Hotel_Name: Radisson Blu Hotel, Marrakech Carre Eden
Review_Text: + very good location breakfast and size of the rooms  - the towels need to be changed at the restaurant nobody can be sure if they have enough beers or same wine like yesterday in the room they did not supply every day shampoos or one day shampoo and not shower gel not every day ear sticks and for a 5 stars hotel is not acceptable.

Hotel_Name: Radisson Blu Hotel, Marrakech Carre Eden
Review_Date: Donna I wrote a review Sep 2022
Review_Text: Absolutely beautiful hotel . The Service was incredible! Everyone from the moment we checked in was friendly and accommodating. I would like to personally say that Quafae Laomaya was just fabulous! She helped answer any questions we had about Marrakech. Quafae also helped us with setting up any tours we were interested in  as well as any transportation concerns we may have needed. I highly recommend this hotel to anyone visiting Marrakech!! You can‚Äôt beat the impeccable service and location.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Hotel_Name: Radisson Blu Hotel, Marrakech Carre Eden
Review_Date: Jim C wrote a review Sep 2022
Review_Title: Solid Hotel in the trendy part of town
Review_Text: Great location lots of good restaurants within walking distance.  - the hotel is on the top floors of the Carre Eden Mall  - 20 to 30 Dirham taxi to the Medina (based on your haggling skills)  - Good breakfast buffet  - Large comfortable room  - Friendly Staff

Hotel_Name: Radisson Blu Hotel, Marrakech Carre Eden
Review_Date: Andrei Plat wrote a review Aug 2022
Review_Title: The Radisson Blu Marrakech is an embarrassment to the entire Radisson group.
Review_Text: The hotel has a good bar and restaurant there is a swimming pool a nice big balcony and a view of everything..... There are far more minuses than pluses...  Didn't like it !!!  1.When you check in they take a security deposit (no mention of it in the booking conditions) but most importantly the return of the deposit I've been waiting for more than two weeks (an employee assured that the three days maximum) and then got the refund after a long correspondence and swearing...  2. In the suite just the sockets didn't work there was no electricity the bathroom locks didn't work.  What is strangest with the lights off the outlets in one of the rooms did not work there was no electricity.  3. And the best part !!!!  When I was about to leave (I paid for the hotel parking in advance) I was blocked by parking attendants - beggars and started to demand (just demand not ask) scaring my children to pay them 50 MAD of course they were sent to hell a hotel employee came out and talked to them about something...(maybe they work together). Finally when I started to call the police the same hotel employee said something to these valets and they left. .....    This is not a Radisson hotel the Radisson Blu Marrakech is an embarrassment to the Radisson hotel chain and the entire Radisson hotel group!!!!    –í –æ—Ç–µ–ª–µ –µ—Å—Ç—å —Ö–æ—Ä–æ—à–∏–π –±–∞—Ä –∏ —Ä–µ—Å—Ç–æ—Ä–∞–Ω –µ—Å—Ç—å –±–∞—Å—Å–µ–π–Ω —Ö–æ—Ä–æ—à–∏–π –±–æ–ª—å—à–æ–π –±–∞–ª–∫–æ–Ω –∏ –≤–∏–¥ –Ω–∞ –≤—Å–µ..... –ú–∏–Ω—É—Å–æ–≤ –≥–æ—Ä–∞–∑–¥–æ –±–æ–ª—å—à–µ —á–µ–º –ø–ª—é—Å–æ–≤...    –ù–µ –ø–æ–Ω—Ä–∞–≤–∏–ª–æ—Å—å -    1.–ü—Ä–∏ –∑–∞—Å–µ–ª–µ–Ω–∏–∏ –æ–Ω–∏ –±–µ—Ä—É—Ç –≥–∞—Ä–∞–Ω—Ç–∏–π–Ω—ã–π –¥–µ–ø–æ–∑–∏—Ç (–æ –∫–æ—Ä—Ç–æ–º –Ω–µ—Ç –Ω–∏ —Å–ª–æ–≤–∞ –≤ —É—Å–ª–æ–≤–∏—è—Ö –Ω–∞ booking) –Ω–æ —Å–∞–º–æ–µ –≥–ª–∞–≤–Ω–æ–µ –≤–æ–∑–≤—Ä–∞—Ç–∞ –¥–µ–ø–æ–∑–∏—Ç–∞ —è –∂–¥–∞–ª –±–æ–ª—å—à–µ –¥–≤—É—Ö –Ω–µ–¥–µ–ª—å (—Å–æ—Ç—Ä—É–¥–Ω–∏–∫ —É–≤–µ—Ä—è–ª —á—Ç–æ —Ç—Ä–∏ –¥–Ω—è –º–∞–∫—Å–∏–º—É–º) –∏ —Ç–æ –ø–æ–ª—É—á–∏–ª –≤–æ–∑–≤—Ä–∞—Ç –ø–æ—Å–ª–µ –¥–æ–ª–≥–æ–π –ø–µ—Ä–µ–ø–∏—Å–∫–∏ –∏ —Ä—É–≥–∞–Ω–∏‚Ä¶  2.–í –ª—é–∫—Å–µ –ø—Ä–æ—Å—Ç–æ —Ä–æ–∑–µ—Ç–∫–∏ –Ω–µ —Ä–∞–±–æ—Ç–∞–ª–∏ –Ω–µ –±—ã–ª–æ —ç–ª–µ–∫—Ç—Ä–∏—á–µ—Å—Ç–≤–∞ –∑–∞–º–∫–∏ –≤ –≤–∞–Ω–Ω–æ–π –Ω–µ —Ä–∞–±–æ—Ç–∞–ª–∏.  –ß—Ç–æ —Å–∞–º–æ–µ —Å—Ç—Ä–∞–Ω–Ω–æ–µ –ø—Ä–∏ –≤—ã–∫–ª—é—á–µ–Ω–Ω–æ–º —Å–≤–µ—Ç–µ —Ä–æ–∑–µ—Ç–∫–∏ –≤ –æ–¥–Ω–æ–π –∏–∑ –∫–æ–º–Ω–∞—Ç –Ω–µ —Ä–∞–±–æ—Ç–∞–ª–∏ —ç–ª–µ–∫—Ç—Ä–∏—á–µ—Å—Ç–≤–∞ –Ω–µ –±—ã–ª–æ.  3. –ò —Å–∞–º–æ–µ –∏–Ω—Ç–µ—Ä–µ—Å–Ω–æ–µ !!!! Hotel_Name: Radisson Blu Hotel, Marrakech Carre Eden
Review_Text: The whole experience was of the highest quality with excellent service. The staff were universally brilliant. They all appear to have been trained to a very high standard; every request that we made was given a positive response and always with a smile. Amina and Younis the front house managers were brilliant in all aspects; Rachid should be proud of a wonderful team. The facilities hotel grounds food ambience and most importantly; the service was outstanding. We are looking forward to coming back as a family; all in Five Stars on the following;    1. Quality and attention to detail.  2. Consistent well trained and friendly employees throughout all the departments.  3. Quality of food/beverages and the location is amazing; centrally located.

Hotel_Name: Radisson Blu Hotel, Marrakech Carre Eden
Review_Date: Jason T wrote a review Jul 2022
Review_Title: Oasis of calm in the City
Review_Text: This is a lovely mid sized hotel with very accommodating staff who looked after us the whole time. The food is excellent and the air con the quietest of any hotel we‚Äôve been at. Great rooms and quality bed linen and pillows. Overall a great hotel.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Hotel_Name: Radisson Blu Hotel, Marrakech Carre Eden
Review_Text: It was amazing experience and the food was good but not much cheese in morning everyone was enjoying but the air conditioning in the room was in comfortable to use you better change it  Nothing else thank you

Hotel_Name: Radisson Blu Hotel, Marrakech Carre Eden
Review_Title: Be Warned - Heavy Deposit to be paid upon arrival which is hard to get refunded!
Review_Text: Stayed here in June for 3 nights.    Upon arrival we were told we needed to pay a deposit of ¬£250 which would not be charged to my credit card unless needed. This is not advertised anywhere so came as a bit of a shock to us.    The deposit was paid and on checkout we were assured no charges will be made on the credit card for the deposit. After arriving back in the UK I could see a charge of ¬£251 had been made to my card and not refunded even though it has been 4 weeks now.    I have tried to call the hotel but to no avail. I have also sent 3 emails which have been ignored.    I would suggest if you are staying here then do not pay the deposit as I have seen from other reviews that some guests have refused to pay this.    Radisson - If you are reading this please refund me my deposit!!

Hotel_Name: Radisson Blu Hotel, Marrakech Carre Eden
Review_Text: ‚Äúmyself and 3 friends arrived at the Raddison blu carr√© eden around 9pm and was amazed how much of a buzz there was going around the venue the staff at reception were awesome Sara Ouimare & team were quick no fuss check in. in no time we were off to our 2 balcony rooms which were found with ease and met all our expectations. We went down to the bar to sharpen up before heading out and the bar staff were very friendly and helpful. The pool was quite and relaxing with plenty loungers to choose from special mention to Hitcham who looked after us at pool side with cold drinks and snacks daily. At breakfast (which was included in our room rate) the food that was served was fresh. hot and of a high quality which is unusual when serving a buffet style breakfast. we had a cracking 5 days and would highly recommend the Raddison Hotel will definitely be going back!.‚Äù Great hotel great location and great staff!!

Hotel_Name: Radisson Blu Hotel, Marrakech Carre Eden
Review_Text: Radisson Blue Carr√© √âden is a superior hotel with English speaking staff fine dining clean and beautiful rooms and spacious settings ideal for a US based traveller like myself. Thanks to Mr. Fabrice Castellorizios and his team for their remarkable accomplishment in the heart of Marrakech.

Hotel_Name: Radisson Blu Hotel, Marrakech Carre Eden
Review_Text: Overall this hotel is in a great location rooms are clean and the vast majority of the staff our super friendly. We didn't however have the best start to our holiday and I did raise a complaint with the duty manager during our stay.    I therefore make some honest recommendations to hopefully improve service:    - Firstly we paid for a pool view however our room was located at the back of the hotel so not anywhere reasonably located near the pool. This room should therefore be advertised under a different package.  - Additionally our rooms were located a few doors down from an area of the hotel having major construction. Whilst this wasn't a disruption to our sleep in the evening it was very loud during the day.  - The management of the pool area was the biggest bug bear for us during our stay. There is a sign which clearly states if your stuff is left for longer than an hour it will be moved. However when i raised this issue with the pool man he said the guests were out for lunch despite a family of 5 returning over 6 hours later. It felt like French speakers were being given special privileges to the British and it was hugely frustrating to experience. We also wasn't once offered a drink once whilst around the pool and had to wait for over 30 minutes when we did eventually go and ask directly at the bar. To the credit of Hamid (Duty Manager) he was extremely apologetic and the service did improve considerably on the remainder of our trip however I do not agree that there should be one pool man to cater for all guests (especially in 40 degree heat!)  - There is also a major issue with sun beds at the hotel as only a proportion come with a pillow etc compared to the lower end equivalent. Naturally guests all want to lay on the better option so it soon becomes a race to grab a sunbed. A simple solution is to ensure all sun beds match the same quality to avoid the disappointment of your guests.  - Personally it made me feel uncomfortable watching staff melt in face masks when working outside. I understand why this is done but possibly the rule should be reconsidered for staff working outside.  - Pillows! Really not to my taste look puffy but flat as a pancake when you lay your head.  - During our stay I had tried to book an extra nights stay as our flights had been changed last minute. The first time i tried the person on the front desk said no rooms were available despite BA and booking.com showing multiple rooms. A couple of hours later i spoke to another member of staff who booked us a room immediately which was surprising considering we were told to come back in a couple of days to book another night from the original front of house member. On the day of check out i was then informed the extra day wasn't processed correctly! It seems like not everyone on the front desk team is fully aligned and surely it shouldn't take 3 attempts to book an extra night. It would also be nice if the staff could advise guests of their full services during check in as this wasn't mentioned on our arrival.    With all that being said we would however stay here again mainly for its excellent location. All the best restaurants are on your doorstep and rooms are clean. I would just hope some of the issues raised could be addressed for a future stay.

Hotel_Name: Radisson Blu Hotel, Marrakech Carre Eden
Review_Date: Darren D wrote a review Jun 2022
Review_Text: Fantastic service provided by Mr HAMID ZAAKRI the manager at the radisson blu. He was extremely helpful and accommodating Going above and beyond to provide an excellent stay at the hotel. I definitely Recommend this hotel if you are looking for a great service in a luxury setting. I will definitely be back to stay again. Thank you

Hotel_Name: Radisson Blu Hotel, Marrakech Carre Eden
Review_Date: Franco d wrote a review Jun 2022
Review_Text: Great service good food in some dinner plates excellent moroccan patisserie selection. Smoking allowed indoor so we couldn‚Äôt sit inside to listen to some live music. The hosts could you use some smiles and courteous greeting. The pool restaurant could use some refurnishing plans. Overall a correct place to stay at or just have drinks and a meal at.

Hotel_Name: Radisson Blu Hotel, Marrakech Carre Eden
Review_Text: Warm & welcoming team attentive to all requests. Hotel has a contemporary yet modern and warm ambiance. Rooms are spacious and have comfortable newly renovated feel to them with beautiful styling.

Hotel_Name: Radisson Blu Hotel, Marrakech Carre Eden
Review_Date: Hugh W wrote a review Apr 2022
Review_Text: Professional and dedicated staff made this holiday stay exceptional from all staff involved in housekeeping the poolside and the breakfast area. The room was spacious and clean throughout our stay. Felt relaxed and comfortable in a spacious and open setting.

Hotel_Name: Radisson Blu Hotel, Marrakech Carre Eden
Review_Date: Steven C wrote a review Apr 2022
Review_Text: I'm a Radisson fan and this one didn't let me down. The staff and service is second to none and they truly can't do enough for you! The rooms are clean spacious and so comfortable. The breakfast is varied and delicious. The area is clean modern and a nice distance to the Medina and Koutoubia mosque. The only slight criticism is that the pool was too warm to swim (exercise) in. I will return!

Hotel_Name: Radisson Blu Hotel, Marrakech Carre Eden
Review_Date: Daniel O wrote a review Apr 2022
Review_Text: This is our second time staying in this hotel - friendly team and fantastic location for everything we wanted to do in Marrakech.    A special thank you to Hicham the pool supervisor he went above and beyond to make our stay super relaxed. He was very welcoming and attentive always greeting us with a smile and a chat. Excellent service!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Hotel_Name: Radisson Blu Hotel, Marrakech Carre Eden
Review_Date: Rana Tausif A wrote a review Mar 2022
Review_Text: Where do I start I am so pleased with the location and space and wanted to say thank you. The hospitality in this hotel has been nothing short of ‚ÄúService Excellence‚Äù The rooms are spacious clean and super comfortable. The Reception staff Specially - Ahmad - was extremely attentive to every detail and very professional. Thanks again for all your hospitality and I am sure we will be back again.

Hotel_Name: Radisson Blu Hotel, Marrakech Carre Eden
Review_Date: zainab j wrote a review Mar 2022
Review_Text: My husband and I stayed at Radisson Marrakech. We picked the hotel based on the reviews and the location. The hotel or the location did not disappoint. We thoroughly enjoyed our stay and all the staff were attentive. I want to give a special thanks to Ahmed from guest relations/house keeping without him our stay would not have been as good. He genuinely went above and beyond to make our stay the best it could be. I would definitely return to This hotel and will recommend this hotel to all couples
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Hotel_Name: Radisson Blu Hotel, Marrakech Carre Eden
Review_Text: Overall it was okay. The pool was a bit overcrowded but the kids enjoyed it. The friendliness of the staff varied between individuals. Sometimes the staff was too busy to answer our questions. I think it was a bit overpriced.

Hotel_Name: Radisson Blu Hotel, Marrakech Carre Eden
Review_Title: Special Thank you to MR SAID ( Night team)
Review_Text: Professional staff always happy to help. Special thank you to MR Said who helped me at the middle of the night sorting me nice and pool view room.    Really appreciate and hope to see you all again soon.    Regards

Hotel_Name: Radisson Blu Hotel, Marrakech Carre Eden
Review_Text: Terrible since the corona a big downgrade. Noth price worth. All the good reviews are from 2019. Check booking.com and screen for recent reviews!!!    Expensive. No sun after 14h on the terras. Sunbeds are dirty. Very expensive but you get 4* service. Radisson blu should give 5* plus.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Hotel_Name: Radisson Blu Hotel, Marrakech Carre Eden
Review_Text: HOMESUITESDININGGALLERY    MAKE A RESERVATION    L‚ÄôHotel Marrakech redefines luxury    In Morocco L‚ÄôHotel Marrakech is a stunning riad in the medina that looks insanely beautiful. Dripping in savior faire I was constantly pinching myself to make sure I wasn‚Äôt dreaming.         Click here to read more         Pink Luggage Abroad         Perfect Stay    Just returned from a perfect 5 day stay at l‚Äôh√¥tel Marrakech. I‚Äôve been to the city many times and stayed in other very notable 5 star establishments and l‚Äôh√¥tel easily ranks among the best. The property is simply appointed with Jasper Conran‚Äôs exquisite taste you are truly made to feel at home ‚Äì in addition service and food is flawless. The pool is lovely and large for a Medina Riad and heated to 28¬∞C and accessible day and night. The cooks are fantastic ‚Äì they served us in about every public space of the hotel from the dining room to the patio to the rooftop. There are phones conveniently positioned throughout the property to receive 24 hour staff assistance. And a special hats off in particular to Fred the assistant manager and his wonderful staff who are genuinely knowledgeable & gracious. The ordered drivers spas in room treatments and anything else we required with an attentive smile. Our suite was beautiful more so than the photos lead to believe ‚Äì domed ceilings beautiful crafts work and a perfectly chosen mix of new and antique furniture that felt beautifully lived in. Would definitely recommend above other similarly positioned establishments and return on a future stay to Marrakech!    TripAdvisor November 2019         An oasis of calm    ‚ÄúWe were lucky enough to stay at L‚ÄôHotel Marrakesh for 5 nights and loved everything about it: our room (Asilah) was beautiful and airy the courtyard was shady and peaceful with its trees birds and water fountain with fresh roses floating in the bubbling water and the pool was so refreshing to come home to after the heat and frenetic pace of the souqs in the medina. As other have commented the staff at the riad are so accommodating and professional ‚Äì we ate dinner there on 2 evenings (once up on the roof terrace which we had entirely to ourselves) and they made sure to cook us different but equally delicious meals on each occasion. They chilled the champagne we had brought with us from duty free and provided olives and nibbles to go with it ‚Äì well we were there for our wedding anniversary! They also arranged a guided tour of the medina and a day trip to the Atlas mountains as well as transport to a beautiful golf course just outside the city. The overall feeling of L‚ÄôHotel Marrakesh is one of staying in a stylish private residence with just the most wonderful hosts ‚Äì many thanks to Luca Fred and all the team.‚Äù

Hotel_Name: Radisson Blu Hotel, Marrakech Carre Eden
Review_Date: Manar a wrote a review Oct 2021
Review_Text: I honestly cannot express how thankful and grateful I am to Chef Tariq . I was pregnant and he really looked after me . He provided super delicious and healthy üòã meal I felt do energised and at home . Not only is the food delicious but the way he presented the food and the table order was so pleasing for the eye . After my pregnancy he also looked after me with a super healthy meal a balance of meat  vegetables  desserts and fruit a super balanced and healthy meal . I cannot express how grateful I am to Tariq . I was so tired after giving birth but the meal he made for me made me feel so happy . Thank you so much to Tariq and I highly recommend chef Tariq for anyone visiting the hotel.

Hotel_Name: Radisson Blu Hotel, Marrakech Carre Eden
Review_Text: Great hotel good location we arrived at 10.30 and we were able to book in straight away which was a massive bonus. We upgraded to a junior suite go for it a nice treat and not a massive difference from the superior room. Breakfast was great they had a massive choice and an omelette station which I had every day but there was something for everyone not much cereal if that‚Äôs your thing but plenty more to choose from. Staff were helpful but they did let my husband and I put up two large umbrellas at the pool which I was surprised by. The coffee machine at breakfast isn‚Äôt great but we asked for lattes and it wasn‚Äôt an issue. The pool is beautiful and loads of towels at all times. You have to get a lift from the ground floor to reception on the 2nd floor then another lift to your floor and the lifts were so slow. Rooms clean and tidy but I think 2 rubbish bins in a suite is needed the pillows weren‚Äôt to my choice but I get some people will love them. The hotel staff at the ground floor were very helpful with taxis for us and got us the cost so we didn‚Äôt have to stress.

Hotel_Name: Radisson Blu Hotel, Marrakech Carre Eden
Review_Title: Great stay, a special thanks to Hamid- deputy manager
Review_Text: Great hotel. Central location in the new town within walking distance or short taxi to local attractions such as Marjorelle gardens Jemaa el-Fna palaces etc‚Ä¶ variety of options for food and drink at breakfast however can get repetitive. Nice pool area and a decent number of sun loungers but unless you‚Äôre a family or don‚Äôt mind screaming kids you might want to stay clear of this hotel as it was loud all day throughout our stay which can‚Äôt be helped given the hotel rooms all surround the pool. I imagine this would be an issue in most hotels in Morocco as it attracts a lot of families so an adults only hotel would be a better choice. Mainly leaving this review to thank Hamid the deputy manager so much for his attentiveness kindness and great customer service throughout our holiday. He did everything he genuinely could to make our stay the best possible and we‚Äôre very grateful! Many thanks

Hotel_Name: Radisson Blu Hotel, Marrakech Carre Eden
Review_Date: Oussama b wrote a review Aug 2021
Review_Text: Today‚Äôs visit was awesome  Mohamed mousaid was very friendly and helpful  he made sure that everyone is well taken care of and having a pleasant time  also the drinks were well  Made and fresh  thank you to all the staff that made this visit and incredible one

Hotel_Name: Radisson Blu Hotel, Marrakech Carre Eden
Review_Date: Nabil C wrote a review Jul 2021
Review_Text: One of the better hotels I stayed during my trip to Morocco in July 2021. Beautiful rooms and very nice pool. Hotel staff was welcoming and professional. Breakfast could be better but not bad with variety of foods. Very convenient location near to train station with a lot of resturants around. Definitely recommended.

Hotel_Name: Radisson Blu Hotel, Marrakech Carre Eden
Review_Date: D S wrote a review Jun 2021
Review_Title: Unresponsive and do not want to give refund back
Review_Text: Unable to go due to pandemic and they have failed to give back money from last year March (2020).    Each time we call up through bookings.com they lie and say that the refund will be processed but it has been months and no refund is processed still or they put the bookings employee on hold.    This is so disappointing considering the reviews which state positive things however there are also reviews which show a similar issue with Raddison failing to issue refunds.

Hotel_Name: Radisson Blu Hotel, Marrakech Carre Eden
Review_Date: Ghita T wrote a review Apr 2021
Review_Title: Such a nice experience! My best hotel in marrakech with an amazing view, and they have NETFLIX!!!! Absolutely amazing!
Review_Text: A peaceful hotel that I completely loved & enjoyed from the beginning to the end. The staff is so professional & welcoming. Shoutout to Rachid Lansari the F&B manager and his team: the food is divine!

Hotel_Name: Radisson Blu Hotel, Marrakech Carre Eden
Review_Title: Good experience and service, nice staff!
Review_Text: I appreciated the service and the warm welcoming from the first day especially reception staff Mehdi advising about the interesting places to visit KalidUmayma and the manager Marioane. Housekeeping were also very caring with good job on cleaning. Restaurant staff was overwhelmed by service but generally everybody is nice and doing his best..I will come back.

Hotel_Name: Radisson Blu Hotel, Marrakech Carre Eden
Review_Text: Needs more adjustments  It dosent seems that your in this hotel brand really they shpuld care about the chain name    So to cut the story price is high fot nothing and if you go to local hotel is much better and cheaper

Hotel_Name: Radisson Blu Hotel, Marrakech Carre Eden
Review_Text: Have to say my start with the Raddison was iffy but after a couple days I started to understand how to get ahold of room service and the staff was great. I need a layover in Morocco for work reasons and the stayed turned out excellent. Youres Messi was the best and I highly suggest you ask him to help with all needs. Speaks Spanish French and English. Worked well as my French sucks.

Hotel_Name: Radisson Blu Hotel, Marrakech Carre Eden
Review_Text: I was an expat living in Marrakech. Four of us joined the gym. I broke my arm and my start date was delayed and acknowledged by the gym managenent. Then the pandemic hit and we were locked down. Then as expats we all had to leave the country and the Radisson has refused me a refund. Despite doing all the paperwork for them not one cent was refunded. Disgraceful !

Hotel_Name: Radisson Blu Hotel, Marrakech Carre Eden
Review_Text: I spent 2 nights here in middle of Covid hitel had great hygiene measures and staff wore colourful masks As it was quiet my loval tour operator secured me an upgrade to the suite room which was beautifully designed space bright huge bathroom double sinks luxury..

Hotel_Name: Radisson Blu Hotel, Marrakech Carre Eden
Review_Date: Oldies night M wrote a review Oct 2020
Review_Text: I m very pleased with the service  also very clean gd location . The staff was very helpful. I would like to thank MR Yassine working at the restaurant for his prompt reaction to all our requests . The pool is heated  great gym one of the best I ve been in a hotel.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Hotel_Name: Radisson Blu Hotel, Marrakech Carre Eden
Review_Date: Achraf Qaci wrote a review Oct 2020
Review_Text: Im staying at the hotel since 23 aug i really appreciate all hotel services ( room service house keeping reception ..) attached some pictures taken during my stay.  Ps: i wanna thank all the staff i really enjoyed my stay hope i can come back very soon...

Hotel_Name: Radisson Blu Hotel, Marrakech Carre Eden
Review_Date: Elon M wrote a review Jun 2020
Review_Title: Fantastic Stay. This is the hotel has everything a hotel should have.
Review_Text: Everything about this stay was fantastic. Usually I do not write many reviews for hotels but the hardworking staff definitely deserve to be acknowledged. I stayed in this hotel for a week in December and it must have been the most hassle-free experience I have ever had at a hotel. From check-in to check out the staff were able to execute any requests I had and did so in an extremely timely and professional manner. The rooms were clean spacious and spotless upon check-in. Lobby and hallways were also very presentable. I would undoubtingly recommend this hotel to anyone visiting Marrakech or anywhere in Morocco. This hotel is definitely at the top of the list.    Elon

Hotel_Name: Radisson Blu Hotel, Marrakech Carre Eden
Review_Text: We stayed at the Raddison for 3 nights in June 2019 as a family of 3. We are regulars to Marrakech and like the Carre Eden part of the city this hotel is located in such a great spot next door to H&M and just a few minutes walk to the nearest supermarket. The staff were very friendly and attentive the doorman so kind to our 3 year old son always ready for a hug and a chat! We were upgraded to a suite upon arrival which was beautiful and overlooked the red city breakfast was a busy affair but we enjoyed sitting outside and taking our time over some delicious Moroccan tea and enjoying an array of wonderful foods both traditional and western. The pool is small but heated and always busy but if you are up early enough its easy to secure great sun loungers by the side of the pool. For children there was a play area located at the back of the hotel in the conference part but it was just a conference room filled with messy toys - no staff and quite a soulless part of the hotel. It was a shame there wasn't a kids club. Food was really nice and well cooked it was also affordable. Service on the evening was slow the bar and restaurant busier than the number of staff. The evenings are great the hotel has a really nice hip vibe and has families couples and friend groups all enjoying the space. We loved it it offers great value for money in a great location and we will def go back in future.

Hotel_Name: Radisson Blu Hotel, Marrakech Carre Eden
Review_Date: Brian N wrote a review Mar 2020
Review_Title: Fraud - they steel you money from you credit card.
Review_Text: To start off with the positive - the hotel facilities and the area are fine. My problem is:  1) We made an online reservation on this hotel for a small family vacation for me my wife and son (2 adults + 1 child) for 12th Feb - 16th Feb 2020. Being a loyal Radisson member we would pay MAD 3960 + 40.000 radisson points for the full stay.  2) When we checked in we where told our son could not apply for a child as the limit was 12 year and are considered as adult. We where told that we had to upgrade our room for an additional MAD 1300 for the full stay due to my son being 15. We accepted.  3)Upon checkout they issued an inovice for over MAD 10.000. I declined and showed our original reservation and the 1300 upgrade fee. After a lot of time and the clerk talked to the manager he appoligised and issued an invoice totaling MAD 5.543 including taxes. The checkout process took a lot of time and I had a taxi waiting. And the total was in the ballpark of my expectations (3960+1300) so I paid and left.  4) MAD 5543 was charged to my credit card and paid.  5) On the 11th March (almost 1 month after checkout) I have beed additionally charged for MAD 3960.  6) I send a email to the hotel on the 12th March and again 16th March - No respond they ignor my mails  7) On the 16th March I called the hotel and is asked to resend my mail.  8) Responce from hotel is "I have purchased 2 parties one with payment of cash/points and one with Cash." - And this is NOT correct we where only 3 people that shared a room and we only had one reservation and only one room !  9) I have send 2 mails on this respond and also requested them to call me - and suprise no answer.    I have taken contact to my credit card provider to object for this amount - but lets see if I get my money back. For now this is money out of my pocket because of their error.    I just want to warn others against this hotel - as this is no way to treat or cheat their customers by unauthoized withdrawing unaccounted amounts from their credit cards and also I loose trust in Radissons loyalty program.

Hotel_Name: Radisson Blu Hotel, Marrakech Carre Eden
Review_Text: Only arrived yesterday and at a time when most seem to be returning to their native lands.  Very well located for most of the attractions in Marrakesh all within a short taxi ride or half hours‚Äô walk.  Excellent breakfast with omelettes cooked to order  Local produce plus some international bits as well  Staff are extremely helpful and attentive  Very good gym  Well stocked bar

Hotel_Name: Radisson Blu Hotel, Marrakech Carre Eden
Review_Date: Sam H wrote a review Mar 2020
Review_Text: Very modern hotel and had everything we were looking for. We wanted winter sun. The breakfast were excellent. The pool area is amazing and has sun all day. Charaf the pool attendant is amazing and made our holiday he couldn‚Äôt do enough to make sure we were happy. If you want winter sun this is the place
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Hotel_Name: Radisson Blu Hotel, Marrakech Carre Eden
Review_Text: Very nice stay!    During the last week in February (2020) my mum and I visited Marrakech for the first time for four nights and chose the Radisson Blu Carre Eden hotel. We were not disappointed.    Staff  We received a warm welcome on arrival and all the staff we encountered from the security guards reception cleaners and restaurant staff - throughout our stay were professional and initiated great customer service and care. They were very hospitable to all guests including guests who were people of colour. Some memorable people included the cashier guy who signs you in at breakfast called Mohamed and one of the waiters called Abd-Ellatif who was very helpful and served us Moroccan tea during breakfast. The staff are a credit to the hotel. The restaurant staff at dinner including the evening general manager were also very professional and welcoming to guests.    Rooms  Our room were cleaned very well daily the mini bar was checked on a daily basis and there is a kettle for making tea/coffee in the room. The safe in the room kept playing up so we had to call for help on two occasions staff sorted it out quickly and efficiently. Some people had bath robes and slippers - our room didn‚Äôt. Breakfast and dinner options were pleasing. (We were half board).    Location  The hotel is located at a very good location. Right next door to the Carre Eden shopping centre including shops like H&M Carrefour and Zara is also outside. There is a city tour bus stop conveniently located outside the hotel to take you to all the major attractions and the hotel is around 20 minutes from the airport.    Summary  We look forward to our next visit to this hotel because of the professional staff clean comfortable rooms and fab location.

Hotel_Name: Radisson Blu Hotel, Marrakech Carre Eden
Review_Date: Janis M wrote a review Mar 2020
Review_Title: Fresh and clean, in artsy district
Review_Text: Stayed there for 3 nights! Room was spacious and clean! Nothing to say bad! Pool area is very nice! Visited SPA for scrub and hammam- very good recomend it!    Only thing- in a bar everyone smokes and for me it was weird because in Europe smoking is not permitted in bars or hotel lobbies! Otherwise hotel is very nice!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Hotel_Name: Radisson Blu Hotel, Marrakech Carre Eden
Review_Date: Raffaella F wrote a review Mar 2020
Review_Text: The hotel is absolutely gorgeous rooms are modern and the breakfast is rich. The only problem is that is really hard to communicate with staff basically except for the reception all the other departments only speak French. In a 5 stars hotel this is unacceptable.

Hotel_Name: Radisson Blu Hotel, Marrakech Carre Eden
Review_Date: Paul V wrote a review Mar 2020
Review_Text: The location was great in a shopping area with a lot of coffee shops and restaurants around.  The hotel in its youth should be spectacular BUT in our days so badly preserved concerning maintenance issues.  Spacious places and pool    We faced several issues during our short stay (3 Superior rooms were booked).  At first after having checked in they managed to misplace 2 of our luggage and had to wait for 90 minutes (our total stay was for 20 hours) to be discovered and delivered. One of the rooms that was given to me was smelling cigar's smoke and had to move to another room (after my request was given a room with pool view) as the Superior with balcony have an awful view. The condition of the room concerning maintenance was disappointing (have a look in the photos attached) in the toilet area there were @suspicious@ stains on the wall the bathrobe's belt was torn.  This is not what you expecting from an expensive 5* hotels and definitely not a Radisson one.

Hotel_Name: Radisson Blu Hotel, Marrakech Carre Eden
Review_Text: Lovely hotel very friendly staff who go above and beyond expectations to try to help you. Rooms were good quality as was service and friendliness of staff. Room service dont always have perfect english but it is manageable and I didnt find this a problem since english isnt their primary language. Facilities and service was all 5*. Only things i would want to improve is if there was more connectivity with the screen in the bedroom e.g. smart share so I could stream from my phone or laptop and they couldn't provide me with a hdmi cable one night (it was pretty late though). I would stay here again when I return to Marrakech as it was good value as well as great location walking distance to everywhere we didnt use a cab for our entire trip literally walked round the whole city. We were a bit last minute with our airport transfer and the hotel organised a hotel transfer for 300 dirhams in a moderate-premium car (e class) with well mannered driver. They were very helpful with printing our boarding passes too nothing could be too much trouble. Thank you for a perfect trip !

Hotel_Name: Radisson Blu Hotel, Marrakech Carre Eden
Review_Date: Abeda H wrote a review Feb 2020
Review_Text: I was surprised by the urbanisation of Morocco‚Äôs most romantic city Marrakech. And pleasantly surprised by Radisson blu . After touring for a whole week and experiencing the wide cultural aspect of the country and it‚Äôs riads and Kasbah‚Äôs this was back to urbanisation . A modern hotel with the usual modern amenities provided with smiles . That‚Äôs the thing I saw smiles all round . The usual 4 standard modern hotels give you the amenities  but they can be very cold and indifferent. Here it was all smiles and cheerfulness . Plus all the shopping is close at hand . Centrally located in the new part of Marrakech. All within walking distance . Good value considering.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Hotel_Name: Radisson Blu Hotel, Marrakech Carre Eden
Review_Title: This hotell keeps its hign standard and delivers a very good service
Review_Text: The hotel is very well kept and the professionalism of the staff is the icing on the cake when you stay here. We specially appreciate the service from Khalid in the front office and Zakia inthe restaurant. the rooms are very Clean and comfortable. Could get a bit noisy from the yard in the evening. Many other good facilities like the Gym and the SPA.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Hotel_Name: Radisson Blu Hotel, Marrakech Carre Eden
Review_Date: Jacqueline G wrote a review Feb 2020
Review_Text: Loved the room. The hotel is located near a mall and many restaurants. The breakfast and dinner buffets were great with many selections. The pool appeared to be heated.  WIFI worked well. Our group enjoyed staying here.

Hotel_Name: Radisson Blu Hotel, Marrakech Carre Eden
Review_Date: Cat La La S wrote a review Feb 2020
Review_Text: If travelling on your own the place is unfamiliar to you. The location of a hotel is very important. This hotel is centrally located in the shopping area with lots of restaurants around walking distance to famous Marrakesh medina the big bus tour is just in front of the hotel. The staff are very friendly and helpful. They introduce where and how to explore and to dine in. The staff Kameila is very informative to help me setting the sim card and booked the dinner table. The hammad in this hotel is amazing a must to try. The breakfast is so good. Highly recommend to everyone!

Hotel_Name: Radisson Blu Hotel, Marrakech Carre Eden
Review_Text: Visited Marrakesh in December and stayed at the Radisson Blu.    Great location very easy to get to and has ample eating places and shopping around.    A good place to stay for both tourists and business visitors.    The Lobby is on an upper floor and the lifts are easy to take and quick.    There is a good Bar at the Lobby Level and they have a band playing on most evenings.    Good value for money.    Staff is also polite and helpful. Also the currency exchange counter at the Reception is open most of the time and gives a good rate.

Hotel_Name: Radisson Blu Hotel, Marrakech Carre Eden
Review_Date: Charlotte H wrote a review Feb 2020
Review_Text: My husband and I are currently here until tomorrow morning. It has been a lovely short break with plenty of sun!  Very nice hotel clean lots of security on the door the pool was warm but it is in the shade quite early which was a little bit disappointing but we just moved to some chairs where the sun was towels provided but limited beds sometimes.  Food- breakfast has lots of options and is always re stocked. I also had a chicken salad for lunch which was ok not amazing but the chips are lovely! Homemade and perfect.  Room- comfortable bed we like to sleep with a fan but unfortunately they don‚Äôt have any clean room and cleaned everyday  Location- good location close to lots of shops and restaurants. The square is 40 dirham in a taxi away and I highly recommend going there! Belly dancing restaurants and all sorts like casinos!  Tips- always bargain people down they will try and charge you over the top prices for everything you purchase including taxis and cigarettes. I was told they were strict with clothes but I found as long as everything is not hanging out I.e cleavage and very short shorts for women then you will be ok. Be wise and precautious when walking out and about of the hotel.  Price- everything is reasonable with regards to price.  There are some building works going on but it doesn‚Äôt really bother me!  I think it would be beneficial to have some music by the pool.  But I‚Äôve had a lovely time. Thank you!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Hotel_Name: Radisson Blu Hotel, Marrakech Carre Eden
Review_Text: I liked this hotel in terms of comfort decor guest experience however I was very perplexed in the way the bathroom was designed. The sink is visible from the room. WC was private and shower private but there is no actual door into a bathroom. It's all open plan from the room and only WC and Shower have a door. So once I've had my shower I had to get myself dried and ready in full view of my Husband. Who was sat on the desk chair watching tv. Yes we have been married for 15 years but I still like some privacy to get ready washed brushing my teeth etc and world have liked for him to have that privacy too! If you dont get dried and ready outside the shower visible to whoever you share a room with you would need to either get ready in the WC (it too small and no hooks to even hang your clean clothes) or back in the wet shower cubicle!! Madness! Why did you make the screen that you can pull past the sink see through? The screen that would give a little privacy doesn't because you can see right through it!    The lifts were also a daft idea that I could only get to the 2nd floor then had to change lift to go either up or down. Just make the 4 lifts go both up and down!    Everything else In the hotel was great it was quiet it was comfortable I enjoyed the breakfast and service but would not return due to the open plan bathroom. I wasn't ideal and made me feel awkward. I imagine most people like me would prefer a bathroom experience with some privacy!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Hotel_Name: Radisson Blu Hotel, Marrakech Carre Eden
Review_Date: Joyce F wrote a review Jan 2020
Review_Text: The Radisson Blue Hotel an amazing friendly staff accommodations were great. The Gem is our friendly waiter Abd-Efitiel always with A smile ear to ear with a heart of gold.  The hotel is located in the heart of the modern district easy access to M√©dina shopping nd other great sites.

Hotel_Name: Radisson Blu Hotel, Marrakech Carre Eden
Review_Date: Teri Z wrote a review Jan 2020
Review_Text: Had an Excellent stay at this hotel Abdellatif was a very Friendly Professional server and host. The Palmieri Camel Rides is a Must as well as Shopping at the Medina. 1st trip to Morroco and Loved it!!!!

Hotel_Name: Radisson Blu Hotel, Marrakech Carre Eden
Review_Text: We recently spent three nights at the Raddison Blu Hotel Marrakesh. Winter is the perfect time to visit Morocco as the temps and weather are perfect. We found the hotel to be well located and only a short walk or cab ride to all major attractions. The hotel staff was extremely helpful in arranging currency exchange booking local tours and restaurants. The free breakfast buffet is amazing with a huge offering of well-prepared foods. The hotel‚Äôs fitness center is open 24/7 and is well-equipped (if only one didn‚Äôt have to access entry to it through the smoky bar and lounge). The best guest rooms face onto the interior central plaza and swimming pool. The guest rooms are clean and well-maintained. Internet service is free and worked well. In short no complaints about this hotel. Highly recommended for any visitors to the fascinating city of Marrakesh.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Hotel_Name: Radisson Blu Hotel, Marrakech Carre Eden
Review_Text: What a place. Bang in the town centre with all the designer boutiques malls and cafes- our room overlooked the street; was great seeing the movements of people. There are loads of designer copies - handbags wallets- suitcases and many more. Everyone speaks French even the taxi driver very handy for those who are French speaking. The staff at the hotel were simply fantastic- one in particular- Abelatif- do look out for him- nothing is too much trouble- he certainly knows how to make you feel special- he served the Moroccan tea with a fine art. The morning buffet is very diverse with a mixture of the local food and pastries. Other Requests can also be made from the kitchen. We ate mostly out and throughly enjoyed the French cuisine as well as the Arabian food. Despite being over 35degrees then it was quite cool at the back in the shade. Good place to relax- the swimming was transparent which was something new for us. There is spa and Hammam treatment is something else. Small items were on sale in the entrance and at the reception which was on the next floor. One lift is used to go down from the reception only and others are to have access to rooms- takes some getting use to. Staff are good to give us tips of the cost of taxis beforehand so that we don‚Äôt pay tourist fare. From the airport it cost us 150 dirhams. Tips are your discretion. Busy roads and lots of people about. We visited some beautiful places - jardin marjorelle - a must see while in Marrakech. Food are not cheap in good restaurants but there are cafes which cater for all tastes.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Hotel_Name: Radisson Blu Hotel, Marrakech Carre Eden
Review_Text: From entering hotel you were treated like family  the rooms were great size and had tv with a few English speaking channels and great shower with freebies shampoo  shower gel etc .  Good comfy bed so had great nights sleep .  Breakfast has a pretty good choice with omelette station very nice .  All the staff were very friendly  polite and some spoke great English .  If you can speak a bit of French it helps with the rest of the staff .  All in all a great hotel in a great location .  Only downside carpet in our room could do with renewal but that wouldn‚Äôt put me off as everything else makes up for it .

Hotel_Name: Radisson Blu Hotel, Marrakech Carre Eden
Review_Text: Great rooms great service amazing bathrooms with tropical showers amazing breakfast (though a bit full crowded and noisy). Spl thanks to D Mohammed and Rashid for help and hospitality. Excellent location in new Marrakesch not too far from old town

Hotel_Name: Radisson Blu Hotel, Marrakech Carre Eden
Review_Text: Good hotel with a good location as well  Receptionist very polite and attentive to our needs  Clean property  Good size for the bed with a large shower  Thanks for the little attention as a member of the radisson group really appreciated!!!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Hotel_Name: Radisson Blu Hotel, Marrakech Carre Eden
Review_Text: We went for a 10-day break for Christmas and new year.  We had booked the premium room because it offers more space for 3 people.  The reception ( in the middle of the night) was just perfect. They instantly organized a third bed for our daughter. The pool is just great. A very attentive life-guard is on duty without disturbing the fun with too much rules etc. The whole hotel is an ideal mix of high-level and family hotel.The F&B staff is professional and very friendly. I HAVE to mention 2 names of people who gave us the best experience: Younes and Shakiza. These guys are the best!!!

Hotel_Name: Radisson Blu Hotel, Marrakech Carre Eden
Review_Text: Our rooms were comfortable staff are honest (we paid euros instead of dirhams once and they brought it to our attention) courteous and attentive. Kids liked the pool. Massage at the spa was not great. The fitness center was nice. The restaurant surprisingly does not have vegetarian or vegan choices. The common areas appear a little tacky and could have been decorated more tastefully especially considering that pricing was similar to the Sofitel and other higher end hotels - the rooms were over USD 300. Smoking is allowed indoors in the bar area (and outside of course). The location (Gueliz) was safe but not as ritzy as Hivernage - that area was our first choice but it was fully booked and we came back wishing we had gotten to stay at our first choice.More

Hotel_Name: Radisson Blu Hotel, Marrakech Carre Eden
Review_Date: Jennifer H wrote a review Jan 2020
Review_Title: Great location and oasis in busy Marrakech
Review_Text: Spent 2 + 1 nights here as a part of a longer trip. The location was fantastic. Rooms were clean service great and amenities perfect. The pool was well maintained with fresh towels always at the ready. The gym was a pleasant surprise clean and well appointed with equipment. Lila (restaurant on property) provided an extensive and fabulous breakfast buffet a lovely lunch-by-the-pool menu (we were starving from travel when we arrived at lunchtime) and a lovely dinner. Only snags: 1. our quick turn around laundry was delivered to the wrong room (one floor below) but the gentleman who delivered it CAME BACK to the hotel and found it for us. 2. Our rooms were above the lively band so it was a bit loud in the evening. Ask for a room on floors 4 or 5 if this might be an issue. We were so tired it didn't matter. I would definitely stay here again.

Hotel_Name: Radisson Blu Hotel, Marrakech Carre Eden
Review_Date: Pepe Y wrote a review Jan 2020
Review_Text: My wife and I arrived on the 02/01 and we are not the harshest people - we understand that things can go wrong. Our first room had an issue with the bathroom and after further attention it wasn't fixable. Marouane who is the front reception manager pro-actively asked to meet me to apologise and the professionalism was exceptional. We were instantly moved to our new room and our stay was exceptional.    The location was convenient for all the sights and the staff was friendly giving us some useful tips e.g. how much general taxi fares should cost (saved us a fortune!).    The food was also exceptional. Breakfast had a variety of options and the lunch by the terrace was a great experience.    5 stars from me!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Hotel_Name: Radisson Blu Hotel, Marrakech Carre Eden
Review_Text: Great hotel. Wonderful location. Only issue was A/C. Staff very quick to respond Pool was well maintained. Morning breakfast was fantastic. Accommodated our GF and Vegan requests easily. Staff was very responsive & friendly

Hotel_Name: Radisson Blu Hotel, Marrakech Carre Eden
Review_Date: Ram Raghavan wrote a review Jan 2020
Review_Title: Great location, excellent room, service was a hit and miss
Review_Text: Stayed at the property for 4 nights including new year.    The location is brilliant. You are walking distance to restaurants as well as the M√©dina (it‚Äôs about a kilometre away).    We booked a junior suite as we had two kids and it was more than adequate for our needs. Only issue was that the aircon didn‚Äôt work in one of the rooms (it didn‚Äôt matter because it was winter so we were fine)    From a service POV we had some brilliant experiences to some very average ones. Given the price we were paying and the brand I would expect consistency on this.

Hotel_Name: Radisson Blu Hotel, Marrakech Carre Eden
Review_Date: Frank M wrote a review Jan 2020
Review_Text: Some aspects of the service were a bit hit and miss but sometimes was exceptional. It's only 7 km from the airport (ca. 20 minutes by car). A taxi should cost about 70 dirhams (7 Euro) but not more than 10 Euro. Immediately upon arrival we were conned into paying 20 Euro. Our introduction to the most popular local habit of ripping off tourists. One of the main advantages of this hotel is that it is on a main road. There is almost always a normal taxi waiting out front so no need to plan ahead. Many are less accessible that really expose you to inconvenience at best and personal risk at worst. Linked to the main square & the Yves St Laurent Museum each within- 30 minutes walk. Currency is exchanged without commission at normal bank rates & without the additional transaction charge levied by machines. The hotel is comfortable. We slept well & were pleased with all room facilities - safe iron power sockets tea/coffee/hot chocolate & toiletries. The bedding was changed every second day and the cleaning was generally thorough. The lifts can be annoyingly slow. Reception is on floor 2 (third level - US). One lift only goes to reception & some lifts do not go to the ground floor. The breakfast has a wide enough offer for all tastes and is supported by an army of waiters. The bar menu has oysters for 12 Euro per dozen. Christmas dinner was 35 Euro -OK for 3 courses plus champagne. The outside pool is a decent size and the water warm. The gym is also well equipped although the TV and internet on the running machines were not operational. The wi-fi worked but not that well but there is a general lack of bandwidth everywhere we visited in Marrakech. Responses are often slow - both in the dining room bar and when phoning reception. During our second week we started to get pleasant surprises - cookies & sweets in the evening & bathrobes and slippers appeared. So is this normal or had it been overlooked previously? The hotel boasts a large footprint but this consists of rooms that surround a central pool. Menu prices were very reasonable. However trips and transportation if arranged by the hotel are expensive. there are better deals to be got. Plenty of tours will pick you up from the hotel - we visited the Atlas mountains including 30 mins camel ride for ca. 30 Euro. The hotel is not cheap but this is the price of decent accommodation and for those who appreciate certain standards it is well worth it. Bear in mind there will be a small surprise at bill time since local taxes (80 Euro for12 nights) are added on at that point -despite having paid in advance. This is normal nowadays but it really should be transparent at the time of booking.

Hotel_Name: Radisson Blu Hotel, Marrakech Carre Eden
Review_Date: Farah P wrote a review Dec 2019
Review_Text: Lovely hotel and staff. Went with our two young boys and they loved it too. A special mention to some of the amazing staff members- Mohammed Latif at the breakfast buffet went beyond for our son ensuring he had his hot chocolate each morning. Ilyas at reception was extremely professional Ehsam and Abdul Aziz at the door. Highly recommend this hotel!

Hotel_Name: Radisson Blu Hotel, Marrakech Carre Eden
Review_Date: A J wrote a review Dec 2019
Review_Text: The hotel was lovely and the staff were so great. It was my partner‚Äôs birthday and they upgraded our room delivered fresh flowers laid rose petals on the bed and welcomed us with a selection of desserts and Moroccan pastries. I couldn‚Äôt recommend them enough as their hospitality is amazing! There was also live music regularly playing at the bar and Moroccan tea served in the lobby both lovely touches. The hotel is well located with a mall taxi rank and cafes nearby.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Hotel_Name: Radisson Blu Hotel, Marrakech Carre Eden
Review_Date: Aso Ali Ahmad wrote a review Dec 2019
Review_Text: I stayed for 4 night with my friend & very friendly staff the rooms are clean location the pool area is great and nice everything perfectly the rooms are big and comfortable clean definitely will come back again

Hotel_Name: Radisson Blu Hotel, Marrakech Carre Eden
Review_Date: Joseph B wrote a review Dec 2019
Review_Title: Beautiful hotel in centre of town
Review_Text: Radisson Blu is a 5 star hotel on the main street in the centre of Marrakesh next to a shopping centre and within easy reach of major attractions.  It has a gym that is larger and better equipped tan msny hotel gyms.  Rooms are large well equipped very comfortable.    A personal experience. The night before leaving I found the safe in our room wouldn't open I had our passports and credit cards in it.  During the night I couldn't sleep knowing we had to leave early and what would happen if it still wouldn't open.    So at 2.15 a.m I called Room Service. Up came Badr who tried for about 20 minutes with his codes to open it. No success.  He then called his colleague Walid who came with tools and at 3 a.m opened it.    All this time my wife was sleeping through this. The staff were most courtious and eventually efficient.    I cannot praise highly enough the effort and decency of these people which reflects so well on the hotel.

Hotel_Name: Radisson Blu Hotel, Marrakech Carre Eden
Review_Text: As far as burgers can be memorable this one was. Not a guest at the hotel but a place I always enjoy coming back to. At 110 dh for the burger and 50 dh for a pleasant glass of Moroccan red wine the premium paid for the location service atmosphere view and quality of food is hardly excessive. Worth visiting again.

Hotel_Name: Radisson Blu Hotel, Marrakech Carre Eden
Review_Date: Happy Jerusalemite wrote a review Dec 2019
Review_Title: Extremely comfortable and well appointed. Well located in newer city. Good breakfast.
Review_Text: The room faced other buildings which was fine since the front faced a busy thoroughfare. The room was very well appointed and comfortable with a comfortable bed kettle for tea with tea selections and a good shower though I found having the sink in the room and separate compartments for toilet and shower to be strange. The breakfast space was pleasant and the selection of foods extremely broad. As a group we were granted a good meeting room. Everyone was very helpful. The only criticism: it was a modern hotel that could have been anywhere in the world.

Hotel_Name: Radisson Blu Hotel, Marrakech Carre Eden
Review_Date: Abdessamad B wrote a review Nov 2019
Review_Text: Excellent and professional service with that little extra that make you feel special and welcome. Nice person working here and his name is Noufal and he is working in the restaurant and bar. He is always greeting you with a smile and asking if we need something.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Hotel_Name: Radisson Blu Hotel, Marrakech Carre Eden
Review_Title: Great hotel in a very good location
Review_Text: If you are looking to be in the city that is the hotel you have to go to for a weekend gateway!  The hotel is located in Gueliz next to the shops restaurants etc. You are close to everything and we did not have to use any transportation during 2 days!

Hotel_Name: Radisson Blu Hotel, Marrakech Carre Eden
Review_Text: We had a great stay here and hope to return one day. Despite the hotel being very busy the staff were able to remain calm and respond to questions and requests quickly. A special thanks to Marouane who was extremely helpful and welcoming.

Hotel_Name: Radisson Blu Hotel, Marrakech Carre Eden
Review_Text: We had a lovely holiday in the hotel. The rooms are spacious and well furnished moreover the staff was helpfulfriendly and efficient.the food was excellent with a large variety.the bar cocktails and atmosphere were exceptional we loved it We would definitely come back again.

Hotel_Name: Radisson Blu Hotel, Marrakech Carre Eden
Review_Text: Arrived at the radisson in the middle of the hustle bustle of gueliz. When checking in we were told that we had a free room upgrade which was amazing. The suite was a really good size and had a balcony as well. The facilities were very good. They had the basics of WiFi good shower and a comfy bed. The breakfast was ok they actually had bacon. It was buffet and the hot food was quite similar each morning. The bar was nice but a little pricey. The staff were all friendly and professional. Would recommend if keen to have a more luxurious stay in Marrakech.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Hotel_Name: Radisson Blu Hotel, Marrakech Carre Eden
Review_Date: Johan T wrote a review Nov 2019
Review_Text: Stayed for a week. It's location is great and you have a huge amount of great rest around the area. Staff is happy and friendly. Was not crowded around the pool which was nice. A little better service attention around the pool would be good.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Hotel_Name: Radisson Blu Hotel, Marrakech Carre Eden
Review_Text: City is fun and this hotel is acceptable oasis but it more like a 3.5 star hotel.  - Room safe did not work no power  - Telephone handset did not work (until I plugged and plugged it back in)  - Shower glass door makes hideous cracking glass sound every time its opened  - Room smelled musty  - Some towels smelled strongly of vinegar  - Ran out of bowls at breakfast (I used coffee mugs for my cereal)  - Even at 10:15AM already out of towels at the pool  - Hotel driver (cost is over 4x as much as taxi would cost) let me off in the middle of the airport parking lot instead of near the gate. Told me to walk  -No hotel robe despite may people using the pool (Also I would think in Muslim country they could make it easy for you to cover up)  - No in room slippers (minor)  - Reception always crowded

Hotel_Name: Radisson Blu Hotel, Marrakech Carre Eden
Review_Text: We had a good experience at the radisson blue care eden. I would not give 5star for the hotel as nobody could take our laugged upon arrival and when we asked if they could take it from our room downstairs the answer was no you have to bring it.    Breakfast was great. Housekeeping did always a great job but our food went missing sometimes and they knock very earlier around 8 o'clock for room service.. ?  Medi on guestrelation explained everything about Marrakech which helped us. The pilates teacher was great. The pool was very clean. The location is amazing!!    Abdellatif made our stay very special. Every morning he made us laugh and extra care during our stay. Just because of him we would come back. As he showed us 5 star experience.!

Hotel_Name: Radisson Blu Hotel, Marrakech Carre Eden
Review_Text: We stayed for 4 days. The rooms were modern clean and comfortable. The hotel was close to all major attractions. We walked tot he M√©dina and other historic and significant landmarks. The outdoor pool was perfect even late in the season.

Hotel_Name: Radisson Blu Hotel, Marrakech Carre Eden
Review_Date: Qamar M wrote a review Oct 2019
Review_Text: although claimed to be a five-star hotel it is definitely not the one according to European or International standards. The airconditioning works at its minimum the rooms are not properly maintained (missing sink nozzle) extremely shabby lobby area swimming pool gives a glass bathtub look etc. it is not exactly close to the main happening centre of Marrakech. there are a couple of better options available.  breakfast served was very really good as it contained a lot of local food however the coffee served is an instant coffee. generally good but not outstanding as few other five-stars hotel in Marrakech

Hotel_Name: Radisson Blu Hotel, Marrakech Carre Eden
Review_Text: property nice atmosphere in the city center. close to market shops and medina. we enjoyed square and monuments. we liked also our trip to ourika and find morocco a wonderful country and poeple are friendly. staff is able to provide good service and friendly

Hotel_Name: Radisson Blu Hotel, Marrakech Carre Eden
