Review_Date: N F wrote a review Oct 2019
Review_Text: The location of the hotel is really great and the rooms and other areas are well kept and clean. The breakfast buffet is varied and what you would expect from this kind of hotel class.  Sadly the service was very disappointing. Staff are extremely friendly and courteous but not at all attentive. We would often have to ask specifically for obvious things like fresh cutlery for our meals or for them to clean up the legacies from other guests.  In the evenings we would have to ask several times to order drinks on the patio and waiting times were long.  It's not that they are understaffed but the employees just don't seem to be trained that well.  For a five star establishment and these rates I would have expected more.

Hotel_Name: Radisson Blu Hotel, Marrakech Carre Eden
Review_Date: MEHTA DEVAN wrote a review Oct 2019
Review_Text: I decided me and my girlfriend to have a unique stay in Marrakech the reason why we picked up Radisson blu as a place to stay recommended by our friend so we set up October as date of travelling.  To be honest Upon arrival to hotel everything was so smooth staff in this hotel were very helpful we had a very nice room 4072 the breakfast was good as well.  We had a first trip to atlas mountains the trip was so amazing starting from our driver was a very nice gentlemen helpful and very friendly with us all the trip thanks to this wonderful experience we decided to book another trip so we had a city tour that was booked by hotel guest relations but unfortunately the tour was not as we expected first a very old van was there to pick us up and the guide had a very bad English just like as his first experience we supposed to see many monuments as we were told the bahia palace the sedians tombs koutoubia mosque and square the only thing that we had was 40 minutes in bahia palace and a quick stop in Koutoubia mosque and rest was in the medina and souks I think the guide was concentrated on the souks more than historical visit.  When you pay 150 euros for a city visit you supposed to have a very good experience but with regrets we had nothing when we came back to hotel to complain this to guest relations the guy told us I will check this matter and till now nothing.

Hotel_Name: Radisson Blu Hotel, Marrakech Carre Eden
Review_Text: Had to wait hour for roomwas told it was an upgrade room 3001.reported dried blood on bathroom wallhad to tell reception twiceoutdoor 2 seater uncomfortable had to use pillow to sit on itbedroom carpet stained and mark's on walls.realised I had left property in room after I got back homehave e-mailed hotel twice now without a reply.

Hotel_Name: Radisson Blu Hotel, Marrakech Carre Eden
Review_Date: Ahmed A wrote a review Oct 2019
Review_Title: great location with great value of money
Review_Text: this hotel is the my favorite one and i wouy come again . clean room with great veiw to the swimming pool and hot tub. the breakfast is awesome and the room has a balcony if you are smoking . GYM is quite good üëå

Hotel_Name: Radisson Blu Hotel, Marrakech Carre Eden
Review_Text: I would like to thank all the team at the Radisson Hotel of Marrakesh for their warm professional and awesome services that they did offered to both of us for 4 days and night in sept 2019. From the great perfect room bed all the amenities nice pool great terrace and garden to relax before or after discovering Marrakesh. The FOOD was so delicious well prepared and displayed for breakfast. I kept talking about this experience with many of my friends since we came back. Also I had a moment that I left my precious hat at the pool and I realized the day after and I asked for help and Mr Rida Laachari Food and Beverages Manager was extremely professional and pleasant. He founded my hat after looking at their security camera and did the delivery to my room. When we came from our excursion he was smiling and explaining about his investigation to find my hat. Every day he kept asking us if we need more assistance or request and I even pushed my luck to ask him about their famous little cookies next to the Check In services‚Ä¶! Not only he shared the recipe of them he also introduced me to the chef pastry they delivered me a small well wrap box of these precious treats. Anyhow this hotel location and their team was an extreme pleasant experience for both us.  THANK YOU/ MERCI!!/SCHUKRAN

Hotel_Name: Radisson Blu Hotel, Marrakech Carre Eden
Review_Text: I booked the hotel through Agoda because on the websites of the hotel the price was much higher.  One day prior to arrival i sent an email with my RR gold membership number.  I got a confirmation.  At check in the staff wasn't able to see my status and wasn't interested in searching. He said we can check at check out.  I got my room.  3075.  Nice but small room. Bathroom included in the rooms.  Shower smell like toilet at arrival.  No welcoming gift for gold members.    Later i went again to front desk and asked for late check out and benefits at the hotel for gold members.  The same staff from check in was very surprised that i am a gold member and my membership number was not added to my booking at that times.  He added it and told me about the benefits 15% discount on food and beverages.  Late check out was not available because of the reservation for the next day.    There is no turn down service at the room.  Till departure i missed my gift as a gold member.    The discount was not given because we drink alcohol and eat dessert. That's no food and beverages.    Breakfast looks nice but its a horrible choice.  More salad and fruits sweets and stuff.  No plates for coffee cups coffee in self service.    The entrance to car park is not clearly marked later the parking for hotel guests is also not clear.  Staff at basement is very friendly.    The situation for using lifts is horrible  some go just between ground floor and lobby one only for parking.  Long time to wait to get a lift.    Staff at lila is not very attentive.  Wait that you call them. The job of waiters are to take my money in a nice way not wait that i asked them to spent money.    In all the years i stayed in 5 stars hotel this hotel just get 3 of 5 stars from me.  A huge disappointment.    And for me no recommendations if you want to stay in Marrakesch.  There are much better options for half price.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Hotel_Name: Radisson Blu Hotel, Marrakech Carre Eden
Review_Text: We arrived at 2:00 a.m.& the staff was exceptionally helpful as they helped us settle into our roomüåü The outdoor area of this property is Lovely & the spa is conveniently located by the pool area. The breakfast buffet was a beautiful presentation - something for every desireüëç This hotel location is EXCELLENTüòé

Hotel_Name: Radisson Blu Hotel, Marrakech Carre Eden
Review_Date: Tinka B wrote a review Oct 2019
Review_Text: I booked at the Radisson Blue after spending one night at the terrible riad Harmonie. I must mention that the staff were excellent there was a huge variety of food for breakfast and my whole experience in general was fabulous!    Thank you for being simply amazing!

Hotel_Name: Radisson Blu Hotel, Marrakech Carre Eden
Review_Text: Room is well designed and modern - everything seems to be in the right place. Very comfortable bed and love the long office table. Gym is particularly good in terms of the equipment. Services on balance are good though not outstanding.

Hotel_Name: Radisson Blu Hotel, Marrakech Carre Eden
Review_Title: A good choice away from the Medina
Review_Text: We really enjoyed this hotel only a mile from the old town and Gueliz has a lot of good restaurants and bars nearby. Outside the hotel it's frenetic but inside it's quiet and calm a real haven away from the madness of the Medina. It's not historic or decorated like a palace but on the other hand it has all the facilities including a nice pool area which is unusual for a city hotel. Staff were really nice and helpful too.  Note to management though - you really do need to repair those loose tiles on the bottom of the pool that's a safety hazard.

Hotel_Name: Radisson Blu Hotel, Marrakech Carre Eden
Review_Text: This hotel is in a great location  has a lovely pool  food is pretty good and rooms are nice. The staff do their best.  Reason they get 4 not 5 is that the check in was messy and confused and they need to focus on detail of when rooms are cleaned and ready and match names of guests.

Hotel_Name: Radisson Blu Hotel, Marrakech Carre Eden
Review_Text: I've stayed in several hotels in Marrakech. The Radisson Blue is definitely one of my favorites. It's in a great location has fantastic restaurants a fun bar scene and modern rooms. The staff have always been warm and friendly. Even the small things are done right - good water pressure in the shower complementary water good wifi speeds. The Radisson Blue works for me - works exceptionally well.

Hotel_Name: Radisson Blu Hotel, Marrakech Carre Eden
Review_Date: Gail Goldman wrote a review Oct 2019
Review_Text: A hotel can have a beautiful room in a great location but if there is danger in the room stay away. The geniuses who constructed the shower in the bathroom with open areas from the shower stall to the marble bathroom floor should have been fired. There are no bathtubs here as we requested so we were stuck with a large showering stall and a hand shower or a rainforest head. Either way if the water comes out of the open area to the bathroom floor you have a very dangerous situation. We were not the only ones who had this happen in our group and all were very alarmed. People almost on the slippery floors. One day the housekeeping staff did not even leave a bathroom mat and our floor was bare.  The other problem was that there was no climate control in our room. When we turned off the freezing AC it just kept going. One night we got it off and then the room was suffocating. Yes we called for help a couple of times and they could not adjust the temperature either. What a mess.  Forget the veneer of this hotel and think about the safety and comfort.

Hotel_Name: Radisson Blu Hotel, Marrakech Carre Eden
Review_Date: Colin G wrote a review Oct 2019
Review_Text: A group tour but we were lucky enough to get one of the best rooms - large and overlooking the pool. Good facilities within immediate reach including Carrefour Market in shopping complex below and (just) within easy walking distance of the Medina. Very clean with excellent housekeeping service. Friendly and attentive staff. Meals very good - European prices.

Hotel_Name: Radisson Blu Hotel, Marrakech Carre Eden
Review_Title: Convenient and good place for tourists,
Review_Text: I stayed here a few nights to visit Marrakech and found it very convenient. First off city hop on/off bus stop is right outside in front of the Starbucks next door. Hotel is also sandwiched between two entrances to Carre Eden which has a supermarket in the basement where you can stock up on the bottles of water you‚Äôll need for a day of sightseeing.    While the hotel staff is very friendly and welcoming hotel furnishings seemed a bit worn and there were some unpainted spots throughout my room and the hotel. My room was on the 3rd floor and there seemed to be incessant banging noises in the early afternoons. Breakfast was included (although it was not mentioned during my check in and I had to confirm that it was part of my stay) and it was a decent breakfast with plenty of options. I suggest scoping out a table outside for fresh cool air as it‚Äôs also right next to the pool. Lunch was a miss as a few items I wanted to test from the menu were ‚Äúnot available.‚Äù    Overal 3 stars as it was a decent place to camp out and convenient for my purposes.

Hotel_Name: Radisson Blu Hotel, Marrakech Carre Eden
Review_Text: Radisson Blu Carre Eden Marrakesh is no doubt one of my favourite hotel now. The location of the hotel is very perfect and the rooms are very comfortable and spacious with fast internet good aircon. It has a shopping mall just below it so you don‚Äôt have to worry if you have forgot to pack any stuff. The staff of the hotel is very nice and helpful. They‚Äôre very friendly and very helpful especially Kam√®lia the Guest Relation Manager she really takes her job seriously and helps the guests in her best possible way. Being a vegan it is very difficult find a restaurant in Morocco that understands vegan concept but she managed to find me a restaurant near the hotel. Also did she helped me book my train tickets to Casablanca and guided me through the process. The hotel has a 24 x 7 money exchange at the reception which gives you a very fair rate for USD to MAD. I think the hotel should have more options for vegetarian in their food menu and for the breakfast of course.  I had booked the room pool side which has the view to this very nice courtyard with a see through pool where you can enjoy your breakfast or some drinks. The atmosphere is so special that it really felt like home to me. All respect for Kam√®lia who does a great job here; a true sample of excellent hospitality.

Hotel_Name: Radisson Blu Hotel, Marrakech Carre Eden
Review_Text: In depth breakdown of my review as follows:    (You can type: Angela Nakiyingi Marrakesh travel vlogs on YouTube to see snippets of hotel)    LOCATION: Perfect! So many shops and restaurants around. 30 minute walk /10 minute drive to Medina. Little mall 2 minutes away with supermarket downstairs that closes late. Many currency exchange places available which was handy.    PRICE: Very affordable we booked on on the beach website. ¬£250 each for 4 nights & bed and breakfast- cheaper than booking direct.    STAFF: Very friendly and attentive. A bit slow when we went down for a spontaneous dinner. We got upgraded to a pool view balcony room but had to wait 2 hours to check in.    We were also asked to pay a ¬£400 pound deposit which we had not been made aware of prior. Unfortunately we decided not to pay and reassured we wouldn't use the bar tab or fridge contents in our room. Overall nice staff.    CLEANLINESS: I'm very particular when it comes to cleanliness. The hotel room was cleaned every day we were there. I have no issues at all about it.    DINNER FOOD: The dinner from the menu was absolutely tasty! It was presented very nicely with nice flavours. We had a burger and a Wrap. I really wanted to try the Tagine but it was 220 Dirhams which is approximately ¬£20- too expensive! I can tell that the Tagine would taste out of this world.    BREAKFAST FOOD: Mediocre at least. Nothing in the breakfast buffet was nice to my tastebuds. There is the option of fresh Omlette. The lady didn't cook it well so it was a bit runny. Drinks weren't special either. We only had breakfast once out of the 4 nights and decided to eat elsewhere-waste of money    OVERALL THOUGHTS: It's labelled 5* but I didn't really see a 'wow factor'. It was comfortable and a nice stay overall. If I am to return to Marrakech I'll probably stay in a better 5* hotel. Lovely staff pool and dinner.    RATING out of 5: 4/5
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Hotel_Name: Radisson Blu Hotel, Marrakech Carre Eden
Review_Date: Mr D wrote a review Sep 2019
Review_Text: Fantastic 7 night stay at the Radisson Blu.  The rooms are of a decent standard and reflect a 5 Star hotel which sometimes isn‚Äôt the case in some hotels in Marrakech.  I couldn‚Äôt fault any part of my stay and would definitely stay here again.

Hotel_Name: Radisson Blu Hotel, Marrakech Carre Eden
Review_Title: Pretty good oasis for a tired traveler
Review_Text: This centrally locaed hotel is good - not outstanding - and offers some good amenities particularly a lovely courtyard with a swimming pool and sitting area where one can enjoy a leisurely breakfast coffee or cocktail. The rooms are not particularly spacious but they are modern clean and comfortable but the washroom facilities are in the bedroom and the sink is much too shallow and the mirrors are poorly located hard to use. The corridors for accessing the guest rooms are much too long and one can have to walk two city blocks' distance to get from the elevator to the farthest rooms. Overall however the hotel has much to offer.

Hotel_Name: Radisson Blu Hotel, Marrakech Carre Eden
Review_Date: Amy G wrote a review Sep 2019
Review_Text: We loved it here. We stayed for 5 nights in September and firstly the pool is great - in the sun for majority of the day and can always get a sun lounger (even though there‚Äôs only about 30 in total).  Very annoyingly people did leave things on the beds for hours when they weren‚Äôt there and nothing was moved. Other than that pool is great.  Rooms are spacious clean comfy beds.  Reception staff always keen to help.  Breakfast hot selection isn‚Äôt great. Plenty of cold options but a lot of salads and breads etc.  Perfect location short taxi ride to most places 20 minutes from the airport and a 30 second walk from carre Eden shopping centre.  All in all we really enjoyed our stay.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Hotel_Name: Radisson Blu Hotel, Marrakech Carre Eden
Review_Date: Sandie L wrote a review Sep 2019
Review_Text: I am a travel agent and came to stay with my friends. Great location and very hospitable staff. The managers were great and couldn‚Äôt do enough for us.  Rooms were very trendy and spacious.  Provided an extra bed where needed and water bottles everyday.  My friends loved the stay there and I would recommend to all my clients. The breakfast was good lots of varieties.    Thanks  Sandie  HolidayPA

Hotel_Name: Radisson Blu Hotel, Marrakech Carre Eden
Review_Text: We visited beautiful Marrakech for the first time and chose the Radisson Blu Hotel to stay for the first few nights. The room was big and comfortable. The pool was refreshing to swim in under the blazing sun. Customer service was excellent. In particular Zohair at the reception was exceptionally helpful and polite. His friendliness made our stay extra special.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Hotel_Name: Radisson Blu Hotel, Marrakech Carre Eden
Review_Text: I stayed here with my family. It is located above Carre Eden shopping centre. Plenty of shops and restaurants outside and a food court in the shopping centre. Excellent staff who are very helpful from the moment you enter the hotel.    The deluxe rooms are large and spacious with high quality bedding. There is a toilet room shower room and the wash basin is just outside. This was a bit annoying. I would suggest that you get a pool side room.    The rooms and hotel grounds are kept in excellent condition. However the pool was showing its age with a few broken tiles but don‚Äôt let that put you off. Service from the pool attendant was excellent. The breakfast was good with plenty of choice. However eating at the hotel can be quite expensive. The spa facility is clean and hygienic - so we did not bother going anywhere else.    By European standards the hotel is only a 4 star. Overall we had a good experience at this hotel and would highly recommend it and would not hesitate to return.

Hotel_Name: Radisson Blu Hotel, Marrakech Carre Eden
Review_Text: After the bad experience at another hotel we checked into the Radisson Blu hotel. The staff member Emman was amazing and helpful. He assisted us with the best available rate. The reception team upon arrival even acommodated us to check in early and we had poolside view in our room. The staff at breakfast were always friendly and kind. The breakfast is a bit limited and one particular female staff member at reception rolled her eyes whilst assisting us and perhaps she needs to understand how body language in particular eye rolling is not considered professional. I will definitely book at this hotel again.

Hotel_Name: Radisson Blu Hotel, Marrakech Carre Eden
Review_Date: Bert M wrote a review Sep 2019
Review_Text: Was there for 1week. Close to airport with taxi 15 minutes drive. Location is in the trendy Gueliz district. Close to a lot of nice restaurants shopping mall Starbucks banks...  Very friendly staff especially the pool boy who is extremely helpful ! Breakfast is very good lot of choice sitting inside is a little dark. Rooms are spacious and are not small at all. Only negative point is that there is only 1 seat on the outside terrace...  The only point I was disappointed was the price of a mint tea in the evening 50 Dirham or about ‚Ç¨5 at the cafe at the corner it costs only 20 Dirham or ‚Ç¨2 !!!  Overall a very positive experience in the lovely Marrakech !

Hotel_Name: Radisson Blu Hotel, Marrakech Carre Eden
Review_Text: After our Sahara desert tour we feel like staying at a decent hotel and Radisson Blu didn‚Äôt disappoint! The hotel is rather new and design very chic love the room (although flushing didn‚Äôt work the first night...) and front desk Assim is fun and helpful your staff really added a personal touch well done!

Hotel_Name: Radisson Blu Hotel, Marrakech Carre Eden
Review_Text: Stayed in the hotel for 3 nights. A little bit of paradise. Perfect location. Close to airport shops and restaurants. 20 minute walk to the M√©dina.  Amazing food. Staff were very helpful. A big thank you to Abellatif who went over and above to make our stay extra special. Thank you üòä
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Hotel_Name: Radisson Blu Hotel, Marrakech Carre Eden
Review_Text: Stayed at the Radisson for 4 nights I would highly recommend the hotel. Great location (around a 20 minute walk/short taxi ride to the Medina) lots of shops & restaurants around & excellent concierge/security on the hotel. Especially would like to mention the receptionist Aissam amazing at his job & very helpful. Rooms are a great size & very good facilities. Only downfall to the hotel was the pool which needs a re furb as the tiles were falling off underneath.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Hotel_Name: Radisson Blu Hotel, Marrakech Carre Eden
Review_Text: Ok hotel in a great location! So many local interesting eateries around it. Under it is a mall below the mall is a huge supermarket. 5 star hotel but luxe factor is missing. It felt like it was just a 4 star hotel.

Hotel_Name: Radisson Blu Hotel, Marrakech Carre Eden
Review_Date: Mrs Bawa wrote a review Aug 2019
Review_Title: A good stay with some lovely staff customer service
Review_Text: My family and I stayed for a week during mid-August. The hotel itself was nice however the rooms could do with a deep-clean. I think the 4/5* that Europeans expect for the price they pay isn't exactly on par with what is offered in all countries. Having said that there were some wonderful staff members who went above and beyond to make our stay comfortable. This included Rashid who helped us to settle in and was always very friendly with our family. He really did fulfil the service that should be expected when paying 5* prices.  I do feel though that the breakfast needs updating. It was a tad too ethnic/local for us who have a slightly different palette for breakfast. Toast/ English breakfast etc would be useful going forward.

Hotel_Name: Radisson Blu Hotel, Marrakech Carre Eden
Review_Text: Just finished our stay in Radisson Blu Carre Eden and overall it was a comfortable stay however it did not meet my expectations.    Pros / things that impressed me:  Staff are attentive  Lovely location  Nice rooms overlooking the pool and terrace area  Clean hotel    Cons / things that disappointed me:  Very small reception  Faulty lights which took 3 phone calls to sort out along with a tripped fuse  During our stay there was a business party who had booked as well. For 3 nights they had parties and discos till 1am which was not ideal when overlooking the area. The balconies were nice however still a lot of noise from the loud music and singing.  I did feel they were prioritising one group of guests over the majority other. There was no prior warning or notice.  Breakfast was very standard and repetitive every day with no variety at all.  The coffee machine kept serving hot chocolate when pressing for Coffee which was rather annoying.    Overall 3/5  Would stay elsewhere next time unless I only wanted the Gueliz area with access to some restaurants locally.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Hotel_Name: Radisson Blu Hotel, Marrakech Carre Eden
Review_Text: The rooms are nice decent size clean comfy and modern - the bathroom was huge with a double size walk in shower. Small balcony area over looking the pool.  The hotel is connected to a shopping mall next door which came in handy for me.  Short taxi to the souks.  Breakfast was really nice  Great stay

Hotel_Name: Radisson Blu Hotel, Marrakech Carre Eden
Review_Text: Amazing stay with my girlfriend. Good service and staff very professional at front desk. Mehdi at guest relation really very professional and friendly. Thanks to all I recommend this hotel to all for the service

Hotel_Name: Radisson Blu Hotel, Marrakech Carre Eden
Review_Text: The staff at this hotel is exceptionally friendly and professional. They were so nice to our kids who called One-Touch several times. The waiters at Lila were top-notch and we really enjoyed the great food and very clean environment. Also the singer with his guitar was talented - really enjoyed his music. Thanks guys!

Hotel_Name: Radisson Blu Hotel, Marrakech Carre Eden
Review_Text: We were walking passed and decided to stop by for some food. The staff were very slow to take orders or give us our food. I had asked for water 2 times and still never received any in the end. When asking for my bill we waited a very long having to also asked 3 times. staff looked as if they had nothing to do. But had to be asked many times for anything. Food wasn‚Äôt very nice either and would not recommend. Waiting was extremely long. Don‚Äôt think the staff even knew what they were doing. People who sat next to us came in whilst we just finished our food but yet they had received the bill and had left before we even had the change to get our bill after multiple times of asking.    My boyfriend had then walked up to pay as we desperately wanted to leave but the staff member had turned his back and walked away from the till. Will not be back due to extremely terrible service one of the worst experiences when going for food We‚Äôve ever had!!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Hotel_Name: Radisson Blu Hotel, Marrakech Carre Eden
Review_Text: I stayed in Radisson Blu hotel for business in March 2019. The hotel is really good with spacious rooms very clean and modern. The shared facilites like restaurants bars and all very good and the garden with the pool is top class. i reccomend it by far

Hotel_Name: Radisson Blu Hotel, Marrakech Carre Eden
Review_Title: Not as good as reviews would suggest
Review_Text: PROS: Super friendly and genuinely caring staff.  Hotel in excellent condition and located.  Rooms lovely and spacious. Breakfast juices and health drinks great. Good TV channel choices.Great clean irons an ironing boards.Great location. easy walking distance to old city straight down the road 15 mins. Great cafes restaurants and shopping in area. Modern hotel in excellent condition. Bedding OK    CONS: No face flannels only one bar of soap - where do I put it hand basin or shower??  AC unit in room only has temp control which isn't very sensitive. No fan control....it's cold colder or freezing. Minibar poorly stocked powerpoint are not standard european..you need adaptor from hotel. Not sure I'm a fan of open plan bathroom. Hotel full of holidaying and families....think noise and kid.s picking breakfast items up with bare hands and placing back. Have seen that each morning. Also it's not very relaxing for adults. Phone goes unanswered on each of the pre programmed 4/5 numbers.....very annoying I even called the emergency number and NO ANSWER...imagine I had needed medical assistance!.  Mini bar not restocked for 2 days. Toiletries rearranged without permission by housekeeping when clearly they have been set up by guest their way. Coffee and tea stocks not replaced for 2 days. Security is super tight you feel like you are in jail. It's way over the top. Someone at street level is all you need not someones at level 2 as well starring at you with a serious face all the time. It's a hotel not a bank we are here to enjoy our holiday not be given impression its so dangerous security is needed everywhere! Security cameras also everywhere. I really hated the over the top security here. Breakfast so so. No fresh berries no smoked salmon. Omelette station is a weird set up just on a table near a wall. Chefs are serious faced and never smile. Some breakfast tables not fully set up so you need to ask for sugar milk napkins. Food items and coffee removed when not finished! No slippers or robe in room. Pillows are terrible you'll need to place two under your hard for any support. Ordered room service burger medium to well - it came up half raw and uncooked! Fries were also stone cold (see pic). As with rest of middle east staff are amazingly helpful extraordinarily friendly and very eager to please. They just don't follow through and when guests aren't around their attention to detail and professionalism go out the window. I was disappointed the hotel tour manager refused to book shared tours for me. He insisted they only organised private tours at 3 x the price. I ended up booking what I had to on Viatour via internet. I was travelling alone so doing a private tour alone would have been boring. I've never encountered any hotel insisting they can only book private tours.    I wish trip advisor would sample hotels individually as I'm starting to find "certificates of excellence" mean very little based on personal experience thus taking away from the credibility of trip advisor and setting expectations for potential guests too high. I probably wouldn't stay here again.

Hotel_Name: Radisson Blu Hotel, Marrakech Carre Eden
Review_Text: Hotel is nicely situated in a busy area and road where one can easily walk or grab a taxi to the centre. The area is busy and surrounded by restaurants. There is also a shopping centre behind the hotel with a supermarket in it.  The rooms are quite nice they are relatively new comfortable and spacious. Bed is very comfy as well.  We used the pool and ate at the hotel restaurant. The pool is a really nice feature considering Marrakech's summer temperatures and the food in the restaurant is fair as well.  I would gladly stay here if I ever came back to Marrakech again.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Hotel_Name: Radisson Blu Hotel, Marrakech Carre Eden
Review_Date: Khulood B wrote a review Aug 2019
Review_Text: I stayed here for a week with my husband and 1 yr old son. The staff are so nice by the end of the trip they all knew my sons name. Rooms are clean and big. The buffet breakfast has a wide variety and mint tea was perfect! My only negative was the room i was it didn't have a separate bathroom and the sink was in the room. I'd advise if you have a child to make sure that it is separate only because he kept banging his head on the side of the sink and after a shower there was water on the floor. It isn't a major issue but just for the convenience would get a different room. The location really is good. There is valet parking too! Your close to everything! And the shopping market downstairs is a bonus. Thanks to all the staff that made it such a pleasant stay.

Hotel_Name: Radisson Blu Hotel, Marrakech Carre Eden
Review_Date: Tariq Khan wrote a review Aug 2019
Review_Text: Amazing Hotel located in the centre close to all amenities. Hotel facilities are exceptional and staff are fantastic especially Rida the Food & Beverage Manager who went out of his to satisfy us!  We stayed last summer too and the experience gets better every year.  Thank you to all at Radisson Blu Marrakesh.    Tariq Khan Bristol UK

Hotel_Name: Radisson Blu Hotel, Marrakech Carre Eden
Review_Text: Staying at the Radisson Blu was amazing. The staff were really friendly and constantly went above and beyond to ensure we had a good stay. It was located in the perfect position with night life and restaurants within walking distance. The hotel is also inside a shopping centre so have great options there also. The breakfast was beautiful and nice with freshly made egg omelettes on request and many other elements. The pool area is beautiful and enough sun beds for everyone. The rooms were cleaned everyday although fresh sheets and clean surfaces. The receptionist staff where really really nice. And most staff spoke English. The spa was beautiful and everything was perfect. All in all was a really good stay & would definitely be coming back there soon.

Hotel_Name: Radisson Blu Hotel, Marrakech Carre Eden
Review_Text: Both my wife and myself had a fantastic time at the Radisson Blu in Marrakech. We spent 10 nights there in July 2019 and had a ball. Great hotel all the staff are superb friendly helpful and nothing is too much trouble for them. Special word of gratitude for Faical at the pool gets you a deck chair towel umbrella drink food you name it Faical will sort it. Sometimes has to deal with difficult 'important' people lol but does so always smiling. Breakfast was perfect set you up for the day lovely omelettes fresh bread fruit and all the usuals. Friendly management I will watch the remainder of le tour with added interest üòÉ. All in all a thoroughly enjoyable experience thank you all.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Hotel_Name: Radisson Blu Hotel, Marrakech Carre Eden
Review_Date: Mr. Mansouri wrote a review Jul 2019
Review_Text: Such a 5 star hotel all around with a wonderful and luxurious design a great restaurant professional staff beautiful garden and lots of ambience with music live shows... in a word it‚Äôs THE BEST in Marrakesh Highly recommended!

Hotel_Name: Radisson Blu Hotel, Marrakech Carre Eden
Review_Text: Poolside amazing. Very clean and service by faical was brilliant. Stayed here many times and khalid at reception is brilliant. Also Fatima in reservations was brilliant and gave me a good deal. Will definitely return.

Hotel_Name: Radisson Blu Hotel, Marrakech Carre Eden
Review_Date: Nikola K wrote a review Jul 2019
Review_Text: Great time in great hotel. Everything was great especially breakfast and front office dep. I will be back and i will stay there every time i come in Marrakech. Hotel is also located in nice part of city and medina is just 5 min with taxi.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Hotel_Name: Radisson Blu Hotel, Marrakech Carre Eden
Review_Date: Ladan H wrote a review Jul 2019
Review_Text: The straff and the hotel is nice very central nice breakfast and an amazing service.  Special thanks to Khalid who helped us a lot.  Very easy to check in and check out. I recommend this place to everyone the lines to be close to city.

Hotel_Name: Radisson Blu Hotel, Marrakech Carre Eden
Review_Date: George X wrote a review Jul 2019
Review_Title: When staff makes the hotel experience great
Review_Text: The people/staff of the hotel were amazing. Always ready to assist helpfull and with a smile.  The location is very good close to the centre but not in it.  The facilities are great with a very good breakfast and large swimming pool

Hotel_Name: Radisson Blu Hotel, Marrakech Carre Eden
Review_Text: Stayed for a week during July 2019. Lovely hotel room overlooking the small pool. Great variety at breakfast and great location connected to the Carre Eden shopping centre. Cannot fault the staff always on hand with a special shout out for the Front Desk Manager Aaminah who has been extremely helpful and her colleague Khalid.

Hotel_Name: Radisson Blu Hotel, Marrakech Carre Eden
Review_Text: Perfect location as it is close to the heart of Marrakech and easily accessible. Extremely friendly and helpful staff that respond very quickly to your requests. Very clean facility with a beautiful pool area and nicely decorated rooms. Can only recommend it

Hotel_Name: Radisson Blu Hotel, Marrakech Carre Eden
Review_Text: This hotel was by far the most expensive on our trip to Morocco and the worst actually the only one we didn't like. When we checked in they neglected to bring up our luggage until we asked about it and even then my husband had to ask several times and go down to the lobby to get them to do it. The hotel room seemed to be designed only for what they must have thought was an attractive "modern" non-Moroccan appearance because the functionality was terrible. Every time we took a shower it flooded the bathroom floor. The light by the bed could only be turned off by a switch that was on a wall too far to reach while in bed. Things like that. The included breakfast was fine and the pool looked nice. We stayed there because it was close to someplace we had to be that evening but at the price we paid I had expected it to be a really nice place to stay.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Hotel_Name: Radisson Blu Hotel, Marrakech Carre Eden
Review_Text: The hotel is in a good location in Marrakech not far away from main attraction  Overall nice room design and bathroom.    However I was very disappointment with the safety of my belonging and the reaction to incident reporting.    Whenever I arrive to a hotel I pack my stuff and place it in a way that I know which goes where.    In the second day of my stay I placed my airpods in the desk assuming such hotel will take care of people belonging. surprisingly when I came back I did not find it.  I searched allover the room assuming that the house keeping misplaced it while they were cleaning. but unfortunately that was not the case.    I spoke with the reception requesting their investigation they informed the security department. They took my number upon check out but unfortunately nothing happen. Even no update about the incident not via email or phone.    While I was reporting the incident I also heard from other traveller that she also lost something from her belongings.    It is horrible to say that I was expecting more decent treatment or follow up in incident reporting. Note that I won't report it if im not so sure about it.    So Be Aware and keep all of your valuable/important belonging in the safe.    Overall I'm disappointed and did not expect such thing from 5 star hotel

Hotel_Name: Radisson Blu Hotel, Marrakech Carre Eden
Review_Text: stayed fri 5th jul -8th july 2019  We have previously visited morocco 4 times . This time i visited with my wife plus kids ( aged 8 & 11 ) for my mates wedding which was all night event on friday night.  Aftert the wedding we invited the married couple for sunday lunch ( i had seen photos and it looked good ).  Before my mate arrived i briefed the waiter .....re: newlyweds and showed him photos of the couple etc and gave him a good tip to bring a small cake out at the end....  We ordered food ( 3 mix grills plus lamb chops main plus a few mocktailsjuice etc  the cost of this was over 100euros.  the food was ok and similar in price to restaurants in manchester. drinks were average at 8euros for mocktail  After the food the waiter came with the cake with 4 other staff members and started singing happy birthday !!!!! how embarassing!!!. the newly weds thought it was our birthday and started singing along....we then told the waiter again that the celebration was a wedding not a birthday but it fell on deaf ears.....we didnt let this spoil things and laughed about it amongst ourselves.  When the bill came we noticed they had charged us 40eoros...YES 40 EUROS FOR THE SMALL CAKE. I WAS GOBSMACKED.....apparently it was 8e each !!!  not wanting to create a scene i paid the bill . in effect the cake( which was average ) had cost us more than 40euros because i had given the waiter a good tip earlier.    On the last day we asked reception how much a taxi would be to the airport...they said 150d/person = 600d= 60e  we declined their offer and took a taxi right outside for a total of 100d ....YES 100d.    It left me thinking that these hotels think that just because you are from the uk or europe they can charge what they like.....cmon Radisson show some class and customer service skills especially when people are celebrating things !!!!!  THIS SORT OF BEHAVIOUR LOSES CUSTOMERS  i would have given a better score had i not felt ripped off.    on a positive the room was clean and spacious and hotel had a good pool although not the biggest.

Hotel_Name: Radisson Blu Hotel, Marrakech Carre Eden
Review_Text: Very good and clean place  the room was big clean and calme  the view its just magnificent also a professional team is waiting for you  i really loved the stay and wish to come back very soon !  Amine EL YOUNOUSSI

Hotel_Name: Radisson Blu Hotel, Marrakech Carre Eden
Review_Text: Stayed there for 4 nights. From the outset it was a superb experience with wonderful staff in all areas. The hotel initially seems disappointing when you arrive at the front door but once you get to reception everything is perfect. Can‚Äôt wait to return
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Hotel_Name: Radisson Blu Hotel, Marrakech Carre Eden
Review_Date: RAH ‚Ä¢ B wrote a review Jun 2019
Review_Text: Radisson blu Marrakech:  Restaurant Lila:  Description: Worst dining experience best ambiance tho!  Review:  I went with my boyfriend to the bar at Lila there was no greetings no host no manager to welcome us literally no one who escorted us to the table.  We sat ourselves and took us ages to get the server attention... then a server noticed we were looking around and approached us with the menus and a smile after 20 minutes a waiter came to take our order then again we had to wait for too long to receive the drinks and there was no tapas at all.  It‚Äôs such a shame for such a city center hotel to have such a faulty service where they could be the best in town!  The best part of that place that made me stay for longer and make me come back when I‚Äôm back to Morocco is the band. I could tell it is the best show in Marrakech very talented and professional performers was there 2 times in a raw and there was different singers who were just perfect the lead guitar player was just incredible with the solos and presence on the stage with a great eye contact and smile with the audience great interaction with the guests and was even adapting to guests requests he should be the manager of that restaurant i think he could manage that restaurant even better than the director of food and beverage.  Again it is a shame to have such 2 bad experiences but you have an amazing band and lead guitar who makes it up for that place.  I will definitely come back on July with my boyfriend just for the band with no expectation for the service!  See you
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Hotel_Name: Radisson Blu Hotel, Marrakech Carre Eden
Review_Text: The hotel is situated at a very convenient location with popular chained cafe and fashion outlets nearby.    The hotel room we stayed is not in particular big but it has all the equipment a traveller needs including iron and iron board.    The room does not have a bath tub but the compact shower room is efficient.    The breakfast has a wide range of food as most of the 4/5 starred hotels offer. They are not in particular grand but are good enough to start a day.    The other thing this hotel needs to improve is the serving attitude of the staff. Of the 10 hotels we used in Morocco this one offered the worst service in particular the serving people are very mean with their smiles.

Hotel_Name: Radisson Blu Hotel, Marrakech Carre Eden
Review_Date: Joon H wrote a review Jun 2019
Review_Text: The hotel is located about 10 minutes taxi ride away from all the usual touristic locations so it's easy to get to from anywhere around the city.    Staff were friendly and everything was satisfactory. Breakfast was diverse and pretty good quality too. Unfortunately we went right at the opening so the omelette bar wasn't up and running yet but other than that stay at the hotel was enjoyable.

Hotel_Name: Radisson Blu Hotel, Marrakech Carre Eden
Review_Title: Great hotel, fantastic location, exceptional service
Review_Text: The hotel is an oasis away from the hustle and bustle of the M√©dina yet just 15 minutes walk or a 5 minute taxi ride. Room clean and comfortable. The service we received from all staff was exceptional - thank you to Medi and Jamal for making our stay perfect!

Hotel_Name: Radisson Blu Hotel, Marrakech Carre Eden
Review_Date: Sheryl A wrote a review Jun 2019
Review_Text: Located in the heart of the modern city is Marrakesh surrounded by restaurants and shopping very western like part of town. Walking distance to Medina and old city. Felt very safe and comfortable in the neighborhood.

Hotel_Name: Radisson Blu Hotel, Marrakech Carre Eden
Review_Date: Petronella F wrote a review May 2019
Review_Text: We were highly impressed with the service we received here. Staff were polite and friendly. Always going above and beyond. It‚Äôs a family friendly hotel with exceptional staff. They were always willing to help you.    Highly recommended.

Hotel_Name: Radisson Blu Hotel, Marrakech Carre Eden
Review_Date: Purnendu S wrote a review May 2019
Review_Text: Should go for rooms overlooking the pools. Rooms are spacious with a balcony. Not very happy with the washbasin being at the middle of the room.  The hotel is in middle of the town and everything is at walking distance.  Food is average for Indian taste.

Hotel_Name: Radisson Blu Hotel, Marrakech Carre Eden
Review_Date: Bianca B wrote a review May 2019
Review_Title: Great hotel and location, out of the hassle of the M√©dina
Review_Text: We have just spent 5 days at this property with my family. We had two rooms overlooking the pool.    Room  Very well equipped with nespresso coffee machines fridge iron & iron board large balcony seating futons and a large desk/office space that made me wish I was there on business rather than leisure. The bathroom is massive with a walk in shower drying rack two sinks bathrobes and separate toilet. All very chic and minimal.    Food  We had breakfast lunch room service all amazing. In comparison to the UK prices are good but comparing to Marrakesh prices are spicy. Good quality however.    Location  The hotel is about 20 minutes walk from the M√©dina 5-10 by taxi (pay max 20 DHR for 2 ppl 50 DHR for large taxi 4 ppl +). We enjoyed being at this location more rather than staying in the M√©dina. While the souks are good fun it does get a bit tiring so getting out of there felt nice.    The area Gueliz is very nice felt safe with plenty of restaurants and shops. It is also about 15 mins to the airport (70 DHR by taxi).    Spa  Amazing massage. Again very good prices in comparison to the UK. It was about 450 DHR for 30 mins 660 DHR for 60‚Äô and 990 DHR for 90‚Äô. Didn‚Äôt get to try the Hammam and to our disappointment one couldn‚Äôt use it with a massage. But the massage itself was amazing. Would definitely recommend.    Pool & Entertainment  This was one of the main reasons we had booked and didn‚Äôt regret. Felt very good to come and soak in the pool after spending many hours walking in 30-40 degrees. They also had a table tennis üèì.  After reading all reviews I was looking forward to seeing the band but it must have been due to Ramadan that they did not play one night. No biggy but would have liked to see them since everyone is raving how good they are. Guess I have to go back again for that only!    All in all a beautiful hotel with good service and all you need for a successful stay in Marrakesh.

Hotel_Name: Radisson Blu Hotel, Marrakech Carre Eden
Review_Date: Sharon M wrote a review May 2019
Review_Text: Really liked this hotel.we had a 5th floor room which was huge more a suite. Large bed room & separate sitting area with sofa. The bed was two singles together and was a little firm. Each room had it's own large screen TV. There was a room with toilet & handbasin off the sitting room and a large spacious bathroomoff the bedroom with separate walk-in shower and large bath tub.A balcony ran the whole length of the sitting room & bedroom which overlooked the pool.Breakfast was buffet style mixture of Moroccan food ( Morracan Soup & Couscous) fruits juices breads yoghurt cereals cakes. Variety of teas & coffee. The bar in the evening was pleasant bottled beers were Casablanca & Belgium Leffe Blonde & Brun open until 11:00pm. Good ambiance for a hotel.The hotel was next to a large shopping centre and the area also had several good restaurants..found a very good Italian.. and cafes including Western styles like Starbucks. The city tour buses ..red & green lines stopped 5 mins away and the main old town square was a short taxi rude away (cost on average between 50-100 Dirhams)  Would happily return to this hotel again
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Hotel_Name: Radisson Blu Hotel, Marrakech Carre Eden
Review_Date: Bernard G wrote a review May 2019
Review_Text: This was a very good value for money hotel.  An initial problem was sorted out quickly and efficiently.  Some of the staff could do with a little better training.  This is no reflection on the Radisson Blu brand it is just a reality that Moroccans tend not to understand the European level of service a 4 / 5 Star should offer.  Others my disagree.  However I strongly recommend this hotel for the very many positive features like comfortable bed good aircon and good internet. Plus it is in a good location in Central Marrakech.

Hotel_Name: Radisson Blu Hotel, Marrakech Carre Eden
Review_Text: Hotel is quite new and is built above Carre Eden shopping mall. This is handy as there‚Äôs a Carrefour supermarket to buy water etc. Lots of restaurants and bars in the vicinity. Takes about 35 -40 minutes to walk to Jemaa El-fna. Pool area nice with comfortable sunloungers.    Gym is large with lots of good quality equipment although the air conditioning wasn‚Äôt switched on during any of the times we worked out so was very warm in there.    Rooms a decent size with comfortable bed although pillows not comfortable. Room cleaning was poor as nearly every day something was missed - coffee creamer one day coffee sachets the next toiletries the day after. Only one small shampoo body wash conditioner etc provided each day for 2 people in room so when showering twice a day (morning after gym and evening) then there isn‚Äôt enough provided. On website says espresso maker and tea making facilities - it‚Äôs a kettle with Nescaf√© sachets.    Breakfast was ok as had egg station for omelettes fried eggs etc. Lots of Moroccan choices which were nice to try. Cheese slices cold meats etc weren‚Äôt refrigerated or on ice so if having breakfast at 9.30 they were a bit dried out with curled edges. Could do with having toast as an option as well. Most staff very friendly. Bar area nice and drinks good.    Enjoyable stay overall but with a few minor improvements eg room cleaning and breakfast choice the hotel could be excellent.

Hotel_Name: Radisson Blu Hotel, Marrakech Carre Eden
Review_Text: Located about a 30 minute walk from the centre this modern and clean hotel is a good choice for visitors. Friendly check in staff great you. The rooms we had were clean and comfortable with comfortable beds. Pool area clean with plenty of sun beds and places to rest in the sun or shade.  A nice bar and stylish restaurant / breakfast area. Gym large and well equipped.  Down-points:  Strange pillows like they were filled with rice  Minor but annoying every day the tea coffee and milk were not stocked or something was not restocked.  Advertising Nespresso in the room but there wasn‚Äôt  Breakfast wasn‚Äôt great there was plenty of food but nothing really to eat. Not even a toaster to make toast. Loads of dishes of spices vegetable salad poor choice of other breakfast types. Only hot option was eggs.  Otherwise a worthwhile stay.

Hotel_Name: Radisson Blu Hotel, Marrakech Carre Eden
Review_Title: Cool hotel in heart of Gueliz
Review_Text: Inside the smart new Carre Eden shopping centre this hotel has a distinctive cool vibe. Popular central cocktail bar with entertainment every night. Great now heated pool. Ideally located for all Gueliz has to offer.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Hotel_Name: Radisson Blu Hotel, Marrakech Carre Eden
Review_Date: Richard B wrote a review May 2019
Review_Text: It's difficult for me to fault this hotel. We were upgraded on arrival which obviously helped but our rooms were spacious clean and comfortable with enormous bathrooms.    The breakfast was truly outstanding and everything was swiftly replenished if it ran low and the food in the restaurant generally was of a very good standard and fairly priced.    The location suited us well it's a taxi ride to the Old Town but the hotel is within a ten minute walk of several of the city's best restaurants and has a supermarket underneath.    The staff were extremely friendly and helpful.    The only slight criticism I can level is that the pool is on the small side for serious swimming and was crowded at times there were just about enough sunbeds.    All in all an excellent stay and I would certainly go back if we visit Marrakech again
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Hotel_Name: Radisson Blu Hotel, Marrakech Carre Eden
Review_Date: Max C wrote a review May 2019
Review_Text: Khalid at the front desk really made the experience for us. We had a wonderful stay! Our room was both spacious and luxurious. We enjoyed lounging by the pool which provided a real oasis to relax after exploring the city.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Hotel_Name: Radisson Blu Hotel, Marrakech Carre Eden
Review_Date: Jan Karel S wrote a review May 2019
Review_Title: You are welcome from the moment you enter the hotel
Review_Text: Easy dropoff with taxi. Inmediately helpful in carrying even small handluggage. Our flight arrived early in the morning but we got a nice room with nice view on the pool without any problems. Our 5 nights stay was very pleasent. Room cleaning was good. Breakfast lot's of choices. Coffee not as strong as I like. Ramadan full Moroccan buffet was nice to try lot's of different salads main courses and desserts. Lots of money for value. I went to the gym twice. Good equipment for types of exercises. Pool is not very large but the water is warm. Too many people 'claiming' their seats with towels will that ever change however the poolstaff keeps an eye and removes the towels when he sees you looking for a free spot. Excellent service. Frontdesk staff really go out all the way to make your stay a top stay.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Hotel_Name: Radisson Blu Hotel, Marrakech Carre Eden
Review_Title: Outstanding services provided by lovely caring staff
Review_Text: Outstanding services provided by lovely caring staff I would definitely recommend this hotel for a pleasant stay with family or work related  My son's birthday was made soo special by staff and stay was very comfortable

Hotel_Name: Radisson Blu Hotel, Marrakech Carre Eden
Review_Text: From the reception we were received just like home! The restaurant bar with the great barmen and pool service are amazing especially Mr. Marouane ! The rooms are great food delicious and the entire team made us feel very welcome! Definitely staying again for another time and another trip to this beautiful city and hotel!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Hotel_Name: Radisson Blu Hotel, Marrakech Carre Eden
Review_Date: Soukayna ÿ≥ wrote a review May 2019
Review_Text: Stayed there for a week for business. Staff members were very patient with our group and were able to handle requests. The hotel is well located and room service is of high quality. P.S_for good lovers: they have great pastries . S.T. For

Hotel_Name: Radisson Blu Hotel, Marrakech Carre Eden
Review_Text: We totally enjoyed our stay in this hotel. Staff was friendly attentive and constantly smiling. The breakfast was very good. We had dinner twice in the hotel and it was delicious. We all enjoyed our stay and we felt extremely welcome and safe. I would highly recommend this hotel. Great value for great service and location!! Thank you!

Hotel_Name: Radisson Blu Hotel, Marrakech Carre Eden
Review_Title: Best thing I liked is the band!
Review_Text: the staffs are very friendly and helpful they smile at us every time we come to the restaurant.  The only thing that made me discover the hotel is the band at the bar they have very good taste of music they adapt to guests requests and they even I terrace with guests which made the ambiance better than epicurien or any other place for those who want to have an experience with live music.  The disappointing part is that there‚Äôs not live on Sunday and Monday and they finish early.  As a local I don‚Äôt like to go out on weekends I like to go out on mondays with my friends and the only destination is radisson blu but for sure we cannot.  Something that really bothers me a lot and which made me stop going there with friends is that the live finishes at 23:00.  It‚Äôs marrakesh and the live finishes at 23:00 we wanna drink more and eat more but when the music stops we ask for the bill and we go somewhere the ambiance is mediocre.  Think of your set up of entertainment and the vision of the hotel because you give a service that is not consistent.

Hotel_Name: Radisson Blu Hotel, Marrakech Carre Eden
Review_Date: Paul K wrote a review Apr 2019
Review_Text: This was our second stay in Marrakesh. The hotel is about 15min walk to the M√©dina. Nearby there are loads of cafes and restaurants. The things I really liked about this hotel was the fact that it was close enough to the centre but also quiet. There is a heated pool (absolutely brilliant!!) sun loungers a really well equipped gym (better than a lot of hotels in the uk...) and a spa. My partner had a hamman and I had a massage both were great.  The thing that sets this hotel apart from others is the amazing service from all the staff nothing was too much effort. Our daughter lost her toy and the staff managed to find it and it was returned to us.  The only down side is the price of drinks and food at the hotel so we tended to eat out for lunch and evening meals (there are lots of places nearby so not a problem)  We will definitely be going back and would highly recommend.

Hotel_Name: Radisson Blu Hotel, Marrakech Carre Eden
Review_Date: Joanna M wrote a review Apr 2019
Review_Text: I stayed here with two of my friends for a long weekend and we were impressed. The service is incredible the pool and surrounding areas are stunning and the rooms were lovely.    I used radisson reward points to pay for our stay and there was a malfunction with the booking system where the hotel were informed the room was for one person rather than 3. The team at reception helped us sort out the situation and were very kind and understanding.    All the staff went out of their way to help us when they could setting up a special place for us to eat when we wanted to sit in the quiet (we had to work for one of the days we stayed) giving us recommendations for places to eat and bringing us water regularly.    I can‚Äôt recommend this place enough if you‚Äôre looking for a modern international hotel. It was a calm oasis in the middle of vibrant slightly chaotic Marrakech.

Hotel_Name: Radisson Blu Hotel, Marrakech Carre Eden
Review_Date: Andrew D wrote a review Apr 2019
Review_Text: I will start with full disclosure. I am a lifetime "Titanium" level for the new Starwood "Bonvoy" program and as such my expectations were high.    However the rooms left much to be desired. Examples - there was no real "bathroom" in the room as the tub "room" and the toilet "room" were there just as you walked in on your left. The sink was staring at you right at you when you enter. The tub had only a handheld wand to shower with (as well the the tub spigot) which i was not use to. As such trying to shower was a challenge and I wound up flooding the floor in the room (no separate bathroom). I got better as the week went on but....... The room I was given was looking over a side street was was very noisy. They had a balcony but nowhere to sit (no chairs even though there was room). I always have the A/C on all night (personal preference) but half way through the night it shut off (which woke me up with heat flashes). I had to fiddle with the thermostat pull my key card in/out of the room enable slot a few times walk around the room a few times and it kicked in. On the first morning there we lost water in the hotel ("generator issue") which made preparing for my business meeting quite challenging. Was I in a third world hotel?    After a few days there I realized my colleagues had much better rooms. I guess i was unlucky.    On the plus side the staff was friendly the outdoor pool/restaurant service excellent the pool very nice.    I would not stay there again.

Hotel_Name: Radisson Blu Hotel, Marrakech Carre Eden
Review_Date: The Don wrote a review Apr 2019
Review_Text: Some of the front desk supervisors were not helpful as they were supposed to and they did not perform their job by taking care of my complaint. It was because the rooms smelled like sewage. It took them 2 nights before they can move me to another room.

Hotel_Name: Radisson Blu Hotel, Marrakech Carre Eden
Review_Text: Stayed for five nights in a pool facing deluxe room. Beautiful view and very friendly staff. Room was always cleaned to a high standard and toiletries replaced without fail every time. The staff were extremely friendly and made my husband and I felt very comfortable. The hotel staff were helpful in every aspect including travel advice and recommendations. The pool was amazing with warm clean water. Thoroughly enjoyed the buffet breakfast every morning.    Areas for improvement:    Offer a wider selection of hot food for breakfast (limited options of hot food)    Upon arrival we were asked to pay a fixed amount in advance to cover any items we used from the mini bar or spa facilities. I would encourage the hotel to include this in their policy or inform customers prior to their visit. Not every traveller will bring an extra 1000 dh on top of spending money.    Other than this could not fault the hotel/service and would recommend to others.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Hotel_Name: Radisson Blu Hotel, Marrakech Carre Eden
Review_Date: Oumnia B wrote a review Apr 2019
Review_Title: The Best Patio/Pool restaurant in Marrakech
Review_Text: I accidentally stumbled upon this place after a very bad experience at Cafe de La Poste. i was extremely pleased with the friendly staff welcoming and the amazing setting of the hotel. Huge patio/pool area very modern and unique the staff is the best and the food amazing. Great Cocktails too. I recommend this to anyone who wants to have a drink or lunch or even coffee in the area.

Hotel_Name: Radisson Blu Hotel, Marrakech Carre Eden
Review_Text: An expert conference is easily accommodated (80plus personals).  Despite beeing in the middle of town and just 20 minutes walk from the main attractions we were comfortably and secludedly concentrating on engineering and strategy issues.

Hotel_Name: Radisson Blu Hotel, Marrakech Carre Eden
Review_Date: Hannu V√§in√∂ L wrote a review Mar 2019
Review_Title: This 5 star hotel has alot to improve
Review_Text: Booking.com description of the Superior Room was misleading which was confirmed by the hotel reception officer. Among other things the following was missing: coffee maker bathrobes slippers bidet second glass for tea. - When booking we had asked information about the shuttle service from the airport to the hotel but never received a response. - In our first room water from the bathroom leaked to the room. The complaints about the missing items made to the floor personnel didn't lead to anything but the reception desk officials reacted rapidly. As as a consequence we received an upgraded room. - The breakfast buffet was excellent.

Hotel_Name: Radisson Blu Hotel, Marrakech Carre Eden
Review_Text: We loved this hotel! We went to Marrakech for a long weekend back in February and really enjoyed our stay. The pool area was great and we also really loved the poolside food menu. The hotel itself is in a good location - right by a mall and a Starbucks and near several restaurants and shops but walking distance (a long walk but doable) to the old town area. The rooms were clean and we appreciated the big bathroom. Would definitely stay again!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Hotel_Name: Radisson Blu Hotel, Marrakech Carre Eden
Review_Date: Karim J wrote a review Mar 2019
Review_Text: one of the best hotel i visit in marrakech.  i highly recommend; thank you to mister ayoub the first person i talked to when i did the reservation very helpful and nice person.  the pool is amazing . very big rooms and very clean .  the hotel is in the center of marrakech the best location you can hope.  thank you again and i will visit very soon.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Hotel_Name: Radisson Blu Hotel, Marrakech Carre Eden
Review_Date: Marilyn R wrote a review Mar 2019
Review_Text: Hotel really clean. Heated pool was great. Our roon was very nice the aircon was a bit cold first night but soon sorted it out. The bar service was poor to say the least waited 40 minutes to get a drink 10 min to get served the rest just waiting. The location is good plenty of shops and not too far from the souke but be prepared to walk. We got a taxi which was an experience in itself. Likened to the doggems on a fair. Breakfast was okay with an omlete station.

Hotel_Name: Radisson Blu Hotel, Marrakech Carre Eden
Review_Date: Stine H wrote a review Mar 2019
Review_Text: Highly recommended also with kids. An Oasis in busy Marrakech. Everything is just perfect. Great breakfast heated outdoor pool excellent service friendly staff. Very big so no personal touch but that was fine.

Hotel_Name: Radisson Blu Hotel, Marrakech Carre Eden
Review_Text: A lovely hotel with good facilities. It is out of the centre so perfect for when you want to get away from the hustle and bustle.  The staff are very helpful and will go out of their way to make you feel comfortable. There is a nice big fire in the bar area which is useful for a rainy days like we had. I had to keep reminding myself that this is Africa as at times it is easy to forget! Thank for a wonderful trip especially to the manager Marwan who was very helpful during our stay.

Hotel_Name: Radisson Blu Hotel, Marrakech Carre Eden
Review_Date: Natalie Gore wrote a review Mar 2019
Review_Text: I had the chance to stay at this hotel for a work conference and I absolutely LOVED it. The rooms were beautiful with a lovely outside terrace looking at the pool and orange trees. The food here was AMAZING- especially the fresh made omelettes in the morning the oranges kiwi and hummus of course all so good. The meeting rooms were fantastic and overall we had an AMAZING stay here.

Hotel_Name: Radisson Blu Hotel, Marrakech Carre Eden
Review_Title: Lovely oasis in the chaos of marrakech
Review_Text: Stayed at the hotel with my boyfriend for 4 nights. Very well located in the heart of the modern Marrakech. If you want to go to the M√©dina you can easily get there in a 20-30 minutes walk. Around the hotel you can find lovely restaurants.  Our room was cozy and very well decorated. Loved the open bathroom concept as well. The staff was very welcoming and helpful and the breakfast was very diverse with a lot to choose from.    Some space for improvement:  1 - If two or more people are staying in one room you should provide more toiletries as one of each is not enough;  2 - a fan should be added to the shower cabin as it is a closed space with no aeration unless you leave the shower door open;  3 - in a superior hotel it is expected that when they clean the room if the iron board and iron are out that the cleaners put them back to the original place;  4 - the breakfast area should be able to accommodate more people. It was always packed in the morning and it was hard to get a place;  5 - didn‚Äôt fancy the fact you can smoke in the bar area (indoors). A bit disgusting in my opinion.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Hotel_Name: Radisson Blu Hotel, Marrakech Carre Eden
Review_Date: suddhasatwa ray wrote a review Mar 2019
Review_Title: Reception staff name Mr Aissam is great and very helpful friend always extend his hand for help
Review_Text: We live room number 4068 from 19 th feb to 24 th feb 2019 Receipton staff Mr Aissam is great and very very helpful. But one guy in reception charge he stay most of the time name probably iman looks front head ball is very unfriendly and unethical. I ask for change 100dihram to small 20 Dhiram couple for tips to hotel staff I ask for twice in different day and different time. By their receipton staf . But that guy always denied. Just you think when you are out of country as tourist then your hotel reception staff is first line friend at new country . If you have problem you ask them but that header most time stay guy receipton is very unfriendly. Need that guy remove from receipton area for customer good. And hotel dinner room is dark not sufficient light and dinner menu never change we stay five days same menu like same old songs. And breakfast is good but arrangement of breakfast item place like pyramid . When you need to take cereal you need to be good athlete fitness. Arrangement food plate for breakfast is horrible. We book this hotel by Expedia due to Radison blue hotel  American brand oh It is horribole hotel as dinner menu and front desk head of staff or stay most of the time and placing breakfast menu plate is terrible. I request Radison blue management USA keep this hotel like Radison blue hotel or take out name Radison blue name . So like me customer will not be fool. We trust American change Radison blue hotel. So customer. Radison blue hotel administration need to listen customer review. To get my room4068 need to walk long from elevator and corridor looks dirty and carpet too dirty looks
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Hotel_Name: Radisson Blu Hotel, Marrakech Carre Eden
Review_Text: Very good accommodation helpful and friendly staff. Very good food along with their famous mint tea. I recommend to everyone.    The service was great and the view from the room was amazing.    It's surrounded by very good restaurants with accessible prices.

Hotel_Name: Radisson Blu Hotel, Marrakech Carre Eden
Review_Date: Robin VW wrote a review Feb 2019
Review_Text: Though we did not stay at the Radisson Blu during our time in Marrakech we wanted to state how amazing the staff at this hotel is! My boyfriend and I ran into some unforeseen challenges while traveling and our own hotel staff had limited English. The Radisson helped us out in ways that went above and beyond expectations especially the night manager Ahmed. If quality staff is important to you you won‚Äôt find much better than at the Radisson Blu.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Hotel_Name: Radisson Blu Hotel, Marrakech Carre Eden
Review_Text: We enjoyed our stay in This hotel we also enjoyed the food there Rida Laachari restaurant manager was very kind and professional also the staff Loubna Eddaoudi and Mounaim Matrouf were awesome. Great experience!

Hotel_Name: Radisson Blu Hotel, Marrakech Carre Eden
Review_Text: Good quality Radisson away from the busy old town of Marrakech making it a nice escape from the frenetic tourist areas. Most of the staff are professional in particular a young woman named Amina but there are some front desk staff who could be more patient. Tasty breakfast but as another reviewer posted the buffet area is dimly lit - making it difficult to see all the offerings. Another negative point at breakfast is that there‚Äôs no toaster. So if you want your bread toasted you need to find someone to assist you. Nearby the hotel is a terrific Italian restaurant called Mamma Mia (bad name but great food). Overall good value for money.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Hotel_Name: Radisson Blu Hotel, Marrakech Carre Eden
Review_Text: We went here last night for a meal and despite not being a hotel guest the staff could not have been more accommodating. We sat outside by the heated pool and the food was lovely...wish we were staying here!

Hotel_Name: Radisson Blu Hotel, Marrakech Carre Eden
Review_Date: Ole A wrote a review Feb 2019
Review_Text: I was not happy after my 4 days stay. My room was ice-cold at night. Despite I complained every day for 3 days and told reception that the room was ice-cold at night  nothing was done.- The last night I had to sleep in my close in order not to freeze....after 3 days of complaining they fixed it. The service in the bar was real low....even when you was alone you had to order to or three times before they served what you wanted....I organized a lunch for visiting friends. Asked for a ordinary bottle of Chardonney.....Was not given a winelist. The gave me two bottles og the absolute most expensive wine on the wine list....This is NOT the way to do it. The location is great and the standard og the hotel is not bad. But the service level is below what's acceptable. The breakfast room is so dark that you don't have a change to see what you eat...One example...There is about 7 different types og marmelade...But there is absolutely no ligt sp you have no idea what you eat....Event its in a muslim country they served eggs and bacon. For 4 days my fried egg was swimming in egg wide...and the Bacon could be used af a knife...it was rock hard.....My overall judgement is 3 stars...Sorry Radisson Blu...You can do so much better than this....must add...even I was freezing and complained every day...they charged full rate....no apologies....

Hotel_Name: Radisson Blu Hotel, Marrakech Carre Eden
Review_Date: Kellie R wrote a review Feb 2019
Review_Title: Safe haven in the madness of Marrakech
Review_Text: When we arrived tired the girl in reception was very unhelpful. We had to wait ages to check in as there was only one on reception. We were stung for a security deposit of 300 euros that we weren't expecting which put a dampener on the beginning of our holiday. Otherwise the hotel was beautiful - pool was amazing room was lovely and it had a view of the pool. Breakfast was gorgeous - kudos to the omelette lady. Cappuccino machine was brilliant. Overall a great stay.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Hotel_Name: Radisson Blu Hotel, Marrakech Carre Eden
Review_Date: David S wrote a review Jan 2019
Review_Title: Best and personal service, amazing staff, excellent location
Review_Text: We arrived around 1AM to the hotel  we were exhausted after very long drive... from the first second we got into the hotel staff members welcomed us with a huge smile we felt that the team was very excited to make us feel home. Once we went to the check in desk the night shift manager Mr Ahmed was ready to give us the keys not before a drink was offered and provided to us. Once Mr Ahmed recognized that we can speak a little Moroccan  with a lot of patience we started to talk Moroccan which make us to feel really at home. The hotel is super clean  always smell great. Rooms are comfortable and big. It‚Äôs in the hurt of Marakesh  everything u need is around 1 minute Walking distance restaurants (all kind kosher as well)  mall caffe  transportation and more. No words to describe how professional are the staff very friendly  always with a smile  they are ready to help we can‚Äôt forget them ! specifically I would like to mention Abdlemajid ( Bell Boy )  The Bar on the second floor is always busy  with a live band.  We had a great time there. We are 100% sure that our next trip we stay only in the Radisson Blue hotel !  Big thank you to the staff !  Super recommended !
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Hotel_Name: Radisson Blu Hotel, Marrakech Carre Eden
Review_Text: We loved most things about our short stay at this hotel. The location is great and the hotel is lovely. We had a suite at the end of a long corridor which we found perfect as there was no noise from the corridor - it was perfectly quiet at night. We had an issue with the shower when we arrived but it was fixed immediately after we reported it. We had no real view as our room looked out on a street but again it was very quiet so we didn't mind. The pool area is lovely - it was cold weather when we were there but I loved that my kids could still enjoy the pool as it is heated and we know have endless videos of my kids performing for us underwater filmed through the glass wall of the pool. Its also a beautiful area to sit and have a drink. And finally we loved the spa - the manager at the hotel and the staff at the spa went above and beyond for us when it came to getting us certain spa services and we remain so grateful for that. It was a highlight of our stay in Marrakesh. The only part of the hotel we got a little frustrated with was the dining room. The service was a bit slow and sloppy - it took a long time to get anything and we didn't find the service to be up to the same standards as the rest of the hotel. Another review mentioned the dim lighting in the dining room during breakfast which I agree with - it was hard to see what the wonderful array of food actually was. A bit more light and some labels would help. Other than that it was a great stay and we look forward to a repeat visit.

Hotel_Name: Radisson Blu Hotel, Marrakech Carre Eden
Review_Title: Rachid and his team are remarkable in amazing Radisson Blu Marrakech!
Review_Text: We‚Äôve had a wonderful stay at the heart of warm Gueliz Marrakech. The view from the balcony is just fantabulous along with the service where every Radisson employee is alert to customers‚Äô smallest details.

Hotel_Name: Radisson Blu Hotel, Marrakech Carre Eden
Review_Title: One of the best hotel Ever!!!
Review_Text: The best hotel with great experience soo clean and modern. So let me tell you how I got the best vibe and energy from this unique hotel in Marrakesh. After a long flight to attend a five days meeting all you need is a great hotel to rest in imagine with me coming late to do a check in and all you are thinking of is how fast you will get to your room to sleep to cover the tiredness that you had from your long trip and suddenly it happens that Mr. wonderful who‚Äôs called Ahmed is helping you with the check in this guy is awesome he gave us the best welcoming that anyone can ask for and he's a great jokes teller hahha thank you Ahmed for everything. Also I would like to thank everyone in the hotel I really wish I can remember all the names because they really deserve the recognition with their help and kindness. Last but not least before you leave try the SPA in one word WOW the best Moroccan Hamam I have Ever had please try it with Ms. Hanan she is the best thank you Hanan for the great experience you gave me. Also I would like to thank Elham and Maryam for the great welcoming you guys made me feel home. Thank you every one again I will definitely come back to Radisson Blu Hotel.    Khalid ÔÅä

Hotel_Name: Radisson Blu Hotel, Marrakech Carre Eden
Review_Title: Clean and beautiful but needs better recruitment process
