Review_Text: Now the hotel isn't all bad. But some of the staff need some people skills training.  On arrival we were asked for the credit card which the hotel was booked with my daughter booked this holiday for us as she was getting married. She asked the hotel prior if it would be an issue that the card wouldn't be present on arrival she was told no. However on arrival it was a big issue. The woman on the desk demanded the card was presented for any use of the Spa or other facilities. My daughter had to come and help with our check in. We tried to explain that we had no intentions of using any facilities and requested to see a manager. At first the manager refused to come to the desk to see us which was visible from a little box behind the desk. On asking a second time both a man and woman came out. Initially the woman asked us for 7000MAD the manager then stated to me she was willing to drop this to 1000MAD and that it was for damages and security. A little more understandable and feasible. I stated that her colleague didn't state this prior hence why I was so frustrated. She said she was happy to take it in cash and gave me a receipt however I used another card just for credit insurance.  The room was beautiful modern and luxurious. The shower was great and the toilet like a throne. The rooms were well cleaned. Shame we had no seats for the balcony for half our stay however. On obvious days such as weekends the bar was extremely busy. The swimming pool area had no more than 4 people at any given time. The fact it was heated was a nice touch. Never woke up for breakfast so can't comment on the food. The bar service sometimes was hit or miss despite being overly staffed in my opinion. The door staff are probably the friendliest of the hotel. Upon leaving we were slammed with a city tax which we thought was included in the original bill. And was told we had taken water from the mini bar! Which we hadn't and refused to pay as my daughter took us shopping for our own water and snacks nearly every day. Nice hotel but mediocre service. Unfortunate as the location is optimal.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Hotel_Name: Radisson Blu Hotel, Marrakech Carre Eden
Review_Date: Laurence K wrote a review Jan 2019
Review_Title: A wonderful hotel in the center of Marrakesh
Review_Text: I stayed for almost a week at the hotel during a business trip in Marrakesh. The hotel is in a very central location right to a shopping mall and at a walking distance (30 minutes) to the square and the markets. I got a beautiful room with view to the pool with lots of light and everything needed for a great stay Nespresso coffee machine great shower comfortable bed.  Service was top and they did everything to make us feel good.  Good was fantastic. Live music every night.  Highly recommended!

Hotel_Name: Radisson Blu Hotel, Marrakech Carre Eden
Review_Text: The hotel is fine as hotels go. But in Marrakesh one can do better. The hotel needs some TLC. Front desk staff were v nice. Concierge services just ok. If you like business hotels go for it. If not go elsewhere

Hotel_Name: Radisson Blu Hotel, Marrakech Carre Eden
Review_Text: Perfect location in city center for visiting and going out to restaurants. The hotel has a heated pool outside. Great and delicious restaurant at the hotel with unbelievable meat.For sure I will recommand and go back to this nice hotel

Hotel_Name: Radisson Blu Hotel, Marrakech Carre Eden
Review_Text: We always come back to this hotel due to its very good location in Marrakech but mostly for the super nice service by the staff. A superior room on 5:th floor gave us the calm and feeling of exclusivity that we wanted. The hight of the day was always the breakfast although a bit full during Christmas Holidays the buffet was very rich and fresh. We would like to give a special honor to the morning staff who accomplished this in a very professional way despite a lot of hungry and not always polite customers. Thank you Hanane Amal Najat Zakia and all the rest of the restaurant personnell. Check out was very easy and quick thanks to Kahlid and Jamal. For those of you who are new to Marrakech the recommendation is to go to the hotel Spa after a busy day in the Souk. You will come out fresh as a newborn.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Hotel_Name: Radisson Blu Hotel, Marrakech Carre Eden
Review_Title: Disappointing - Would Not Stay Here Again
Review_Text: This hotel was definitely not 5 star. The service was poor for several reasons  Our room was overlooking building site; hair dryer not working breakfast area over crowded.Thankfully we were only here for a short stay. The main concern staying here was our money was stolen at the Lila SPA from the changing rooms.There were no other customers there at the time except staff who were wondering in and out of the area.We reported it to the SPA manager who showed no empathy and was arguementive towards us. We did we receive any apology and we were made to feel we were lying about the whole thing.  We also reported it to the hotel receptionist who intentionally disregarded us and again we were just dismissed.We will not be staying here again as don‚Äôt trust the staff after this experience  We kept all our belongings locked in our suitcases/safe and would suggest anyone who stays here does the same.

Hotel_Name: Radisson Blu Hotel, Marrakech Carre Eden
Review_Title: A safe bet for a good stay in Marrakech
Review_Text: Stayed here for a company meeting for a few days and there was really very little to find fault with. The rooms were comfy and well appointed although they don't seem to do showers in a big way here - baths must be the thing here. The TV channels were plentiful and there was a fridge and all the amenities in the rooms.  The food was very good breakfast was a huge North African buffet with a strong French Influence although I struggled to see what some of it was what with low lighting levels and a change of policy of the winter clock change so it was dark until gone 8am.  The main Souk was about 25 mins walk straight down the road and there was a big shopping centre right next door including a supermarket with a fully loaded alcohol section which was handy.  It was disappointing that I didn't get any points for staying here as the company paid for it. Not sure where they go but it doesn't encourage me to stay at Raddison Blus that's for sure.

Hotel_Name: Radisson Blu Hotel, Marrakech Carre Eden
Review_Date: Fehd M wrote a review Dec 2018
Review_Text: We visited the hotel with my wife and my 4 year child.  The hotel is very well located in the heart of the city and at the same time very calm.  The stuff were very nive and available.  Will recommend the hotel for friends wishing to discover Marrakech

Hotel_Name: Radisson Blu Hotel, Marrakech Carre Eden
Review_Text: Reservation - we experienced good reservation handling with a guarantee of adjoining rooms for family of 4.    Location - good location in the new city right next to a shopping centre restaurants and shops. Half an hour's walk to Jema Al Fanaa and historical attractions.    Property - rooms were a serious disappointment. Lacking any character bland and poor design. In serious need of revamp. 1970s style rooms with ugly contemporary furniture and nothing to tell that you are in Morocco. No shower and each room was small being more of a studio than a double room. Poor finishes. Insufficient elevators meaning a long walk to the lifts for most rooms. Definitely not 5 stars. After much complaining and to Reception's credit we were finally allocated adjoining rooms that were a lot better than the "superior" rooms we were first allocated.    Restaurant- crowded at breakfast with large quantities of food but lacking in quality and variety - not 5 stars.    General - we found the concierge and some of the breakfast staff very helpful and friendly. In general needs to up its game to justify its 5 star rating.

Hotel_Name: Radisson Blu Hotel, Marrakech Carre Eden
Review_Text: Nice hotel in a good location (near some highly rated restaurants and the Jardin Marjorelle). Lovely pool and outdoor area. Attentive and friendly staff (who also prepared a nice birthday surprise for my fianc√©e). Great breakfast. Room large and immaculate bathroom very nice too.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Hotel_Name: Radisson Blu Hotel, Marrakech Carre Eden
Review_Date: Mouad T wrote a review Dec 2018
Review_Text: Hotel was generally not up to expectations this was not the main point though.  Two hours after checking out from the hotel further to a business seminar our seminar coordinator received a call from the management falsely accusing me of breaking a shaving mirror and taking the bathrobe with me. Hotel manager argued that I should have reported that the mirror was broken as it is "my responsibility" to make a health check of all the furniture at check-in.  I could see that it's totally unprofessional first because their was no check before my arrival of the furniture and furthermore accusing me of breaking a mirror they didn't check and that could be a serious health hazard for me. Not mentioning the necessary investigation they are supposed to make (hotel has cameras) before concluding to accuse their customer of stealing.    I would strongly suggest if not to avoid staying there at least to control all room furniture at check-in and request a formal check-out before leaving. Otherwise you may see yourself debited + accused of stealing hotel furniture.    Instead of addressing their internal issues this hotel tends to charge and accuse customers.    For my job I use to spend a good part of my time in different hotels around the world. This is first time I see such a thoughtlessness and lack of professionalism

Hotel_Name: Radisson Blu Hotel, Marrakech Carre Eden
Review_Text: This is on of an amazing hotel I ever stayed in. Crows are kind and warm welcoming. Specialy mr.marwan he was a great help to me rooms are clean and nice view.evry thing was great am strongly advise accommodation in this hotleüëçüèªüëçüèªüëçüèªüëçüèªüëçüèªüëçüèª

Hotel_Name: Radisson Blu Hotel, Marrakech Carre Eden
Review_Date: Kok Siang C wrote a review Dec 2018
Review_Text: We booked 2 rooms using our Radisson Rewards points for 5 nights and requested for twin beds rooms in the online booking. We requested for rooms close to each other during check-in and were given rooms with double bed instead. We have to get the rooms changed and were told that because we asked for rooms close to each other and they have decided to give us the double-bed rooms without telling the guests the earlier request (twin beds) was not fulfilled. Not happy with the check-in counter as I find them not effective (more than 1 hour to get the twin beds room) and they could be more friendlier. Despite being in gold status I did not get an room upgrade and the balcony view was facing the balcony of another building    Anyway the location and the rest of the hotel facilities were satisfactory. Breakfast is good as usual (never get disappointed with breakfasts from Radisson blu chain of hotels). Swimming pool is big enough for a nice swim. Excellent service from specific staff such as Mohammed in the breakfast restaurant. Also big thank to the conceige team in the ground floor who are really helpful in getting the taxis and also assisted us in getting us the bubble wraps.

Hotel_Name: Radisson Blu Hotel, Marrakech Carre Eden
Review_Date: Ali S wrote a review Dec 2018
Review_Text: Amazing hotel in agreal location  The stuff is great !!!!  Worth it big time .  Better than alot of other more expensive hotel in this crazy city .  I recommend it ... you will be happy ..  Abet deffecult to find it but its worth it .

Hotel_Name: Radisson Blu Hotel, Marrakech Carre Eden
Review_Text: Very nice hotel good location very nice pool stuff so friendly. Amazing breakfast and the hostess were so helpful. You can feel party in the air at Radisson. We can not wait for next time in Marrakech.

Hotel_Name: Radisson Blu Hotel, Marrakech Carre Eden
Review_Text: What a pleasure: not only terrific location in the Gueliz (modern) section of Marrakech but one of the best rooms I have ever stayed in. It is really designed so well with modern furnishings plenty of room to unpack very comfortably and a great bathroom (double sinks huge shower wonderful amenities).

Hotel_Name: Radisson Blu Hotel, Marrakech Carre Eden
Review_Text: The hotel was beautiful clean and lovely. The room was nice and the bed was really comfy. The hotel staff was amazing really helpfull and always aware of your needs. And the restaurant served great food and juices. Especially the breakfast buffet was a treat.

Hotel_Name: Radisson Blu Hotel, Marrakech Carre Eden
Review_Date: Jonathan Z wrote a review Nov 2018
Review_Text: We stayed for 4 nights and had a lovely stay. The location was central and close to most attractions. The staff were very friendly and helpful. The grounds were very pleasant (for example eating lunch next to the swimming pool surrounded by trees). The rooms were very clean.

Hotel_Name: Radisson Blu Hotel, Marrakech Carre Eden
Review_Date: Brian B wrote a review Nov 2018
Review_Text: I went on a vacation with my girlfriend and we stayed here. its a very nice 5 star resort that gives you the best service in every way. It was a little expensive but 100% wort the price we paid. The thing i liked best was the location. Its a short 10 minute walk to Jemaa El Fna and even closer to the Souks. I will be recommending the Raddison Blu and Marrakech to all my friends and family
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Hotel_Name: Radisson Blu Hotel, Marrakech Carre Eden
Review_Title: Great hotel in a great location
Review_Text: Special thanks to Amina Salmi our guest relations person. She is a lovely person and very helpful not only did she give us a great room (4029) but really guided us through our few days there.    Just came back on 16/11/18 after a 4 night stay at this hotel  It is in a great location and has really good facilities for a city centre hotel  Food and drinks in hotel are of a very good standard. Food prices are ok drinks reasonable price  Heated pool a great feature as we had a couple of fairly warm afternoons and relaxing by the pool was very welcome  The Medina is about 25 minutes walk and the Majorelle gardens and Yves st Laurent museum is about 20 minute walk in the other direction  All in all a great few days break    S & U Bhalla
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Hotel_Name: Radisson Blu Hotel, Marrakech Carre Eden
Review_Text: Great hotel. We surely could come back another time. Great location great staff members and amazing rooms. There isnt a thing that could have ruined our stay every thing was perfect. Radisson blu is surely a hotel that deserves 5 stars
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Hotel_Name: Radisson Blu Hotel, Marrakech Carre Eden
Review_Date: Vanessa H wrote a review Nov 2018
Review_Text: Stayed here for 3 nights cannot fault. Great location next to a shopping center and within walking distance to the M√©dina and Yves Saint Laurent gardens. Entertainment in bar every night. Was upgraded on arrival to business suite that overlooked the pool. Breakfast really good with something to suit everyone. Pool and garden areas stunning.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Hotel_Name: Radisson Blu Hotel, Marrakech Carre Eden
Review_Date: Delphine S wrote a review Nov 2018
Review_Text: A really beautiful hotel with up-to-date facilities. They seem to take your personal safety seriously and have security personnel in place which reassured me as a single female traveller. My room was very spacious and had a wonderful view of the pool. The food was delicious and reasonably priced. I would recommend a visit to the spa where I had a really relaxing massage and a manicure. I would stay here again!

Hotel_Name: Radisson Blu Hotel, Marrakech Carre Eden
Review_Text: I always read reviews before booking my holiday.reading between the lines it looked OK. How wrong I was. We arrived at about 10pm very tired.and was given room 3033.  We had booked a room with a king size bed.. the room looked tiredwith stiain carpet and arms of the only chair. The bed was two single beds. balcony looked out on a apartment opposite with just one chair. We sat next to the swimming pool and looked all round. There were bedrooms on four sides up to 4 or 5 floors. I can‚Äôt understand were the other reviewers got there ‚Äú wonderful views ‚Äú from . We did complain about the room the next day. They said they would look into it. Nothing happened and I didn‚Äôt push it. To be fair to the hotel. When we were leaving they asked if we had a good stay. I said no and told them why. They said I could stay for a drink or meal on the hotel or next time we came they would do something.. I told them we wouldn‚Äôt be coming back. I must say this hotel is in the middle of the night life if that‚Äôs what you go for..
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Hotel_Name: Radisson Blu Hotel, Marrakech Carre Eden
Review_Title: Stupid Staff and food is not good
Review_Text: staff is full of attitude and they don't respect customers. Food quality is so worse that it's better to go for street food. Drinks quantity is too low at a high price...    Staff shouts on people and the services are also not good.

Hotel_Name: Radisson Blu Hotel, Marrakech Carre Eden
Review_Title: Brand new hotel located in shopping complex
Review_Text: 5-Star Hotel with the typical Radisson atmosphere: modern and stylish furniture large bathroom with nice walk-in shower. The hotel is part of a larger complex including a shopping mall supermarket Starbucks and a couple of restaurants. Front desk was very helpful and friendly quick check in and out. The hotel is a 30 minutes‚Äô walk from the Jemaa el Fna and the Souk/ Medina. I was given a room on the 5th floor coming with a balcony facing the main street in front of the hotel. Nevertheless the noise from the street did not make it thru all very well damped.    Breakfast buffet is 5-star standard with the exception of the coffeemaker which is OK for a roadhouse but not an upscale hotel. Anyhow the rooms come equipped with a Nespreso machine so that¬¥s OK. I also found the pool hours a little strange. Talking a little swim after a long day? Forget it pool closes at 7pm. That would be OK for an outdoor pool in Scandinavia in November but not for Marrakech.    After all I enjoyed staying there for the nice rooms the good breakfast and the helpful and friendly staff at the reception (some ladies at the front desk come in Chinese suits which is nice to see in the middle of Morocco :)    GREAT HOTEL; WORTH THE 5 STAR RATING!

Hotel_Name: Radisson Blu Hotel, Marrakech Carre Eden
Review_Text: Nice family hotel. Service in the bar very slow. Pool area very busy as people reserving Sun beds for the whole day and not using them.  Good buffet breakfast but need more variety. Cold bread no facility to make a toast. Easy access to shops and most amenities.

Hotel_Name: Radisson Blu Hotel, Marrakech Carre Eden
Review_Date: Tarun Singhal wrote a review Nov 2018
Review_Text: Night manager is horrible.... He don't know how to speak to customer... He is so rude and pathetic person that we will never going to look back to Madison....    He was misbehaving with us and security guys was watching everything.

Hotel_Name: Radisson Blu Hotel, Marrakech Carre Eden
Review_Title: Calm oasis of luxary in a great city
Review_Text: Just had 5 days here with family. Perfect for all needs. The breakfast was very tasty and ticked all my "essentials" (bean to cup coffee machine fresh croissants omelette bar and freshly squeezed juice) plus Moroccan dishes (3 types of hummus and much much more). We stayed in a family friendly suite that was perfect for our needs faced the back and was super quiet room had divider so at night in essence we had 2 rooms.Nespresso in room a nice touch. The hotel is very funky great bar and live music most evenings (excellent french and english popular and jazz music- really really good). Raddison Blu hotels always have great gyms and this one is excellent with full range of CVS equipment weights and multi gym plus pilates in a studeo.The hotel is also family friendly with a warm outdoor pool and a table tennis table that the kids loved. Finally have to mention how lovely the staff were everyone was welcoming and it is difficult to pick out individuals but very special mention must go to Khalid on the front desk who is a great "go to guy" and very helpful and Zachia at breakfast she remembered all our likes from day one and looked after us everyday (the fresh coffee waiting for us on the table and the Moroccan tea freshly poured were a wonderful way to start the day-thank you)

Hotel_Name: Radisson Blu Hotel, Marrakech Carre Eden
Review_Text: I choose Radiasson Blu Hotel for a change of environment after staying in the Marrakech Medina Riad. I have the best time here because of their prefect location everywhere is walking distance to Starbucks Zara H&M McDonalds and there is a grocery store at the basement. We were lucky to be upgraded to Junior Suite which the room is madness huge! Thank You for the great hospitality! Its definitely a 5 Star Hotel.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Hotel_Name: Radisson Blu Hotel, Marrakech Carre Eden
Review_Text: My Wife and i visited Marrakesh for 4 days and stayed at the Radisson. It is ideally located within walking distance of all the tourist sites it is also ideally located for some local quality restaurants and great shopping. Our room was clean and very comfortable Wonderful that our room had a terrace where you could sit out and relax.  All the staff were very friendly and helpful. Check in only took a few minutes as did checkout. f we were to go back to Marrakesh we would find it hard to pass over the Radisson.

Hotel_Name: Radisson Blu Hotel, Marrakech Carre Eden
Review_Text: Reception is on the 2nd floor but after enter the door there is no information where to go. We had to ask doorman how to get to the reception. There was no receptionists when we came....Stuff just walked and talked around and nobody came to make check in.Breakfasts are served from 6 am but there was not a cook who makes hot dishes. We had to eat cold ones only (had no time to wait).Good looking hotel big and comfortable rooms but unprofessional stuff.....

Hotel_Name: Radisson Blu Hotel, Marrakech Carre Eden
Review_Text: This is a large modern hotel built around a central outdoor pool and seating area. Door staff are great and front desk was very helpful. The hotel is about a 25 minute somewhat frenetic walk from the Medina and most other historic attractions of Marrakech. The area the hotel is located is fairly modern and westernized; it is very busy at almost all hours and features hundreds of bars restaurants and clubs.  Rooms are modern clean and quiet. The breakfast area is dimly lit but features an amazing selection of foods that are replenished regularly.  Not the most authentic Moroccan experience but a good calm and restful antidote to what goes on outside the front door. Would stay here again.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Hotel_Name: Radisson Blu Hotel, Marrakech Carre Eden
Review_Text: We had a great time at the bar. I always go for a drink there but this was by far the best Service we ever had thanks a great guy called MOUNAIM! Not only is his French excellent but he also spoke excellent English. He knows exactly how to speak to clients and he should be training some of the staff. Thanks again MOUNAIM and good luck to you! Merci encore MOUNAIM pour l'excellent service!

Hotel_Name: Radisson Blu Hotel, Marrakech Carre Eden
Review_Text: We were there for 3 nights.... location is fabulous and the service and quality of rooms was outstanding...breakfast too quite vast. We were a large Group and felt there were enough spaces to meet too.

Hotel_Name: Radisson Blu Hotel, Marrakech Carre Eden
Review_Text: I liked it a lot actually. Breakfast is amazing and huge! Tons of choices. The rooms are well appointed. WiFi was good. The shower is really cool and funky. I would stay again for sure. Especially with the heated pool!!

Hotel_Name: Radisson Blu Hotel, Marrakech Carre Eden
Review_Date: TC Eylem E wrote a review Oct 2018
Review_Title: For me best one in Marrakesh
Review_Text: For me best one in Marrakesh .The staff is very friendly and always ready to help. Clean  comf. and nice.  Location was great too .  Food from the hotel restaurant is amazing. Fresh and delicious . Bar was so nice

Hotel_Name: Radisson Blu Hotel, Marrakech Carre Eden
Review_Text: We really enjoyed our stay here! The rooms are immaculate very well appointed and the beds very comfortable. The breakfast buffet was huge and delicious. In the evenings the bar was a great place to relax for a drink. We can definitely recommend this hotel.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Hotel_Name: Radisson Blu Hotel, Marrakech Carre Eden
Review_Date: Alexandra N wrote a review Oct 2018
Review_Text: The hotel is amazing the staff is professional and friendly and they go the extra mile for the guests. Special thanks to Munaim who has great skills and he was a perfect host for us all together with the other colleagues and new training staff- all amazing and I will be more than happy to return. The hotel is walking distance from the market and restaurants clothing stores and coffee shops. The pool is fabulous and I spent most of the time there just too relaxing to wanna leave.  Rooms are nice and clean there‚Äôs a minibar also. The only thing I would suggest even tho is not a major issue- the menu could have a little bit more options. The atmosphere when the live band is playing is great.  Would definitely recommend and return!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Hotel_Name: Radisson Blu Hotel, Marrakech Carre Eden
Review_Date: Trevor J wrote a review Sep 2018
Review_Text: We stayed here for 7 nights to celebrate a friend's 40th birthday. The hotel is lovely comfortable stylish modern and very clean. The pool area is small but we had no trouble getting a sunbed. We were in room 5101 (an upgrade as we booked a standard double). A lovely room with very spacious bathroom but view is of street rather than poolside and terrace. We were half board the content of which was not explained to us on arrival. Basically you can have 2 courses from a limited menu. This wasn't explained to us until day two and we had been served three courses the day before? There were six choices of starter main and dessert which sounds ample but quite a lot of fish and seafood which some of our party couldn't eat so very limited choice. The menu was the same every day. To be fair some waiting staff would let us order off the main menu if it was a similar priced meal but not all. I will say that everything we ate was very good we just had a lot of the same things over 7 days. We did ascertain half way through the week that we could have lunch or dinner but the menu remained the same.  The staff throughout the hotel were all very helpful special mention to Zakia in the restaurant at lunch always smiling and so helpful and accommodating.

Hotel_Name: Radisson Blu Hotel, Marrakech Carre Eden
Review_Text: What a superb hotel this is. Everything about it screams quality from the personal and friendly service to the comfortable rooms the (incredible) food to the affordable drinks. We were left wanting for nothing.    It offers excellent value for money as well as a clean and friendly environment. The staff can‚Äôt do enough for you.    It‚Äôs a great place to stay and we would return without hesitation.

Hotel_Name: Radisson Blu Hotel, Marrakech Carre Eden
Review_Date: Amy L wrote a review Sep 2018
Review_Title: Great, clean/ new accommodation and friendly staff
Review_Text: Loved the contemporary feel of the hotel which still had Morrocan accents didn‚Äôt lose the feel for the city. The best location as no more than 5/10 mins from all the sites. Food was average but people were friendly and helpful. Rooms were great and we felt extremely safe in the hotel which is always a priority! Good pool for couples/ families as well and would definitely recommend. Nothing too wow about the hotel but really enjoyed our stay!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Hotel_Name: Radisson Blu Hotel, Marrakech Carre Eden
Review_Date: RedOne Z wrote a review Sep 2018
Review_Text: My wife and I just spent a wonderful 48 hours at Radisson hotel with a beautiful swimming pool the place is just so awesome  the staff are so tender.  Food staff everything was above expectations. Room had amazing view and was spacious and comfortable.  The service is impeccable filled us up with delicious food.  I would like to said many thanks to Abdellatif (Breakfast service)  The WiFi is outstanding.  This was our first stay at Radisson and we have decided to come back in next year.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Hotel_Name: Radisson Blu Hotel, Marrakech Carre Eden
Review_Text: Very helpful staff. Groups of 9 golfers stayed here. Staff helped with bags. Excellent check-in experience. Rooms very nice. Staff very helpful. I would recommend as a bar for exploration. Short taxi drive to anywhere in Marrakech.

Hotel_Name: Radisson Blu Hotel, Marrakech Carre Eden
Review_Date: Tony F wrote a review Sep 2018
Review_Text: So this is my third stay at the Radisson Blu Marrakech which shows you just how good it is.  The staff are second to none. Check-in is fast and efficient and we were upgraded from a Superior Room which was unexpected.    Im writing this from my fifth floor balcony at 5:30 in the morning stars in the sky looking over the pool and outdoor restaurant/bar area.    I love the fact that this hotel is not full of screaming kids.  I love the fact that this is a classy business hotel.  I love the fact that the pool and area is quiet and mostly empty daytime and livens up at night with locals coming to eat and drink here.  I love the free WiFi which works even around the pool area.  I love the bathroom and rain shower in my room  I love the TV channel that plays non stop movies (MBC2)  I love the fact that theres a coffee machine in the room but plenty of trendy coffee places and bars just a few steps away.  I love the large supermarket right under the hotel.    Turn left out of the hotel and a few blocks to find a fantastic place to eat or have coffee and watch the crazy traffic. Think it's called cafe Elite. Another block just past McDonald's and you have a newly built outdoor shopping area with a host of modern shops.    This hotel is definitely the modern part of Marrakech and a taxi for 20/30 dhs (¬£2) will take you straight up to the Medina in 5 minutes if you can handle the craziness the colour smells and heat....i can just about bare all of that knowing I have this peaceful little oasis of a hotel to come back to.    Breakfast has plenty of options although could be labelled as I have no idea what half the things are. Good to be adventurous though. Omlettes cooked to order are great. And yes I will definitely return here.    And yes I will only stay here on my return.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Hotel_Name: Radisson Blu Hotel, Marrakech Carre Eden
Review_Text: If I'm in Morocco and as far as I'm concerned  it's the only place to stay. Thinks its been my fifth time. Never disappoints. Excellent service. Love the rooms. Central. Modern. Don't stay at a Riad......

Hotel_Name: Radisson Blu Hotel, Marrakech Carre Eden
Review_Date: Emma W wrote a review Sep 2018
Review_Text: Great hotel.  Efficient courteous and caring staff.  Lovely comfortable clean rooms.  Well equipped gym.  Nice outdoor pool.  Excellent breakfasts.    We've just had a superb week in Marrakesh and chose the Radisson Blu as we like this chain.  I was holidaying with my young adult son so we had everything we needed here.  All the staff went out of their way to look after us and make us feel both welcome and comfy.  We loved the wide variety at breakfast especially the delicious freshly cooked omelettes.  The staff are excellent and work hard.  We needed a late check out and it was very kindly arranged.  I'd go back it was a great experience.  Thanks!

Hotel_Name: Radisson Blu Hotel, Marrakech Carre Eden
Review_Date: Shubhojit M wrote a review Aug 2018
Review_Text: Excellent property. Middle of shopping high street.    Staff excellent.    Everything was very pleasant and nice.    The room service was very good.    Resturant staff are excellent    Reception is very warm    Loved the overall stay. Extended one night to stay more at the property.

Hotel_Name: Radisson Blu Hotel, Marrakech Carre Eden
Review_Text: I would like to share with the visitors of TripAdvisor my idea about Radisson Blu carr√© √©den marrakech  The hotel placement is very nice in the middle of the city 5 min to jamaa alfna by taxi u have everything near to u by walking the markets shopping centers the coffee shops different restaurants the most famous ones  About the rooms/the suites are just fabulous u have many choices confortable spacious and clean the view is just amazing  The ambiance of the hotel is very good all the day  About the service I did never see better than the service of this hotel because of the kindness of Mr Abderrahmane Benmansour rooms division manager and Mr Rachid restaurant manager I enjoyed my stay because of them they are very gentle and looking for the happiness of the guests all the time the complaints are resolved on the same time  With a lot of understanding and help  I would like to thank them so much for everything they did it for us thank u Abderrahmane thank u Rachid I will come back very soon because I felt like in my home thank u from the bottom of my heart  Najia is doing the best hamam ever the ceremonial hamam is just amazing the room service is helpful I thank all the guys of the room service specially mr Youssef saber thank u Youssef for ur kindness every morning  I thank also mme jamila la gouvernante she helps me to move from the room to the suite by his self she is so gentle and professional

Hotel_Name: Radisson Blu Hotel, Marrakech Carre Eden
Review_Text: This hotel is beautiful inside very friendly staff and great location. Plus best breakfast in town! Room was spacious and modern felt very safe and all requests were taken care of. Great pool and food

Hotel_Name: Radisson Blu Hotel, Marrakech Carre Eden
Review_Date: Mary P wrote a review Aug 2018
Review_Title: A wonderful stay at a modern hotel
Review_Text: My husband and I stayed at this relaxing hotel for 7 days and enjoyed it thoroughly. It is an modern new hotel decorated tastefully with Moroccan accessories and vintage Moroccan movie posters. Jamal from the front desk upgraded us to a spacious comfortable suite and Amina provided us with delicious food and drink while we waited for our room to be prepared. The service is outstanding. The entire staff is very kind and helpful and do their best to accommodate any requests.    The only negative experience we had was securing loungers by the pool. They were all reserved by 8:00 am in the morning. A hotel of this size could use another pool area perhaps shallower than the current pool to accommodate small children.    We would not hesitate to stay at this hotel again when visiting Marrakech!!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Hotel_Name: Radisson Blu Hotel, Marrakech Carre Eden
Review_Date: Krimo O wrote a review Aug 2018
Review_Text: Only the location of the hotel is very good. Breakfest space is too smal for so much people. The pool is very small and there is no space for all the guests. Cold water in the room while showering. I called the reception about it and they said they will send someone. Nobody came.

Hotel_Name: Radisson Blu Hotel, Marrakech Carre Eden
Review_Text: My husband and I stayed at the hotel to celebrate our anniversary for four nights. This is an excellent hotel and is located in a perfect spot.    Hotel: Brand new hotel with excellent rooms. Our room had a balcony overlooking the very good view of the pool and silence area. Room was cleaned everyday and toiletries refilled. Room had a comfortable bed with iron tv and minibar. The room also has a ketttle with tea/coffee facilities. The design of the room was very modern with a hint of Moroccan touch. The was cleaned everyday to a high standard and the service was brilliant. Sayda who cleaned our room always did so with a smile and worked very hard to ensure room was to a excellent standard. The hotel has an excellent spa service an awesome Aquarium pool and a high tech gym with all the new top of the range equipment.    Location: perfect location next to very good restaurants ranging fast food such as McDonald‚Äôs and Burger King to fine dining. Also has very good cafes and dessert places nearby. Hotel is a short taxi ride like 5-8 min to the old town-M√©dina where you‚Äôll find Koutoubia Mosque souks and Jemaa el-Fnaa. Another 5 min drive in the opposite direction you‚Äôll find Jardin Majorelle. There is currency exchange outside on both sides of the hotel. The hotel it self is attached to a very good shopping centre with high street shops and fast food chains.    Staff: The staff at the hotel are fantastic and provide an excellent customer service. From security door man bell boy guest relations to housekeeping waiters/waitress and to reception staff to mechanical staff to spa staff all know their jobs and value of customer service. They helped us out a lot and advising us how much to pay to local taxi drivers helping us with our excursion- we did the hot air balloon excursion which was fantastic and safe. Also decorated our hotel room and provided us with a complimentary anniversary cake. Also advised us on which transport would be reliable and cost efficient take for trip to Agadir. Thank you to all staff.    Food: We were half-board so only had breakfast and dinner. Breakfast was buffet style food was good but was a slightly limited. Dinner again the menu didn‚Äôt offer a lot but the food was of high quality and taste. Water and drinks weren‚Äôt included and had to be ordered separately.    Overall we absolutely loved our stay at the hotel and really enjoyed the massage and hammam at the spa. We loved the location and the hotel is truly tremendous. What made our stay even more fabulous was the fact you had excellent Wi-fi connection in every part of the hotel so you could stay connected with the world and on social media. This hotel is very good for couples as were given absolute privacy and although we went during peak time the hotel is big enough that no one gets in anyone‚Äôs way which I liked. Thank you for making our stay in Marrakesh a smooth and memorable one.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Hotel_Name: Radisson Blu Hotel, Marrakech Carre Eden
Review_Date: esrat c wrote a review Aug 2018
Review_Title: Perfect for those of you with family, especially 1st time!
Review_Text: Stayed here for a week with my family & after our flight got delayed we ended up reaching the hotel at 1AM  there were very humble staff gave us drinks for free to calm us down and the rooms are a decent size too loved the idea of a separate toilet and shower room. Room service was absolutely excellent shoutout to Maryam who we adored! Breakfast is excellent too attentive staff and buffet style omlette station was really cool too! The swimming pool is regularly cleaned and is pretty deep for children so I would recommend you to bring floats if you have kids who want to swim but for casual swimmers the pool is great! Honestly this hotel is was truly the highlight of our visit location is also good too right next to Carr√© Eden shopping mall and a lively area to walk around in the evening. Even the security downstairs they were lovely gentlemen especially Ahmed I‚Äôm afraid we forgot a couple other names but hopefully they‚Äôll remember our faces as we will with theirs. Other than that this hotel is perfect for first timers as Marrakech the city itself isn‚Äôt exactly the perfect spot to take small children but this hotel is amazing.  Will definitely recommend this hotel to anyone trying to visit Marrakech.

Hotel_Name: Radisson Blu Hotel, Marrakech Carre Eden
Review_Text: I visited this hotel several times while in Marrakech and it was amazing! The bar staff were all lovely and very helpful and always made us feel welcome. The food was amazing!! 100% recommend! The staff remembered us each time we came here and made our visit very memorable!

Hotel_Name: Radisson Blu Hotel, Marrakech Carre Eden
Review_Date: moshe arye w wrote a review Aug 2018
Review_Text: I was there with a couple of friends for the weekend it was a amazing experience I real nice and cozy hotel amazing views beautiful pool and awesome bar.  The most important thing is the staff they have they have a lot of staff ready to help you whenever and whatever you need.  A special thanks to the night manager Ahmed who is so helpful with everything

Hotel_Name: Radisson Blu Hotel, Marrakech Carre Eden
Review_Date: Avrumy P wrote a review Aug 2018
Review_Text: Had an amazing experience here! beautiful fresh and cozy place loved it here! Also they have here the most awesome night manager Ahmed he did everything he could that we should be as comfortable as can be!

Hotel_Name: Radisson Blu Hotel, Marrakech Carre Eden
Review_Text: I was there for a business trip  amazing room & great breakfast with amazing Team !!! what is nice this Radisson is with a Moroccan touch which makes it extremely interesting  the team is very attentive and willing to support anytime when required for sure I will come back very soon!

Hotel_Name: Radisson Blu Hotel, Marrakech Carre Eden
Review_Text: We visited the hotel for a week at the end of July 2018. What can I say about this hotel nearly everything was simply amazing.    When we checked in we had 2 rooms (4 people) and I had requested for them to be connected. I was made aware prior to arrival that the connecting rooms were not available so was expecting this. But what I was not expecting was to be upgraded to a suite! The lovely lady Amina checking us in suggested to upgrade us so we could all be in one room. The suite was on the top floor and was beautiful the rooms the bathroom the views everything was outstanding.    The amenities were great too the pool was not vast in size but it was a good size and the hotel was not packed and we got a sun lounger everyday near the pool. The staff were amazing and on call for anything. They gave out free drinks on one very hot day which was a nice touch.    There was a kids club and I want to give a special thank you to Meena from kids club who was such a lovely person who had an actual interest in making the experience good for the kids. She was interactive bubbly and got the kids to socialise amongst themselves even if there was a language barrier. The kids club was also very clean with a tremendous amount of activities. My son did not want to leave the club and I usually had to drag him out.    The location is the best right in the city centre with everything walking distance.    Coming to the negative: I only have one negative comment to make and that is the breakfast. There was not much variety at all no toast only baguettes! You had to make your own tea/coffee and a few times the coffee machines weren‚Äôt working and no one had put in the milk or whatever else the machine needed. Also there was a sort of slow service with replacing things I don‚Äôt think I ever got a teaspoon to stir my tea as they were always getting washed. Also the staff at breakfast seemed not as friendly as the rest of the staff.    But having said this  I would still 100% go back the breakfast was a small negative in contrast to all the positives about this hotel.    It is family and couples orientated everyone is wonderful the hotel is clean and beautiful and the location is perfect.

Hotel_Name: Radisson Blu Hotel, Marrakech Carre Eden
Review_Date: Jose D wrote a review Jul 2018
Review_Text: Great place to spend some days of holidays. The staff is very friendly specially the ladys from the restaurant. The swiming pool is the best we have ever seen. I would recomende it for families with small kids

Hotel_Name: Radisson Blu Hotel, Marrakech Carre Eden
Review_Title: Suites with room to spread out
Review_Text: We were assigned to a suite that included a dining and living room area a bedroom with walk-in closet and a huge bathroom with a large shower stall in addition to a tub. There was a wrap-around balcony as well. The hotel has a central courtyard with an outdoor pool. The breakfast and dinner buffets were delicious and the staff were professional and courteous. We enjoyed walking around the neighborhood.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Hotel_Name: Radisson Blu Hotel, Marrakech Carre Eden
Review_Title: A relaxing oasis in a vibrant city
Review_Text: A perfect place to stay if you want to mix traditional and modern experiences in a relaxing setting. We stayed in a business room which was a real treat for a vacation stay. Large and wonderfully equipped with a balcony facing the inner court with its great pool area. I personally just love the super confy bed with crispy and fresh bed linen and the spaceous bathroom with nice amenities and very good towels. Housekeeping is very efficient meticulous and service minded. Breakfast is just a dream. This time we stayed a lot in the pool area during the day with its impressive service given by the pool staff. Always smiling carrying new towels fixing sun beds where you wanted them rearranging parasols and on top of this also serving drinks and snacks. All this in the hot Marrakech sun. They really are worth to be mentioned.  So if you want to be comfortably situated in the city center Gueliez close to a lot of restaurants fun shopping and nice cafes this is a very nice hotel to stay in. The entire staff is very service minded and brings the typical Moroccan hospitality that you would expect. You can easily take a taxi to the old town and the famous souk and Jemaa El Fna which you have to see. The ride is not more than 10 minutes and costs between 10-15 Dirhams in a small taxi petit taxi. If you are more than three people you need to take a large taxi  grand taxi for 50 Dirhams since the small ones are not allowed to take more than 3 passengers.

Hotel_Name: Radisson Blu Hotel, Marrakech Carre Eden
Review_Date: Samuel R wrote a review Jul 2018
Review_Text: If it was a 4* hotel I will rate 5* but being a 5* hotel I was expecting more unique rooms.    Don‚Äôt get me wrong service is great staff very attentive beautiful pool and good amenities. But for a 5* hotel I was expecting more unique rooms. The only reason I rate 4* is because the rooms having a good size had furniture more similar to a business hotel than a 5*.    Other than that service staff attention to detail are 5*

Hotel_Name: Radisson Blu Hotel, Marrakech Carre Eden
Review_Date: Stefan K wrote a review Jul 2018
Review_Text: We were in Marrakech on a round trip. Me and my family were staying in this five star hotel for three days. We took a junior suite. The spacious suite was confortable clean and calm in every way. We all slept very well. Breakfast was good. The selection of food was okay but nothing special. Besides the omelet cooks. They did a great job. The pool service was attentive fast and friendly. We had dinner in the hotel restaurant. The food was tasty the atmosphere very nice. When checking out the reception manager Abderrahmane gave us a warm farewell. Thanks for making our stay remarkable! Greetings Nadia A and Stefan K

Hotel_Name: Radisson Blu Hotel, Marrakech Carre Eden
Review_Date: Ahmed H wrote a review Jul 2018
Review_Text: From when we entered to the last day we were treated great. It was an awesome stay. I could not say a negative word about any staff or say anything negative about the hotel. If you are lucky we were lucky we got to be welcomed by Khaled. He sorted everything thank you again Khaled and thank you the Radisson Blu team. It's been a pleasure and will highly recommend

Hotel_Name: Radisson Blu Hotel, Marrakech Carre Eden
Review_Title: Nice hotel outside of the Medina
Review_Text: The Radisson is located on a large street about a 5 minute car ride from the Medina. It‚Äôs central but not busy. The rooms are modern. The bathroom is an open concept type where the sink is outside of the shower and the toilet.    This can be inconvenient if you‚Äôre traveling with colleagues as one of us complained that this faucet can be noisily bothersome when he‚Äôs asleep and his roommate is brushing his teeth :-)

Hotel_Name: Radisson Blu Hotel, Marrakech Carre Eden
Review_Text: We recently stayed at the hotel for 5 days with family & friends and i can say it is an excellent hotel in a brilliant location with shops and restaurants within walking distance.  The staff provided an excellent service. Khalid on reception was excellent by far the best.  Rooms were very clean and spacious the pool view was really nice.  The spa treatment was 5* was wonderful.  Had a wonderful and pleasant stay will return if going back to Marrakech.

Hotel_Name: Radisson Blu Hotel, Marrakech Carre Eden
Review_Text: Stayed for three nights and really enjoyed our stay. We were given an upgrade and so can only speak about our superior room that was spacious clean and showed only slight signs of wear. All in all a good room. AC not too loud some English tv channels and a good bathroom.    small complaints. Water pressure in the shower not great nor was the temperature of the water. We also experienced the ‚Äútowel on the sun bed‚Äù problem that I hate - management should set a policy to stop this behaviour but haven‚Äôt.    On a good note there are several very good restaurants within five minutes walk of the hotel.    Breakfast was above average with an egg station etc.    Would stay here again.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Hotel_Name: Radisson Blu Hotel, Marrakech Carre Eden
Review_Date: Vicki R wrote a review Jul 2018
Review_Text: I recently spent five nights at the Radisson Blu and highly recommend for several reasons including beautifully modern and comfortable rooms absolutely lovely staff and an ideal location. I was here for a few days of work followed by a short holiday and it was very convenient to have the breakfast and pool area to relax in between walks to the Medina/Souk (25 minute walk) Marjorelle Gardens (15 minute walk) and shops and restaurants (2 minute walk). Very safe neighborhood.

Hotel_Name: Radisson Blu Hotel, Marrakech Carre Eden
Review_Title: Radisson Blu not for for our family
Review_Text: Our awful experience started the moment we checked in. The lady who checked us in gave us this condescending look because our booking was for 2 adults and we had our two kids under 12 with us. When we booked online it indicated kids stay for free. The lady said the fine print was only 3 people are allowed in a room. So for a family of four be prepared to leave one parent or one child at home or pay more. Kids really don‚Äôt stay for free in other words. We have platinum status with another hotel chain. It‚Äôs hard to start loyalty to Radisson for our family of four with this kind of hotel policy. Maybe this hotel policy was not the receptionist‚Äôs fault but the way she looked and treated us was horrible to say the least. We paid $80 more during check in to accomodate the extra child? Total bill was $242 for one night keep in mind we checked at about 12 midnight. In the morning we were awakened by a hotel staff saying he had to check the mini bar even with the do not disturb sign on the door. Realizing he woke us up he just said he‚Äôd come back later. My son slipped when he was coming out of the shower your showers have serious flaws water from the shower goes to the area outside the shower. We are a family of four and there was only one small bottle of body wash. The towels provided were not even enough to wipe the water from the shower. The toilet didn‚Äôt flush well. We didn‚Äôt bring up these issues anymore because we knew we would just be disappointed with the response. We stayed again on a different night unfortunately from a booking already previously made. We got the same condescending look from another evening receptionist. Our recommendation do not say kids stay for free on your website when that‚Äôs not the case. Charge extra if you have to your condescending look is not necessary and overshadows whatever good things your hotel might have. Install shower curtains in the bathroom and waterseal your shower doors? If you are enthusiastic enough to charge for an extra person make sure you give the proper amount of amenities.

Hotel_Name: Radisson Blu Hotel, Marrakech Carre Eden
Review_Date: Karin R wrote a review Jul 2018
Review_Text: ‚ÄúWelcoming a guest to a foreign country with grace and goodwill is an aspiration of hotels worldwide. This hotel staff and management exceeded these aspirations every day of my week stay. General Manager Fabrice Castellorizios Director Malik Meziane and Guest Relations Manager Loubna Eddaoudi along with the server waitress who brought me my iced coffee every morning without a prompt from me and many many others created a safe caring home far a way from my home in Austin Texas. I'm a hard customer to impress as I have traveled a great deal and this team provided superlative service on every aspect of my stay! :)‚Äù    Addendum: Given rev626 's review on a tour booked by this hotel staff I must state that the tour I arranged for a full day of zip lining and horse back riding in the Atlas Mountains was perfect. I requested a driver who spoke excellent English and he indeed was an superb guide and conversationalist. His car was new and comfortable. All the vouchers were provided by the hotel to the vendors electronically and I paid for the tour on my final hotel bill. Seamless and sensational!

Hotel_Name: Radisson Blu Hotel, Marrakech Carre Eden
Review_Title: Prime Location, Good Service, Nice People
Review_Text: We stayed at Radisson Blu Carre Eden from 18th June-24th June'18. Airport Pick up was arranged by Hotel and driver was very warm. When we arrived post 10PM the staff was very nice and made the check in process very smooth. All our requests were been taken care of. The hotel has a nice Pool and Common Lobby area. Food was nice. we thoroughly enjoyed our stay. Loubna Siham and Khalid from Guests Relations and Reception took very good care of us.

Hotel_Name: Radisson Blu Hotel, Marrakech Carre Eden
Review_Date: Eric A wrote a review Jun 2018
Review_Text: We stayed in the hotel for a week and had a lovely time. The rooms are modern and clean. The pool area is very comfortable. The food is really good. However most importantly the staff are fabulous    They are all equally friendly and cannot do enough to make your stay as comfortable as possible.    It is also close enough to the Medina to walk there but far enough away to escape from the busyness and the madness!!    I would highly recommend this hotel and plan to stay there again.

Hotel_Name: Radisson Blu Hotel, Marrakech Carre Eden
Review_Date: Inger N wrote a review Jun 2018
Review_Title: Amazing hotel with an awesome SPA
Review_Text: The hotel is amazing and staff are so service minded! I‚Äôve visited the SPA twice now - yesterday for Hammam and massage treatments and today for another massage! So recommend this for all interested in getting a relaxing and great stay as a base for other activities.

Hotel_Name: Radisson Blu Hotel, Marrakech Carre Eden
Review_Date: Anna N wrote a review Jun 2018
Review_Text: When traveling it is always important to look at how the standard is in the specific country you‚Äôre in. I can not compare standard at the hotels in Thailand with Greece for exemple.    With that said this hotel is absolutely amazing! Wonderful service with very kind and helpful staff and a great breakfast!    The SPA is fantastic!! Everyone should try hammam treatment and also the massage is very very good. I am very picky with this since I am a physioterapist and unfortunatly many times get disapointed but here is no complains at al you get so much value for your money!! Even at the SPA they are very proffessional and very kind and serviceminded!    I can highly recommend this hotel and SPA!

Hotel_Name: Radisson Blu Hotel, Marrakech Carre Eden
Review_Title: A perfect example of excellent customer service
Review_Text: My partner and I stayed here at the beginning and end of our two week road trip around Morocco and we were blown away by the friendliness and professional service we received. My partner celebrated his birthday while we were there Siham organized everything for us. Recommend us an amazing restaurant and private car helped us with our rental car and was just an absolute delight. Abdul (our bellman) was so sweet and remembered us when we came back after our trip. After travelling for two weeks it was so nice to come back to a place that felt like home we even got the same room! Breakfast was delicious and there was always entertainment. If we were to return to Morocco we wouldn't even question it we would stay here again. Thankyou all so much!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Hotel_Name: Radisson Blu Hotel, Marrakech Carre Eden
Review_Text: Staff - Amazing service - Amazing bedrooms - Amazing bathrooms - Amazing housekeeping - Amazing Pool - Amazing!    I‚Äôm not a massive fan of chain hotels. However you actually don‚Äôt feel like you‚Äôre in one here. Everything was exceptional.    Two small things. You‚Äôd make way more money if you had dedicated service round the pool. Trying to find someone and getting a drink took ages. Also don‚Äôt close your bar at midnight and at least offer room service after it‚Äôs shut.    But still. Loved it!

Hotel_Name: Radisson Blu Hotel, Marrakech Carre Eden
Review_Text: We stayed for four nights in a superior room on the fourth floor.  Check in staff were polite welcoming and efficient. The lobby is clean and modern.    The rooms are clean and stylish and the beds comfortable. There are some signs of wear and tear but nothing major. The rooms were well cleaned and made up each morning and again with a turn down service in the evening.  The breakfast was good with a wide variety of cooked and cold dishes but was badly let down by the most appalling coffee I have ever tasted. There were pots of really dreadful coffee and two automatic machines which seemed to dispense hot chocolate when the cappuccino button was pressed. Service was friendly and polite but no one seemed to notice that cups plates and cutlery frequently ran out. We only found teaspoons on the last morning.  Lunchtime food by the pool is of a good standard with plenty of choice and the service was efficient and friendly. Prices are reasonable for a hotel. The pool is warm and clean and has plenty of sun beds for lounging.  In the evening the bar area is a good place to spend time and the head barman Abdess looked after us impeccably. He was attentive friendly entertaining and full of useful local information. Exactly what you want of a good bar man.  Other reviews have been critical of some staff but we could not fault any of them.  If you are looking for local character then you won‚Äôt find it here but this is a very good mid priced international standard hotel.

Hotel_Name: Radisson Blu Hotel, Marrakech Carre Eden
Review_Date: Alex I wrote a review Jun 2018
Review_Text: The hotel is absolutely perfect for the accommodation and service provided. Excellent friendly and extremely honest staff (especially thanks to Yassine and Samir). Rich breakfast buffet. Excellent wi-fi. Clean and spacious apartment.

Hotel_Name: Radisson Blu Hotel, Marrakech Carre Eden
Review_Text: Great location good food good facilities very clean with friendly helpful and supportive staff. A lovely stay in a fantastic vibrant city made memorable by the quality of service offered by this hotel. Very impressive indeed.

Hotel_Name: Radisson Blu Hotel, Marrakech Carre Eden
Review_Text: I have stayed at this hotel several times and it always lives up to my expectations no matter if I stay alone or bring my family. I can recommend the hotel for your holiday in Marrakech. You find the mix of old and new food and caf√©s and good shopping just around the corner. All kinds of transportations available should you like a taxi a Caleche or just a bus ride. The staff is professional and forthcoming besides being very kind and serviceminded. Rooms are fresh and tidy and breakfast is the best I have seen in a hotel. The pool area is rather busy so come in the morning. The afternoon could be spent in the Spa which is the best in town. If you want to work out you will find an unusually large gym with very modern equipment.

Hotel_Name: Radisson Blu Hotel, Marrakech Carre Eden
Review_Date: Joe B wrote a review May 2018
Review_Title: Stunning hotel, everything you could need
Review_Text: Very modern looking well decorated hotel which feels like luxury. Restaurant serves simple dishes from various cuisines. The outside dining area by the pool is a lovely place to have breakfast or simply take a drink. Breakfast selection impressive. Staff very friendly and always made an effort to say hello and ask how our day had been. They also were very helpful when organising a tour for us.

Hotel_Name: Radisson Blu Hotel, Marrakech Carre Eden
Review_Text: No words cannot explain how good this hotel is. The staff the food the service and everything! As you read this review please please do not have second thought on booking this hotel. It has surpassed beyond my expectation. Do yourself a favour by not eating outside their breakfast and dinner buffet was excellent. A server named Stagiaire hassan gave us one memorable night by giving us a wonderful experience while we seat and eat our food. The ambiance both gave us a romantic and chill vibes it is like no other. Every morning our room was freshly made the pool was heaven!    Ps: you will not regret staying here. Book this now! Thank me later! See ya!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Hotel_Name: Radisson Blu Hotel, Marrakech Carre Eden
Review_Text: Despite a relatively enjoyable stay the hotel the property are now with-holding funds which they are illegally holding. Despite numerous emails and phone calls nobody has yet to resolve this issue and even acknowledge my complaint. Extremely dissappointing on what was a very pleasant stay. It would be appropriate for contact to be made to resolve this issue immediately.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Hotel_Name: Radisson Blu Hotel, Marrakech Carre Eden
Review_Text: This is a lovely hotel situated in the newer part of Marrakech Gueliz and about a 15 to 20 minute walk to the Medina. Its a very cosmopolitan and relaxed area where people were less conservative in how they dressed and there were lots of resturants cafes and bars/clubs. The hotel in next to the big shopping centre.    Once you enter the hotel the hustle and bustle is gone and is really calm. The hotel is beautifully decorated and the service from all staff we encountered was excellent.    Breakfast is great - a massive selection of food and there is a fresh omelette station too.    The pool area is really lovely and a welcome break from the business of the medina where you can sunbathe and order cocktails to your lounger.    The bar is comfortable and is table service. If you drink wine the Moroccan Rose is lovely and much cheaper than the French equivalent available.    We ate dinner one night - massive rib eye steaks perfectly cooked. They also give you bread and soup to start at no additional cost.    We also had tapas at the bar and lunch by the pool. All the food we had was of a high quality and reasonably priced (at UK standards) obviously more expensive then eating locally in the Medina.    The rooms were stylish and comfortable.    The carre eden was the perfect base for us to explore Marrakech.

Hotel_Name: Radisson Blu Hotel, Marrakech Carre Eden
Review_Title: Excellent stay in a modern hotel. Great staff
Review_Text: From the start our experience was excellent. Khalid at reception was wonderful. He tried his best to accommodate our request that we had made in advance and as he was unable to he was kind enough to upgrade us to suites that met our requirements. Excellent suites. very spacious and clean. Great for families. The hotel itself is located as part of what appears to be an upmarket area (I maybe wrong) and shopping centre. There are very nice restaurants around and the hotel food was excellent as well. The breakfast spread was extensive with live stations and amazing fresh fruit juices. Room service was of a high standard as well. The TV selection was very good and there is youtube access on the televisions + you can connect your own devices. excellent when you have kids. the hotel has a heated pool as well as a spa and a gym. This is a very nice radisson blu property. Every member of staff from the doorman bell boys to the manager were all exceptional. Keep it up.

Hotel_Name: Radisson Blu Hotel, Marrakech Carre Eden
Review_Date: Michaela L wrote a review May 2018
Review_Title: First part of the stay couldn‚Äôt have been better
Review_Text: We were taken care of our special parking requirements were fulfilled ( two HD Streetglides) and the requirement to park them and most of our luggage while we went on a three day desert tour. However the staff has changed out an is a little sluggish now which is kind of sad since we‚Äòve received such a wonderful service the first night... but we‚Äòll see how it develops
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Hotel_Name: Radisson Blu Hotel, Marrakech Carre Eden
Review_Text: Built in a new town area with shops and cafes all around. It is a fair walk into the Souk but manageable. Rooms are very new and stylish in design. Facing into the pool area it is still quiet. No real Moroccan feel to it though. Breakfast is good and a spa fitness area is also reasonable.

Hotel_Name: Radisson Blu Hotel, Marrakech Carre Eden
Review_Text: This hotel is built on top of a shopping mall in the centre of a busy retail area with lots of people around in the afternoon and evening. Despite this it was very quiet in our room and very unhurried and private. It is an easy 20-25 min stroll to Koutoubia Mosque and Souka and about the same distance to the Yves St Laurent Gardens. There are plenty of options to eat in the surrounding district at all price points.    The hotel seems designed for small groups and business travellers rather than larger groups so it has a more sophisticated but relaxed feel about it compared with other hotels we stayed at in Morocco. Entry is at street level but reception is on 2nd floor. You often need to change lifts to get to the upper floors which sometimes can make it a bit slow.    The room was a reasonable size with space to spread out our luggage. It was sunny during the day but very dark during sleep time. We were some distance from the lifts at the back of the hotel but this was not really a problem. The bed was comfortable. The room had an open style bathroom with only the shower and the toilet in closed spaces. This resulted in us having limited space to hang our hand washing a necessary task when on long trips and the laundry prices were big city prices. Many other rooms have separate bathrooms so it might be worth asking for one of these.    Breakfast was buffet style with an extensive cold selection and a more limited hot selection although there was a crepe and omelette station. We also had a drink in the bar which was a bit smoky but the atmosphere was good. We did not use the pool but it looked quite inviting if the weather had been warmer.

Hotel_Name: Radisson Blu Hotel, Marrakech Carre Eden
Review_Date: Adrian C wrote a review Apr 2018
Review_Text: Usually you will book for a Riad type of hotel. However this is a better contrast to the city. Excellent service perfect location (mid-distance between Majorelle Gardens and Koutoubia Mosque) a oasis of modernism. Perfect pool with warmed water. Live music. Good neighborhood (shops restaurants safe). Good rooms with a nice view to the pool. Excellent wi-fi

Hotel_Name: Radisson Blu Hotel, Marrakech Carre Eden
Review_Date: Henry Y wrote a review Apr 2018
Review_Title: Nice Room Good Location, Friendly Service
Review_Text: If you want a a little decent activities outside the hotel this one is right on the chic part of Mohamed V which you can‚Äôt ask for any better.    The room is of good size and elegantly decorated and the bathroom is modern trendy and spacious.    Most delightfully the staff at the concierge desk on the ground floor was extremely helpful and friendly. Almost at every occasion I needed help the staff there had always volunteered to help out. Extremely friendly and helpful.    Nice one.

Hotel_Name: Radisson Blu Hotel, Marrakech Carre Eden
Review_Title: Lovely Stay, some areas for improvement
Review_Text: We had a lovely 3 night stay. The hotel is very well located close enough to the Souk to be able to walk there but far enough away that you can enjoy a little more peace and quiet. We were a family of 4 2 adults and 2 children. We had a 2 bedroom suite which was really great with a lovely lounge and wrap around balcony facing onto the street (was well insulated so no noise disturbance). I applaud the hotel on letting us check in early and also check out late their flexibility was greatly appreciated. I do think though the reception could do a better job selling the facilities of the hotel we were left sitting for 10 minutes waiting for our room keys and then we were handed them without any explanation of breakfast wifi the pool the spa. We only received the information on requesting it. Bottled water is provided by the bed every evening which is nice I would really recommend that this is provided on arrival as well. We had a couple of small issues with our room the reception staff promptly called the housekeeping manager who came promptly and fixed them which was great. We had lunch each day at the hotel restaurant food was good service was mixed depending on who you had serving you there are a lot of stagaires floating around who don't seem to be given much guidance on what to do. One server was excellent Zakia (I think was her name) she was our first server and by far the best one. The service by the pool was very poor the gentleman taking drinks orders (dressed in a poolboy uniform) was very grumpy and unhelpful. 4 times I had to ask for a towel. Difficult to order drinks shortage of umbrellas. Breakfast was ok not bad not the best I have ever had the breakfast bar doesn't seem to be replenished too often in the last hour of service cups are running out tables are not being reset coffee is poor. You see what appear to be managers (dressed in blazers) walking around talking to staff but you don't honestly feel their contact with guests to understand how the stay is going if anything can be done etc. In spite of my negative remarks we had a very enjoyable stay I recommend this hotel and hope some of the service issues get addressed.

Hotel_Name: Radisson Blu Hotel, Marrakech Carre Eden
Review_Title: Amazing hotel, very modern with good food
Review_Text: Pros :  - Great food for all day dining and especially breakfast.  - Amazing quite swimming pool great for all ages and adults.  - Rooms are kept very clean and we recommend the family suite which is very spacious and great for families of 4      Cons:    - staff were unfriendly and always said no they would never open a door for you and only did the bare minimum requirements for their job. I was disappointed with the service.

Hotel_Name: Radisson Blu Hotel, Marrakech Carre Eden
Review_Text: We stayed there over the long easter weekend and the hotel itself was perfectly fine for a city hotel with a decent room breakfast selection and pool.    However the reason I am downrating in so much is the rip off excursion that was misadvertised. They sold us a WHOLE day trip to the atlas mountains for 500dhr per person (5 of us so approximately 200 quid in total). What this turned out to be was a 45 minute car journey with a car driver who didn't speak english to a point in the mountains where our driver just dropped us and didn't tell us where we were. He then asked us to pay another man to guide us around a trail. We couldn't have done this ourselves as he dropped us away from the trail. Then at the end at approximately 1pm he said in broken english/french that he was taking us back to the hotel. So we essentially paid 200 pounds for a half NOT FULL day excursion with no guide. Poor excuse for concierge service and therefore DO NOT BOOK ANY EXCURSIONS THROUGH THIS HOTEL

Hotel_Name: Radisson Blu Hotel, Marrakech Carre Eden
Review_Date: Azamat Z wrote a review Apr 2018
Review_Text: Nice rooms however everything is extremely slow.  Only 2 persons on reception desk per one guest registration can take tons of minutes. Plus had an issue payed for room in one day and next day they say i didn‚Äôt event i had a receipt. So it took half an hour for them to re approve that i actually did. Wouldn‚Äôt recommend. If location matters then go for it other thins like service prices not worth for it.

Hotel_Name: Radisson Blu Hotel, Marrakech Carre Eden
Review_Text: An excellent hotel in a great location in gueliz just a 25 minute walk to the medina. Luxuriously appointed modern rooms were very comfortable and equipped with all the amenities you might expect. The live music in the bar in the evenings is a welcome bonus. Perhaps the best feature though was the heated swimming pool -invaluable when the weather isn‚Äôt quite so hot. My only complaint was that food menu was somewhat limited for vegetarians.

Hotel_Name: Radisson Blu Hotel, Marrakech Carre Eden
Review_Text: New hotel and it may still have some oddities but overall a super location near a great mall in case you need something Western. I‚Äôd highly recommend men try The Barber Shop in the Carr√© Eden mall. The prices of food and beverage can be upscale. There are some great restaurants like Mamma Mia and Le Loft right down the block.

Hotel_Name: Radisson Blu Hotel, Marrakech Carre Eden
Review_Date: Olga P wrote a review Apr 2018
Review_Text: I stayed in this hotel for 3 days for a big corporate event. During this time hotel personnel entered my room though "Do not disturb" sign was placed. In the end my earrings were stolen. Though the room cost 283 euro/night and we relied on so-called famous hotel name no guarantee that you are safe. Everything depends on attitude. The hotel staff does not care about their guests. AVOID RADISSON!

Hotel_Name: Radisson Blu Hotel, Marrakech Carre Eden
Review_Text: Stayed here for a few days and i loved it!  our room was very spacious and the bed was so relaxing plus breakfast was good also.  staff are very welcoming and kind.No complaints from me just the first night we came there was a bit of a mix up but after that i did not experience any problems what so ever.  P.S location is perfect right in the city centre

Hotel_Name: Radisson Blu Hotel, Marrakech Carre Eden
Review_Text: great hotel amazing service night shift staff super professonal Ahmed Said Samir..Guest services amazing Siham she knows great places and amazing restaurants..best hotel in town with best amenities and Spa.

Hotel_Name: Radisson Blu Hotel, Marrakech Carre Eden
Review_Date: Dave T wrote a review Mar 2018
Review_Text: Spent a week here on Business.    Central location makes it perfect for walking around Gueliz and dining choices.    Ouafae (Wafa) at the Front Desk was a blessing when it came to our endless questions and room requests....Just ask for ""Number 9" and she will be there with a smile and a laugh    Three minor "gripes"....    1 - The panhandlers out front are ridiculous - The Security do a fantastic job of dispersing them but you will get surrounded if you stop for more than a moment outside the door.    2 - The Walkthrough shower - Beautiful shower.....horrible drain. Every.Single.Day the bathroom flooded. It's a marble floor so it turns into a skating rink within 30 seconds of starting your shower. You will use ALL your towels to avoid sliding across the flooded bathroom.....and you will be back at the front desk asking Ouafae (Wafa) for more towels and apologizing for the flood...    3 - The bathroom door will not stay closed. This is probably due to being warped from the routine flooding from the shower.    Now that the "gripes" are out of the way....    Would I stay there again? Absolutely.    The staff were FANTASTIC. From Housekeeping to the Concierges to the Security to the waitstaff at Lila's....WELL DONE!!!    A special thanks to Kamal for literally running through the halls to help me check out!!    (side note.....check out Le Catanzaro and Mamma Mia for dinner while you are staying here!!)

Hotel_Name: Radisson Blu Hotel, Marrakech Carre Eden
Review_Title: Stayed here during a Yoga Retreat
Review_Text: I stayed at the Radisson Blu as part of a yoga retreat to Morocco. I loved the peaceful feeling of this hotel in the middle of Marrakech which can be quite hectic. The rooms were beautiful and while I wish I had a queen bed instead of two twin beds it was very comfortable and had a nice balcony that looked out into the street. The hotel gym was huge and great for getting a workout in during your travels. We had daily breakfast at the hotel and it was extensive and delicious. Tons of options that were both healthy and decadent. I ate dinner at the hotel bar one night and it was pretty good although service at the restaurant for dinner was SO slow so beware. The pool was gorgeous and I enjoyed practicing yoga poolside daily each morning. This hotel is a nice safe clean luxurious option for anyone traveling to Marrakech.

Hotel_Name: Radisson Blu Hotel, Marrakech Carre Eden
Review_Date: Drew D wrote a review Mar 2018
Review_Text: My wife and I stayed here for 3 months while on a business trip to Marrakech. English is maybe the 4th language spoken in Morocco. While it would have certainly helped if either of us spoke French or Arabic the staff was very accommodating. They always treated us with a smile and would go out of the way to attend to any of our needs. The front desk and the management all spoke english very well. If we asked anyone else for something and they didn't understand us they would reappear in a few moments with someone who could translate for them. The staffs always presented themselves with a great attitude and truly wanted to ensure that we were taken care of. Our housekeeper Hasna was outstanding. Being westerners we were use to a few items that were not normal (top sheet for a bed). She not only delivered on every item in which we requested but every time she cleaned our room she remembered and brought fresh items with her. I wish I could take her on all my travels.

Hotel_Name: Radisson Blu Hotel, Marrakech Carre Eden
Review_Date: Rosie H wrote a review Mar 2018
Review_Text: Stayed here for 4 nights over a long weekend. Hotel is centrally located in new part of the city but close to many of the sights. Very comfortable room with large bathroom.
