Staff were very helpful and attentive. The swimming pool whilst not large was lovely and warm with plenty of loungers around. We were on a B&B basis and the breakfast was excellent a huge choice of hot and cold foods. We only ate in the hotel for lunch on 1 day but that was very good too albeit a little pricey compared to some of the restaurants nearby.  The hop on hop off tourist bus - which at ¬£13.50pp for a 2 day ticket is excellent value - has a stop right outside the front door.  Would thoroughly recommend this hotel.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Hotel_Name: Radisson Blu Hotel, Marrakech Carre Eden
Review_Date: Marion K wrote a review Mar 2018
Review_Text: The hotel is located in the beautiful new city of Marrakech. Very Nice garden and pool. Rooms are very spacious and nice balcony. Staff of the hotel super friendley very high service and the food was top of the bill.  The staff Made us feel so welcome we have visited a lot of african countries but they where excellent
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple
Reviewer_Location: Addo Elephant National Park, South Africa

Hotel_Name: Radisson Blu Hotel, Marrakech Carre Eden
Review_Text: My wife and I stayed here together with our 5 months old daughter and enjoyed our stay to the fullest. At check-in we were upgraded to a business room with Pool view provided by a nice baby cot and on top of this the service was second to none. Everyone was very nice and friendly (especially baby friendly). Breakfast was great and the hotel gym has everything you look for. The location is also the best in town. We would happily go back and stay here again.

Hotel_Name: Radisson Blu Hotel, Marrakech Carre Eden
Review_Text: Absolutely beautiful hotel. New so the taxi drivers may not be sure where it is but just show the address. Super clean beautiful rooms and the HEATED outdoor pool is a huge plus.    There‚Äôs is live music in the lounge every evening and it is of an excellent standard. Located in the nicer part of town we enjoyed going back after wandering in the hot souks of the Medina. It takes about 20 minutes to walk to the Medina or a taxi is about 30 dirhams.    Peaceful and classy. I will definitely be returning. Would definitely recommend.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Hotel_Name: Radisson Blu Hotel, Marrakech Carre Eden
Review_Date: Mattias M wrote a review Feb 2018
Review_Title: Best value for money hotel in Marrakech
Review_Text: Very nice hotel. Hotel up to high standards nice rooms very good facilities restaurant lobby and bars all with a nice ambiance and good food.    I stayed at many hotels in Marrakech during the years but this is today clearly the best one .    Very well situated and easy access. The hotel is of international standard and not very ‚ÄúMoroccan ‚Äú if your like the touch of Morocco and ancient Marrakesh you should choose a Riad in the Medina but if not this is the place to relax after a day in the red city.    Ask for a room overlooking the pool area if you want the best view.

Hotel_Name: Radisson Blu Hotel, Marrakech Carre Eden
Review_Date: Rebecca N wrote a review Feb 2018
Review_Text: Beautiful hotel very friendly and helpful staff. In a great location about 20 minutes walk to the medina. The room was lovely very clean with view of the pool. Breakfast had a great selection of food and drinks and the lunch/ dinner food was good too.    We really enjoyed our stay here and would love to come back!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Hotel_Name: Radisson Blu Hotel, Marrakech Carre Eden
Review_Date: Geoffrey H wrote a review Feb 2018
Review_Text: The hotel is situated in a very attractive part of Marrakech.  A busy commercial area.  We arrived as a party of 37.  Within a few seconds of our arrival we were handed our room keys-very efficient.  Our room was very well appointed with a covered balcony overlooking the Main Street.  The bathroom was very spacious with a large walk in shower and separate WC (unusual in Morocco).  A large flatscreen tv was great but very few English language stations.  Bed was comfortable but pillows were a little soft.  The Swimming Pool although outside is steaming hot in Winter and most attractively situated.  We breakfasted in the Conference Centre which was situated in pleasant surroundings.  Check out was very efficient with all bags carried by efficient smiling staff.  All in all a very comfortable hotel and one I‚Äôd be very happy to return to.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Hotel_Name: Radisson Blu Hotel, Marrakech Carre Eden
Review_Date: Nancy L wrote a review Feb 2018
Review_Text: I was really pleased with the Radisson Blu in Marrakech. The staff including Ahmed the night manager couldn't be more helpful. The only issue I had with my room was the distance to the elevator and the staff made every effort to change the room. The room was clean and comfortable and I'd go back again without thinking twice about it.

Hotel_Name: Radisson Blu Hotel, Marrakech Carre Eden
Review_Text: Excellent location - shops/cafes/restaurants/ all within immediate walking distance. Good heated pool at the hotel. Hotel staff very polite and always available to help. Good hotel security inside and out. Superb rooms all clean and fresh. Iron/ironing board/kettle/safe all in room. Hotel can arrange all transfers to and from airport taking out the headache of bartering with cabs.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Hotel_Name: Radisson Blu Hotel, Marrakech Carre Eden
Review_Date: Denise J wrote a review Feb 2018
Review_Text: Weeks stay at such a fabulous hotel  Staff on every level are so friendly and always happy non stop making everyone and everything such an amazing experience thank you so much loved the breakfast restaurant and bar heated swimming pool and outdoor lounge area are fantastic this is right next to the shopping malls and in the heart of everything we where on floor 3 rooms are welcoming so comfortable and of high standard tea and coffee free in rooms hairdryer bathing products robes and slippers bed and pillows are cozy and comfy and rooms are very clean sound proof no noise heard at all would highly recommend for comfort and location can‚Äôt wait to  come back free wifi throughout hotel and in rooms did not lose connection once really good gym and the staff and spa are outstanding  Thank you to all staff for making our stay feel fantastic and so comfortable

Hotel_Name: Radisson Blu Hotel, Marrakech Carre Eden
Review_Title: Even if the i stated clearly at time of reservation: I ll come because of my birthday.........
Review_Text: Room with very small bath-tub (3058) one day Water leekeage from room above (no excuse or give-away or what ever....) avoid this room anyway due to an exsisting connecting door....could hear in first night neighbours Alarm clock later on the hair-dryer .......no good sleep at all.........continuing with Sunday gathering in front of my terrace :( no peace.....no silence :( ........Hole Hotel is on TOP of a Shoppingcenter if u haeve a room facinf the inner-court u r lucky maybe quiet........Lot of Staff always friendly but N O M A N A G E R or even the GM around .......in 4 DAYS IF NEVER SEEN HIM IN ANY OUTLET :( -----and also no Birthdaycard or whatever------the only Thing a Little cake from the Restaurant-Manager/CREW served in room after i was back from BAR in my room........BREAKFAST - Selection TOP but by far too dark you Need a torch at 7 o clock to see what you take from the Buffet and all the plate are positioned on fragile ground ( what for ????) ALL in one I could have the same in AGADIR for the half Price and also excellent Service.......maybe the courtyard and very cold unusual weather did the rest :( ! Even so thanks to the wonderfull Bar Manager TARIK from Room Service and all the staff who made my stay an enjoyable one and will remember me :) VIE/HKG !!!!

Hotel_Name: Radisson Blu Hotel, Marrakech Carre Eden
Review_Title: OK and of interest to sabbath observers
Review_Text: First the hotel: Nice enough but you must be on a business level floor if you want a full bathroom all in one place. Clean but if I did not have to be walking distance to certain places on Saturday I would have stayed somewhere else. The staff could not be more friendly. The food was plentiful and good but the elevators are incredibly slow you have to switch elevators to get from ground level to your room unless you are lucky enough to catch one that goes to the upper floors. It is situated on top of a mall is walking distance (within 20-25 minutes) to the square the Marjorelle Gardens and YSL museum and other places of interest. Being on the business level floor does not get you a lounge but it will make your stay more pleasant. Those rooms are not all the same so be sure to ask about the things that matter to you (balcony? size of room?) before you book. On a less important note don't skip the desserts. they are fabulous.

Hotel_Name: Radisson Blu Hotel, Marrakech Carre Eden
Review_Date: Naz H wrote a review Jan 2018
Review_Text: I booked this hotel months in advance for my sisters 30th Birthday. I had several email communications with Insaf in reservations and Siham from the guest relations team they were very helpful prior to our arrival. The staff made arrangements for every request I had for this special occasion. On arrival at the airport we were greeted by the hotel driver Abdul in a luxury car. He held a sign saying Happy Birthday to my sister. He is extremely polite and knowledgeable. I would recommend booking transfers with the hotel as it's very reasonably priced and hassle free. Upon arrival at the hotel our room was beautifully decorated with balloons towel design decor on the bed a wonderful birthday cake and a gift for my sisters birthday. Each of our requests were dealt with and we had a comfortable stay. I would like to thank all the staff who we communicated with and whom made this stay exceptional. I would like to also specially thank Abdul our driver reception staff Sonia Jamal Mohammed and all the bell boys to include Kamal. Not to forget the guest relations team Siham who organised and planned everything months in advance and Loubna who assisted us during our stay. Finally a big thank you to the restaurant team who served us during breakfast and dinner. We loved the food and the whole experience. All the best!

Hotel_Name: Radisson Blu Hotel, Marrakech Carre Eden
Review_Date: Seb T wrote a review Jan 2018
Review_Text: I visited marakesh for the Weekend i have lots of friends in the city so booked this huge 60m2 apartment.was disappointed my friends were not able to visit me in my huge apartment they discriminate their own people.non of my friends were aloud inside for drinks even if the apartment could hold 5 people. Never again it felt like prison. Next time i get airb&b in never came across that sort of discrimination i had massive appartment but couldn't bring my friends for drinks had to meet them outside on the street.

Hotel_Name: Radisson Blu Hotel, Marrakech Carre Eden
Review_Title: a special place with special people
Review_Text: Loved the hotel . Central town location beautiful rooms and well kept grounds. Town centre hotel set amongst shops and cafes in the Carre Eden quarter. Easy walk or taxi to the medina etc..  Special thanks to a wonderful staff who made our stay memorable. All the staff managed always to be welcoming and pleasant. They always had time to chat about our day give advice on where and how and a gentle enquiry regarding our enjoyment. Wonderful.  Great food too usual massive Radisson breakfasts and evening fine dining in a la carte restaurant. Special mentions to Loubna Eddaoudi of guest relations who was able to say yes to some special requests for us and to Moussab Asmame whose experience and expertise in the restaurant made each meal special.  A special place with very special people!!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Hotel_Name: Radisson Blu Hotel, Marrakech Carre Eden
Review_Date: Saad Abid wrote a review Jan 2018
Review_Text: When i checked in i thought it was gonna be noisy because of the location (next to a mall) but i was wrong. the rooms are very confortable the architecture is modern the staff is welcoming. the designer thought about making cool outfits for them.  The food is excellent and the pool is original. I would recommend this hotel for people who want to stay in a classy place in the heart of Marrakech.

Hotel_Name: Radisson Blu Hotel, Marrakech Carre Eden
Review_Date: S√∏ren F wrote a review Jan 2018
Review_Text: Top Service and quality. Everything was as expected in such a luxury Hotel. In the Center for Marrakech. All balconies toward the green Garden and the swimmingpool. You cannot hear the traffic from the street

Hotel_Name: Radisson Blu Hotel, Marrakech Carre Eden
Review_Text: I and my wife stayed here.    We were completely happy. From the doormen to the security to the restaurant staff to the room attendants. Everywhere we went the service and courtesy shown was impeccable.    We requested a late check out. It was granted.    We requested Sushi which wasn‚Äôt on the dinner menu. It was granted. Perhaps because as we asked the Chef was walking by who was more than happy to accommodate our request. And wow what a presentation came out. I do not remember the Chefs name but thank you sir.    I requested a single AAA battery (almost not granted). Granted.    Overall - the gym the spa the restaurant the bar the staff the entire grounds for me was perfect.    The only one issue I had was in the bar smoking is permissible as it is in many establishments but because of it I did not sit in the bar area therefore could not enjoy the entertainment the hotel had ever night.    I thought smoking indoors was banned I guess not.    I would definitely stay here again and definitely recommend it to others.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Hotel_Name: Radisson Blu Hotel, Marrakech Carre Eden
Review_Title: This was a great experience - overall.
Review_Text: As a journalist ‚Äì i always start with the critical: the guard outside the hotel seems hostile until they know who you are ‚Äì it stretches down. The room service is good; but too slow in the restaurant in the evening. The food is ok no more. The patio in the back yard is big but the pool seems dirty. But a perfect place to have a glas of wine and relax.    What draws the whole experience was the room. We have one of the corner rooms located on the top floor. A huge room with 50 meters balcony. Large surfaces with beautiful decoration. A large bathroom and a delicate shower room. All rooms have a door to the balcony. This is the nicest room I have ever experienced in Marrakech.It is very attentive to you and it gives a good feeling.    Service wise and with the BIG players like Grand Central Hotel in Barcelona The New York Palace and the Thief in Oslo and others Raddison in Europe - unfortunately this is not entirely world class. It's too tired and needs a heart from the staff. Its management fellows.    But I would love to go back here - to discover more from the what the hotel offers. Hania.

Hotel_Name: Radisson Blu Hotel, Marrakech Carre Eden
Review_Date: Khokho B wrote a review Jan 2018
Review_Text: We went there at different times of the day and were never disappointed. What a nice staff working there especially at night from their very mannered security guys who would call the elevator for you and hold it until you exit it to their servers. At night we just sit at their very comfortable table couches and feel as if we were at home in our living rooms to enjoy either the live music or the DJ music. Their servers ladies like Bouchra and Khaoula were super nice and real classy professionals. We just love that place as a whole it was fancy clean and very respectful.

Hotel_Name: Radisson Blu Hotel, Marrakech Carre Eden
Review_Date: Fedoua M wrote a review Jan 2018
Review_Text: It was our first time to stay in this hotel and it did not disappoint us! The service was excellent by all staff the rooms were extremely clean and comfortable with a beautiful pool viewand the location is perfect! Located near the carr√© Eden Mall and most popular caf√©s and restaurants which is very convenient. Taxi stand is just opposite the hotel. If you love playing tennis table they have it available there. If you want to travel to Marrakech without hassle book in this hotel it will make your stay smooth and more enjoyable thanks to its location and accessibility. Will definitely be back!

Hotel_Name: Radisson Blu Hotel, Marrakech Carre Eden
Review_Text: I took my friend for cocktails had been before and had nothing but good things to say. The service was non-existent this time even although very few customers. We gave up and ordered at the bar 2 Margaritas. They were dreadful both tasted of soap and very little alcohol. I took them back and stayed to watch the replacements being made. These were dreadful. We ordered white wine and this was room temperature. Gave up completely at this point! Such a shame as I love this hotel.

Hotel_Name: Radisson Blu Hotel, Marrakech Carre Eden
Review_Date: Mahmoud A wrote a review Jan 2018
Review_Text: The hotel has a good location nearby restaurants cafes and shopping 10 mins walking from Sahal Alfanaa and very close to a lot of historical sightseeing  The breakfast has a lot of varieties the staff are friendly

Hotel_Name: Radisson Blu Hotel, Marrakech Carre Eden
Review_Date: Cal Sharp wrote a review Jan 2018
Review_Text: Booked Radisson as I have visited many others and always found them excellent. No exception here room was great breakfast super selection and nice pool although could do with a few more sun loungers as it gets busy. Staff generally helpful but as with the whole of Marrakesh mainly attentive to people who speak french or moroccan.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Hotel_Name: Radisson Blu Hotel, Marrakech Carre Eden
Review_Date: Traster T wrote a review Jan 2018
Review_Text: I had a really great time at the Radisson Blu in Marrakech. I‚Äôm sorry I only stayed two nights. I was lucky to get an upgrade to a junior suite and had a huge fruit plate a plate of pastries and a plate of chocolates waiting for me. Then I found a complimentary Blutooth speaker waiting for me as well on my bed!    I ate a couple of times by the pool and the food was good although I would have preferred a few more Moroccan dishes on the menu.    The staff were all very friendly and helpful. Thanks especially to Sonia who checked me out quickly and efficiently when the lobby was full of guests who had just finished lunch!    There is a live band in the bar each night. The hotel is situated right in the modern part of the city and all the usual culprits are here: Starbucks McDonalds H&M - even Nespresso! Yet the wonderful sights sounds and smells of the Souk are a short taxi drive away.    Ancient and Modern side by side.

Hotel_Name: Radisson Blu Hotel, Marrakech Carre Eden
Review_Title: Great hotel in a fab location!
Review_Text: There are lots of luxury / 5 star hotels in Marrakech and of course you can go for the ultimate luxurious hotels / riads / resorts if your budget allow. If not Radisson Blu is a fantastic 5 star hotel and we thoroughly enjoyed our stay there 2017 year-end. Room was spacious bright well appointed and equipped. Loved the bathroom which was huge.    Breakfast buffet has plenty of choices and is the best throughout the hotels we stayed in Morocco this trip (Casablanca Fez Rabat Chefchauoen).    I'd totally stay at the same hotel (unless prices for the luxury hotels become more affordable) next time we're in Marrakech.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Hotel_Name: Radisson Blu Hotel, Marrakech Carre Eden
Review_Text: We had a very adventurous Stay at the Radisson in Marrakech. The Stay was one of the most interesting stays I 've ever had in a hotel. The staff were really nice and courteous and available to resolve any issues we had. We were there for our 10th year anniversary  they made a special cake for us and also hosted us to dinner at their restaurant. The restaurant Manager was really kind and made sure he reserved a table for us every night the live band performed. The Deputy Manager Rasheed was awesome. Having worked myself for over 17yrs I can tell you that the staff in this place are very professional. Thank you guys!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Hotel_Name: Radisson Blu Hotel, Marrakech Carre Eden
Review_Date: Gergely A wrote a review Jan 2018
Review_Text: I stayed here for 4 nights in December - all in all great experience for business travelers and for leisure. The location and views from the rooms are stunning the rooms themselves very clean and flawless. Bathroom is perfect nice and new shower all fine.  The breakfast is great many options and of super quality!  There are few restaurants close to the hotel all can be recommended.  All in all I enjoyed the comfort of this hotel very much.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Hotel_Name: Radisson Blu Hotel, Marrakech Carre Eden
Review_Date: Juliette S wrote a review Dec 2017
Review_Text: Superb hotel away from the busy Medina but near enough to walk in or get a quick taxi. Near to Majorelle Gardens and good restaurants around. Lovely rooms breakfast and pool. Helpful staff Ahmed Night Manager was great at the checkout and everyone was very smiley and charming.

Hotel_Name: Radisson Blu Hotel, Marrakech Carre Eden
Review_Title: An excellent hotel surrounds the Garden of Eden!
Review_Text: We enjoyed our ten days at the Radisson Blu Carre Eden very much.  The hotel was excellent with very clean roomsa lovely patio and a frequently used swimming pool.We will also recommend the lovely spa.  The security was also well maintained.  The breakfast was absolutely delicious with an enormous variety of foodand we also enjoyed our lunch in the Garden restaurantLila.  The staff at the hotel displayed a professional behaviourand were at all times servicemindedpolite and smiling.  We will especially mention the General Managerwho took the time to greet usand was always busy making sure everything was in order.  Jamal at the Front Deskand the two ladies Ilham and Zakia in the breakfast room were exceptionally kindhearted.  Will certainly choose this hotel on our next visit to Marracechand can highly recommend it to other visitors.

Hotel_Name: Radisson Blu Hotel, Marrakech Carre Eden
Review_Text: Gorgeous hotel amazing location and stay  All staf were kind and helpful I remember Lobna I think she was from guest relation department she was friendly and helpful  Overall it was agreat experince I‚Äôm looking forward to visiting this hotel again .

Hotel_Name: Radisson Blu Hotel, Marrakech Carre Eden
Review_Date: Alaa A wrote a review Dec 2017
Review_Text: It was a great experience to me and my friends we enjoyed our time in a 4 days trip the staff were friendly especially Loubna the guest relation manager looking forward to visiting Radisson blu Marrakesh the soonest.

Hotel_Name: Radisson Blu Hotel, Marrakech Carre Eden
Review_Date: Anderson S wrote a review Dec 2017
Review_Text: The staff at the Radisson were very professional and helpful. From Lubna at the reception who was very helpful and Mosabe Asmane whose Service was super and had a very welcoming and amazing personality. Also Safa and Saha were very good. Beautiful hotel with amazing people. Very much recommend it.

Hotel_Name: Radisson Blu Hotel, Marrakech Carre Eden
Review_Text: Honestly the best service I have ever received. Came for lunch and stayed till dinner thanks to mosaab asmane and safa sa7a ...I would recommend this amazing people from reception lubna to everyone involved. Till next time :)

Hotel_Name: Radisson Blu Hotel, Marrakech Carre Eden
Review_Date: Lounes L wrote a review Dec 2017
Review_Text: Thanks to all the hotel team members  very welcoming and always available !  With specific thanks to Mr Ahmed (Night manager) for his precious support and advises !  I will be pleased to be back again  Lounes

Hotel_Name: Radisson Blu Hotel, Marrakech Carre Eden
Review_Date: Originally Morocco Mustapha D wrote a review Dec 2017
Review_Text: Great location in the new section of the city very comfortable rooms very good cuisine offering nice fresh food either for coffee break lunch and dinner. Very good meeting faculties staff vey helpful & professional as well.

Hotel_Name: Radisson Blu Hotel, Marrakech Carre Eden
Review_Date: Hussain M wrote a review Dec 2017
Review_Text: I was in Radisson Blu in month of Oct to attend FPS AGM.    We had a good time in the hotel. It is centrally located with near by malls n food chain.    Rooms are clean and good but I had back side room with opposite bldg view.    They have nice bar at pool side with live music. Staff's are friendly.

Hotel_Name: Radisson Blu Hotel, Marrakech Carre Eden
Review_Date: Neeraj A wrote a review Dec 2017
Review_Text: The location of the hotel is amazing. It's right in the center of downtown. To add to it the service here is amazing and everyone is on their toes to give you good service. The breakfast is great too with a good number of food and drink choices. Great pool as well to add to it ! Totally recommend !

Hotel_Name: Radisson Blu Hotel, Marrakech Carre Eden
Review_Text: Pros -  Nice interiors and pool area  Friendly staff  Good location  Cons-  Room is not cleaned on time daily  Reception tried to overcharge me for my room  Spa tried to overcharge us for our treatments  Room service takes a year to reach your room  Food from room service always arrived cold  No toiletries or toilet paper in our room  No English TV as promised - BBC did not work    It really takes a lot for me to leave a negative review but this hotel is just not a five star and it needs a lot of adjustments.    There are much nicer hotels in the area - Don't waste your money and end up constantly annoyed like we were for out trip.    P.S. The Hotel Manager sorted SOME of our issues but only on our last day and 24 hours after I was told a member of staff would come to our room to assist with our problems.

Hotel_Name: Radisson Blu Hotel, Marrakech Carre Eden
Review_Text: Great stay in this hotel. I already came to this hotel. I go there often as this is the besr hotel I have tried in the city.  Well located next to great restaurants.  Heated pool; much appreciated.  The breakfast is huge with a great choice of breds or anything you want.  Fresh orange juice.  Rooma are lovely

Hotel_Name: Radisson Blu Hotel, Marrakech Carre Eden
Review_Title: Great Hotel, excellent location, super staff.
Review_Text: We had really wanted to stay in a Riad but the choice was overwhelming. The thing that put us off was the fact that guests kept saying how hard it was to find this or that Riad. In the end we decided to go for the more well known brands about a mile from the Medina. We knew we were close to a shopping centre but we didn‚Äôt realise that we were actually above the centre itself. We were in room 4010 and although we could hear the band if an evening time it generally finished around 11. The staff were all incredibly welcoming and helpful and the food (we only ate breakfast) was superb. Cannot fault the breakfasts at all - even though it was November is was warm enough to eat outside we were so full we didn‚Äôt need any lunch. Our room was great - plenty of room and storage. Some comments have been made about the showers (there is a big overhead shower and a smaller one about chest/waist high) but we had no problems at all. Each had a different use. The pool area (being on top of a shopping centre wasn‚Äôt the most attractive) but we liked it the outside drinks/restaurant area was attractively lit of a night time. It was a super location. We would walk out of a night and it was like being in Oxford St there were simply thousands of people strolling. There were a number of very good restaurants close by and a taxi to the medina was 50dhm. We took a taxi to the Jardin Marjorelle and it cost 20 dhm. The biggest negative for us was the cost of drinks and food (drinks even soft ones cost a lot!). A small lager was around ¬£7 and a bottle of water ¬£5. Gin started at ¬£11. There is a carrefour in the shopping centre so we popped in there and bought our goodies from there. All in all we would definitely stay there again the staff were all very attentive and the rooms kept spotless.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Hotel_Name: Radisson Blu Hotel, Marrakech Carre Eden
Review_Date: arun c wrote a review Nov 2017
Review_Title: A heady mix of Berber and French cultures!
Review_Text: We have been to Marrakech several times and in the past have stayed in various hotels. However this time we decided to stay in the heart of the city.    We were amazed when we were upgraded to a suite by Khalid on the reception desk. He was most helpful and represented all that Berber hospitality is all about.    The suite was huge as was its wet room. Most rooms looked down upon the infinity swimming pool.    Room service was prompt although the in room dining menu was restricted.    The turndown service and room cleaning service was superb. There was no shortage of water or that of the coffee capsules for the Nespresso coffee machine in the room.    Breakfast was a bit of a let down though. Although the omelette station produced the desired quality of omelettes the fried eggs were dry with broken yolk. The small sausages were hard and tasteless. They could have provided a wider range of fresh fruits for a country like Marrakech for eg. Pomegranates which they grow in abundance but it was conspicuous by its absence! However the presence of Ilham in the restaurant restored what it lacked in its quality of food offerings. She was gracious welcoming and could not do enough for all who entered her domain! An asset to this hotel!    The security provided by the hotel was refreshingly uncompromising! There were these men in black suits across the main entrances to the hotel.    Beer was expensive at around ¬£8 a glass.    Concierge services and the reception staff were polite and professional but the one touch staff responding to calls could be a little more polite on the phone.    The hotel is well located for those who wish to be in the centre of commerce and the city‚Äôs tourist attraction.    All in all it is a great place to be knowing the least you would get is the Radisson quality.

Hotel_Name: Radisson Blu Hotel, Marrakech Carre Eden
Review_Title: Nice hotel but small pool and service in restaurant average
Review_Text: I stayed 4 nights here in November and found the hotel to be very modern with clean and comfortable with good facilities. Service was good everywhere apart from the single restaurant in the hotel.    The hotel is located about a 20-30 minute walk from the main square in the Medina. A taxi ride costs around 20 dirhams. There are plenty of cafes and restaurants within walking distance of the hotel and the Carre Eden shopping mall is basically next to the hotel.    The check-in was quick and I was shown the pool fitness centre & restaurant which are all on the same level as the reception desks. The one frustrating thing I found during my stay was that the elevators were programmed to automatically stop at the reception level whether you were wanting to go to a lower or higher floor - this therefore wasted a bit of time each time the elevator was used.    My business room had a modern decor and was large comfortable and with all of the necessary amenities (TV tea/coffee inclduing a coffee machine kettle hairdryer safe minibar). The adjoining bathroom had a lovely large walk-in shower in a wet area - this worked well and the large space was great. The rest of the bathroom was also large with two sinks and an area with a couple of hooks to hang items. There was no bathtub although this didn't affect me. The cleaners were very thorough with their cleaning every day and replaced all of the amenities in the bathroom and bedroom.    In terms of the facilities the fitness centre had plenty of modern equipment but the outdoor pool was small with only 30 sun beds around it; whilst i visited at an off-peak time and this wasn't an issue I'm certain that if you visited during the summer months it would be difficult to find a sun bed and therefore difficult to relax by the pool. The water in the pool also didn't feel as though it was heated which would have been nice as the weather was chilly particularly in the mornings.    The single restaurant in the hotel has both indoor and outdoor seating and the outdoor seating is very comfortable with a nice ambience; breakfasts were good with a plentiful choice of fresh fruit salads cold meats cooked food (meat and vegetables) breads an egg station and fruit juices. I dined at the restaurant a couple of times of dinner and whilst the a la carte menu is not huge it has sufficient variety of foods and a nice drinks menu; the cooked meat i had was well prepared and presented. The one problem was with service during dinner - even though the restaurant was not that busy the staff were inefficient and in one case unfriendly as well; orders were taken for tables before dealing with my own ordered drink resulting in a wait time of almost 10 minutes for a single drink which is very poor (one staff member in particular was poor). Also even when you physically went to the bar to order a drink waiters would carry on with other menial tasks before finally serving resulting in a wait time of several minutes.    The hotel has free fast wifi throughout the hotel which was very useful.

Hotel_Name: Radisson Blu Hotel, Marrakech Carre Eden
Review_Text: I stayed at Radisson for six days for conference. By any measure this is one of the best hotels I stayed in my various travels within Africa. The rooms food service etc. are excellent. The conference had buffet breakfast and lunch and it was amazingly tasty and variety of foods. All staffs are attentive and provided excellent services. The room I was in was spacious with living room and two flat TVs. The bed is very comfortable and the required amenities such as coffee tea bath room supplies night gowns slippers safe iron etc. are available. The shower is very convenient for quick shower and also bath tab is available to relax. The hotel has small swimming pool bar live music band gym conference rooms etc. The hotel is located in center and surroundings you find restaurants shopping malls banks supermarkets. If I go back I will definitely stay at Radisson.

Hotel_Name: Radisson Blu Hotel, Marrakech Carre Eden
Review_Text: The stay was wenderfull and unforgettable.  The staff was helpfull and very polite.  The hotel location is great.  Food and drinks very good in the evening in the bar was lifa miusic    Thank You  Monika Kercel
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Hotel_Name: Radisson Blu Hotel, Marrakech Carre Eden
Review_Text: I stayed here for seven days for a work event. Everything in the hotel is generally well appointed (with the exception of whomever decided to put towel bars on the front of the sinks- the obviously don't shave) and the staff were extremely cordial and helpful.    The singular largest detractor was an odor in / around the rooms / hallways of the hotel. The first room they gave me reeked so badly that I asked them to re-clean it; they did and then it simply smelled of the awful odor AND cleaning detergent. They gave me another room where the odor was still present but not as "knock you down" bad. I'm not sure if it is sewer gas mildew in the carpets / carpet cleaner or some other kind of off gassing but the smell was present in the carpeted hallways of the hotel as well.

Hotel_Name: Radisson Blu Hotel, Marrakech Carre Eden
Review_Text: Our fourth stay at the Radisson Blue Marrakech Hotel. All our usual expectations were filled and even surpassed. The "yes I can" pins the staff is wearing is not only there to look fancy but really means a lot. All the staff is there to make you Feel special and be like their most important client. The breakfast is always the best you can get from a 5* hotel and the chef is just amazing. Their Josper oven is a plus. We are always amazed by the location and the quietness of the hotel: In the heart of the City (gueliz neighborhood) close to most of the touristic places (jamaa elfna koutoubia jardin majorelle YSL museum etc.) and still very cosy comfy and quiet. The terrasse around the heated swimming pool is divine. We will definetly come back.

Hotel_Name: Radisson Blu Hotel, Marrakech Carre Eden
Review_Title: A wonderful week at the Radison. 11/10
Review_Text: We have just got back from a 6 night stay at the Radisson Blu. The hotel looked amazing in the photos but was even better in real life. The location was perfect for us - plenty of places to eat nearby and above the Carre Eden Mall which was handy for a little bit of shopping. Also only a 15 minute walk to the main town square and easy to pick up a taxi to the many historical sites around Marrakech. (around 20 dihrams)    We had a lovely warm welcome from Sonia on the front desk who checked us in quickly. There was a holding fee to pay in case we used any services but when we explained that we were on a tight budget Sonia kindly agreed to waive the fee.    The hotel itself is in the newer part of town (Gueliz) and felt like a peaceful oasis away from the hustle and bustle of the rest of Marrakech. The whole hotel is very modern clean and with all the security feels very safe too. Our room was large and spacious and I loved the little touches like "Welcome to the hotel Mr Rahman" message on the TV screen as we entered our room. We stayed in room 3074 and had a pool view which was beautiful. The rainfall shower was excellent and the bed was large and comfy. The cleaning team cleaned the room thoroughly every day and gave us fresh bottles of water etc. The heated pool was lovely and the spa looked great too although we didn't have time to get a treatment there.    The staff in this hotel are superb and they really can't do enough for you. Everyone is so friendly and welcoming and made us feel at home. We were so sad to leave! We had breakfast one morning and there was a wide selection to choose from with a live egg station and plenty of fruit cereals pastries etc. There is a live band in the lounge most nights and we really enjoyed watching them play.    We absolutely loved our stay in the Radisson Blu. I would highly recommend it to anybody and if I went to Marrakech again I would definitely stay there again. Thank you to everyone for making our stay so wonderful - it exceeded our expectations.    from Mohammed and Maria  Room 3074
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Hotel_Name: Radisson Blu Hotel, Marrakech Carre Eden
Review_Date: Hicham A wrote a review Oct 2017
Review_Text: Spent 3 nights at this hotel and I can ask you to avoid the third floor!!!!  Rooms nearby the elevators are noisy because of the loud music!  And rooms from 3090 to 3100 are just horrible and I was there!üò® the kitchen is placed below and it smells very bad ü§•! I‚Äôve lost my appetite üòµ! They should fix that problem because the air conditioning apertures bring all the kitchen odors to the room!

Hotel_Name: Radisson Blu Hotel, Marrakech Carre Eden
Review_Title: Best & Most Accommodating Hotel By Far!
Review_Text: We had stayed here for 7 nights for my mothers and cousins birthday...I had reached out to the hotel and had explained both were two very big and special birthdays.  I had spoken with Zineb (who could not be any more lovely and helpful) who had arranged with the manager to upgrade our room and decorate with balloons cake flowers and so forth.  This was a huge surprise as i was just expecting a few balloons!  The staff (from the doormen to housekeeping) could not be more helpful and friendly if they tried. Adam - who works at the bar is wonderful and really looked after us all.    I highly recommend staying here if you can you wont regret it. The location is great service food cocktails and rooms. They also have live entertainment. My family had the best time.

Hotel_Name: Radisson Blu Hotel, Marrakech Carre Eden
Review_Text: Last minute decision paid off as we left our Riad in the Medina for this. Well it did not disappoint - modern big and has all the amenities we dreamt our vacation could have. Our room was overlooking the street (no noise at night) and it was interesting to people watch over the balcony while sipping a cup of tea or coffee. The room was spacious good working hot & cold shower fridge TV safe clothes rack and more more. The breakfast had a huge selection but was repetitive. On our third and fourth day breakfast didn't excite us anymore. But hey! Who would get tired of freshly squeezed orange juice and mint tea!? Dinner however on their ala carte restaurant was superb! I even decided to spend my birthday dinner here. We had steak and seafood pasta - delicious! And a sip of smooth Moroccan wine to finish the night. I was so impressed with the wait staff (I forgot her name though) because she gave me a birthday cake for free! Housekeeping were friendly and prompt. Though there were times when the room service was slow but they headed to my every request anyway. So it didn't matter. They even had a power adaptor (for our charges) available. Great ambience in the bar with bands to liven up the night. Concierge was helpful with getting around Marrakech. Transportation - accessible; Restaurants/Coffee Shops - near the place (coz its just attached to/adjacent to the mall). Overall one great vacation!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Hotel_Name: Radisson Blu Hotel, Marrakech Carre Eden
Review_Title: Great breakfast, more of a business hotel.
Review_Text: Stayed here as a couple for a few days in October. The hotel is very trendy and our room was lovely stylish with a pool view. The bed in particular was great - big and VERY comfortable. Breakfast (included) each morning was a feast! There was something for everyone! We had two or three courses most days! The pool is freezing but good for cooling off in the afternoon after a sweaty morning walking around the city. The hotel feels very business orientated lots of men in suits not many other holiday makers. Quite expensive at the bar... ¬£6 for a glass of orange juice!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Hotel_Name: Radisson Blu Hotel, Marrakech Carre Eden
Review_Date: Javier jimenez wrote a review Oct 2017
Review_Title: Service on front desk was really slow
Review_Text: We book 6 nights in two rooms  since the check in at 12:30 am really tired from the airplane and after we show at the hotel  the night staff at front desk took almost and hour to check in the 4 of us  I'll hurry him up in the nice way  telling him we are really tired and want to go sleep  his answer was so cynical saying I want to go sleep too !!!my answer was  well sorry you are at your job and we are the guest  so rude from him  and he gave us the worst room with a view of a garage and no bathroom door working and totally appositive from the elevator  any how  the neighborhood and the hotel together with inefficient treat and rude front desk treat leave us no desire to go back again  they had no idea about tourist service and the breakfast buffet was one of the worst in our 5 weeks trip  and they lift everything rigth on time even the water !!!

Hotel_Name: Radisson Blu Hotel, Marrakech Carre Eden
Review_Text: I stayed there for conference.  The hotel is high quality. There is everything you could need. Location is great and if you want to go and visit main square you can crab a taxi in the front of hotel very easily. Hotel has great pool bar and gym. They serve beer at the bar (try domestic beer called Casablanca).

Hotel_Name: Radisson Blu Hotel, Marrakech Carre Eden
Review_Text: The hotel is well located renovated with decent rooms. They got a bit too creative for my taste with the shower...but that's a minor detail compared with all other amenities.    Breakfast was outstanding.

Hotel_Name: Radisson Blu Hotel, Marrakech Carre Eden
Review_Title: The new hotel in the heart of the old city!
Review_Text: Very comfy and clean hotel with International standards. Very good food and cool entertainment throughout the week.    Make sure you get bargain with reception with you check-in for a larger sized room.  My mates and i paid the same rate and they got room twice as bigger than mine.

Hotel_Name: Radisson Blu Hotel, Marrakech Carre Eden
Review_Date: Dan S wrote a review Oct 2017
Review_Title: Ideal modern hotel for a business trip
Review_Text: I stayed at this hotel overnight on business and I was not disappointed. I was upgraded to a junior suite which is bigger than my apartment back home so space wise I had more than I knew what to do with. The beds are big and comfortable pillows are soft and plentiful and the air conditioning is quiet and did not disturb my sleep. My room had a balcony that looked out onto the pool area and in the lounge area there was a Nespresso machine for a morning coffee. Best of all rooms are completely sound proof; so not being woken at 2 am by the couple next door rolling in from a club. Decor is modern and whilst not overly 'Moroccan' there are subtle touches such as the tiling and pictures that remind you where you are. Exercise facilities are exceptional; everything you could want including the possibility of yoga or aerobic classes. They also have a Hammam which looked good but I did not have time to have a treatment. Breakfast was very good and lunch was decent although possibly a bit expensive. The white wine by the glass was dull but the gris was much better. Staff were excellent attentive and warm without being in your face and nothing was too much trouble. I appreciated the genuine-feeling greeting from everyone from the general manager to the housekeeping staff and felt genuinely well looked after. Additional features such as the glass-sided pool and live music six nights a week are a bonus and Overall I would choose this over say the Sofitel which although has a much more exciting facade is showing its age in places that matter such as the bathrooms. A really excellent choice close to the heart of Marrakech.

Hotel_Name: Radisson Blu Hotel, Marrakech Carre Eden
Review_Text: Having just spent 6 nights at this hotel with my daughter I would highly recommend it. Rooms were spacious with everything you need - iron & board kettle mini fridge hairdryer toiletries.    Staff were very helpful. Food was very good as was the breakfast with lots of choice. There's a live group in the bar several nights per week who were excellent.    Staff were constantly cleaning windows balconies etc.    Conceige were always helpful and informative    If I've got any criticism it's that there was an unpleasant smell in the corridor leading to our room coming from possibly the air vents.    There are shops and a supermarket located next to the hotel and it's very easy to get around in fact you can walk to the square very easily.    Would definitely stay at this hotel again

Hotel_Name: Radisson Blu Hotel, Marrakech Carre Eden
Review_Text: I have to say that I had a wonderful time here. From walking through the front door to leaving I was treated like a king. Everyone smiling from the wonderful selection of breakfast to just having a beer by the pool nothing was ever too much. Great service and great people all in all. The rooms where delightful clean and had an amazing view. I'd definatley come back again ! Thank you

Hotel_Name: Radisson Blu Hotel, Marrakech Carre Eden
Review_Text: Hi All PLEASE DO NOT STAY HERE! The reviews and where it was ranked pulled us in and then from the moment we arrived at the hotel we had the worst experience. The staff are rude and understaffed. We're still currently here and wanted to move to another hotel. There is no one to serve you by the pool and anytime you want anything you have to go to reception. The rooms are not cleaned properly dirty plates stay in your room. We've complained several times we're at a point of giving up. We actually leave the hotel to get good service somewhere else. Some staff don't even speak English so you have no idea what they are saying. I can't wait to go home now! This was not a holiday and has put me off ever staying at a Radissons again. PLEASE DO NOT MAKE THE SAME MISTAKE!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Hotel_Name: Radisson Blu Hotel, Marrakech Carre Eden
Review_Title: Beautiful and serene property with great food
Review_Text: We stayed for 3 nights at this property during our first ever visit to Marrakech. The hotel is well located in the city and has good access to key sites (15 minutes away by taxi but make sure to agree on the fare before boarding as taxi drivers cheat a lot and dont use the meter).    The rooms are well sized (although ours had a slight problem with the plumbing in the bathroom - but it was quickly fixed). The breakfast spread is very impressive and you need to dedicate A LOT of time to enjoy it fully :-) We also enjoyed the lunch (served by the poolside) and the dinner (served in the bar/lounge area with live band playing every night). The bartender is extremely flexible and knows his drinks! He will even prepare something off the menu (like he did for us) if you instruct him well.    All rooms face the pool. The property itself is located next to a mall so you have ease of supermarket and shopping.    The staff speaks English well (a rare feature otherwise in Morocco) but we were let down by the Concierge desk lady who tried to overcharge us for the excursion and also claimed (falsely) that the driver was English speaking.    All in all it was a satisfying stay.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Hotel_Name: Radisson Blu Hotel, Marrakech Carre Eden
Review_Title: Lux mid-range western style hotel away from the medina
Review_Text: I really enjoyed this hotel- it offers all of the comforts/luxuries of a western hotel chain when you've had your fill of RIAD scene which like a tagine is definitely to be enjoyed in Marrakech.... at some point though you just want something familiar. The beds were so comfy and the amenities including the breakfast were awesome.    Be forewarned though: my other hotel was overbooked and I called from the lobby to the Radisson Blu to see if they had availability and to confirm the rate. I then took at 10 minute car ride to this hotel to get my room and was told the price had increased by some 100 euros even though I had literally just spoken to someone. I left in both despair and disgust but something told me to check online and I booked the same room at the previously advertised rate here at Expedia. Why try to scam/rip off people coming in from off the street? When I came back the same young lady that had given me the preposterous rate came over and ask if everything was ok- ha! For that I take off one star.

Hotel_Name: Radisson Blu Hotel, Marrakech Carre Eden
Review_Date: Zeshan T wrote a review Oct 2017
Review_Text: Went for a stay in city nice location next to mall hotel was nice and clean staff very accommodating especially the concierge in helping book excursions and taxis will deffo stay again    Thank you everyone at Raddison

Hotel_Name: Radisson Blu Hotel, Marrakech Carre Eden
Review_Text: What‚Äôs Good:  1) location is OK  2)kamal the doorman & the security guy in the parking lot are very nice people  3) can‚Äôt think ü§î of anything else and I tried really hard.    What‚Äôs Bad:    1)The rooms are small and filthy they gave us a toilet with üí© stains the bed had a spider üï∑ and spiderweb underneath luckily we always check my wife freaked out    2) the toilet and the shower are so small it‚Äôs torture to use it    3) the upper shower head is stupid and it‚Äôs impossible to have shower with it the bottom one is great but the idiots mounted it at waist level üòñ    4) no hot water only warm water    5) do not disturb sign dose not mean anything here they walked in while I‚Äôm a sleep they really wanted us to have those 2 free bottles of water question to the MGR: what if the gust is in the middle of something ‚Äúprivate‚Äù and your housekeeping ignores the sign üò±    5) zero privacy  if you open the curtains for sunlight or open the balcony door for some air everyone can see inside your room even the toilet and shower hint the beg mirror next to the bathroom    6) noise all day and all night  it‚Äôs impossible to sleep here the bed was literally shacking every time the other guests closed their door or the housekeeping did here job.    Music during night time as if you‚Äôre in a club    7) if you wash your hands or brush your teeth using the sink water will be on the floor everywhere the designer is an idiot please see pictures.    Same thing with the shower too  We had to ask for more towels to keep water out of the carpet    8) OMG Parking and the elevators üò±ü§íü§ï  No need for waterboarding anymore !!  You will hate every second of your life in this place believe me!! I do üò≠    You‚Äôve got to stop by the front desk every time you want to leave the parking lot so they can give you a one time use pass then you have to stop by at the front desk leave the elevator go to another one so you can go to the parking but wait üòÇ it gets worse. There‚Äôs only one elevator to the parking and you must share it with lots people and it has to stop at every f*%#** level üò°    9) it get worse they charge you upfront for the entire stay ‚Äú I don‚Äôt mind ‚Äú then they charge you 2000 more upfront just in case you used their room service. My flight got delayed so I had to have a late check out guess what they wanted another deposit 2000 more üò≥ darn crooks !!    I‚Äôve been to a lot of hotels because of my business travels but this one hands down is ‚Äúliterally the worst hotel I‚Äôve been to in my entire life!!‚Äù

Hotel_Name: Radisson Blu Hotel, Marrakech Carre Eden
Review_Text: The room was clean and with modern decor however a very small double room.  However problems lay with the lounge/bar where the breakfast was disappointing limited range for a 5star hotel and watered down coffee.    A lot of confused employees were wondering around the reception. The pool area is very small including the swimming pool there is limited sun beds which are mostly taken since it does not provide coverage for the hotel capacity. I had to wait 30 minutes for a bottle of water and towels by the pool area! The service is very poor!    No fresh towels or soaps in the morning which is what you would expect from a so called 5* hotel!    Overall a very disappointing stay and will surely not be arriving anytime soon!

Hotel_Name: Radisson Blu Hotel, Marrakech Carre Eden
Review_Date: Nicolas Roth wrote a review Sep 2017
Review_Text: Brand new hotel in Marrakech in Gueliz a bit off the tourist track. The hotel itself is very nice with spacious rooms. There is a swimming pool and a very pleasant bar outside which makes it the perfect place to relax after a day in Marrakech.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Hotel_Name: Radisson Blu Hotel, Marrakech Carre Eden
Review_Date: J A Jaffer wrote a review Sep 2017
Review_Text: Well located  clean . Very good customer service .Stayed for 5 nights with my wife & son plus friends. Downstairs staff will arrange local taxis to sights & airport & negotiate rates.  Also hotel provides dedicated taxis.

Hotel_Name: Radisson Blu Hotel, Marrakech Carre Eden
Review_Date: Afsha A wrote a review Sep 2017
Review_Text: We spent the last week of August at this hotel and totally loved it. The service we received was amazing nothing was too much for them. The location of this hotel was perfect central to everything and only a 15 mins drive from Jemaa-al-fna. Ismail from guest services was a total credit to this hotel he sorted out all of our excursions recommended places to eat and always greeted us with a smile on his face. Hands down the very best guest services service we have ever received. If you are reading this Ismail thankyou. We had a junior suite very spacious and comfortable only thing I'd have changed was that we had the street view and would have been nicer to have the pool side view. The pillows are extremely soft which took a lot of getting use to. The breakfast was nice but 7 days of the same became a bit tiresome would have been nice to just chop and change things and offer more variety on the hot food. The staff in the whole of the hotel had excellent customer service skills. Our boys used the kids club one of the days which they enjoyed. We used the spa while we were here too the spa staff let our boys stay in the relaxation room and looked after them while we had our hamam and massage which was really good of them. All in all a fab experience wouldn't stay anywhere else if I was visiting Marrakech again.    One word of warning - when we got to the airport we were charged 250 MAD which is excessive as we only paid 70 MAD when we were leaving. So be careful of the airport taxi drivers you should only expect to pay a max of 100 MAD from the airport to this hotel

Hotel_Name: Radisson Blu Hotel, Marrakech Carre Eden
Review_Text: My husband and I stayed in Radisson Blu for 6 nights. What a wonderful hotel! Staff are extremely helpful. A special thanks to Oufae at reception. She was very pleasant well spoken and very helpful throughout our trip. Also a special mention for Mohammed and Mustafa at breakfast. Additionally Mohammed Waleed and Salah were also great and provided a wonderful service at the pool area. Always happy to help with a smile. Really good hotel facilities and an overall excellent stay. Highly recommend Radisson Blu!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Hotel_Name: Radisson Blu Hotel, Marrakech Carre Eden
Review_Title: A great place to stay with lots to do, see and eat nearby
Review_Text: We were here only 2 nights. We had a suite which was lovely. The breakfast is delicious with plenty of choice and very relaxed. The staff are very helpful. Not sure about the pool. A luxury in the middle of the city but why have two sides of the pool in glass so that all can see the bodies of those that swim. Not a pleasant site sometimes and can be embarrassing for those that swim. Just don't get that!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Hotel_Name: Radisson Blu Hotel, Marrakech Carre Eden
Review_Text: Ideally located this hotel has many facilities from an 'Aquamarine' pool to the Eden Spa. The staff are well informed and very helpful if you need an excursion they are more than happy to help!  After our original hotel booking flaked on us - we're so grateful we found Raddison Blu. They saved our trip to Marrakesh.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Hotel_Name: Radisson Blu Hotel, Marrakech Carre Eden
Review_Date: Astghik A wrote a review Aug 2017
Review_Title: The best front desk staff ever!
Review_Text: My husband and myself stayed at the hotel for 12 days in July. The hotel has a very good location nice and clean rooms very cool pool but the key asset of the hotel is it's staff especially the front desk ladies. Upon arrival to Marrakesh we have discovered that all our baggage was lost (in fact we got it back in our hometown 13 days later) one can hardly image the level of the frustration a person is facing if he hasn't been in such a situation. But the front desk ladies particularly Amina and Lubna were more than just helpful. They made us feel welcomed and home with providing extra towels changing our room with a quieter one and even coming with us to the airline office as we didn't speak Arabic or French. At the end all the hotel including the general manager was involved in our search for the baggage. I recommend this hotel as nice clean modern facility but most importantly as a place with a human touch.

Hotel_Name: Radisson Blu Hotel, Marrakech Carre Eden
Review_Date: Dean E wrote a review Aug 2017
Review_Title: Oasis from the busy streets of Marrakech
Review_Text: Rooms are great! Modern good size clean.  Aircon sometimes made our room smell like a hamburger...  Lovely decor.  Breakfast - quite a good selection. Loved the 'egg cooking station ' where you could get yummy omelette made to order.  Nice pastry selection.  Pool - great area. Refreshing water in the Morocco heat.  Only complaint is the pool chair situation. A lot of people will 'reserve' sunbeds and not actually be poolside to use them til later in the day. A common practice in Europe which is inconvenient and I personally find rude.  Not enough chairs and sunbeds for the size of the hotel.  Service poolside is not overly attentive.  Staff are friendly and they 'try' to be helpful. Generally we found Morocco to be quite relaxed with service.  Reception staff lovely. Remember your name. Booked a camel tour for us.  Reservations staff - and maybe it's a language difficulty - sometimes no response to email requests.  Highly recommend getting hotel to organise car pickup from airport for 300 Dirham as it's a little confronting when you arrive for the first time at Marrakech airport.  Nice small shopping complex located next to the hotel.

Hotel_Name: Radisson Blu Hotel, Marrakech Carre Eden
Review_Title: Great hotel, in an amazing location
Review_Text: we spent one night in this hotel in August. It is a great hotel with an amazing location in Marrakesh. Ideally situated you can walk and shop around. The old medina is also very close (5 minutes cab).  special mention to the swimming pool a beautiful transparent aquarium like that my kids absolutely loved.  The junior suite was ideal for a family of 4.  We'll be back ;-)

Hotel_Name: Radisson Blu Hotel, Marrakech Carre Eden
Review_Title: Must Stay here when in Marrakech!!
Review_Text: Excellent hotel with superb facilities! All staff are very attentive and really look after you the facilities are amazing and clean well looked after grounds  we got a room upgrade which was really special and the fact that they made my bday special and little gestures like a bday cake in my room and flowers on the bed really added the special touches to my stay    Would definitely recommend to families with children as very child friendly

Hotel_Name: Radisson Blu Hotel, Marrakech Carre Eden
Review_Title: One of the best experiences I've had
Review_Text: Everyone was absolutely amazing so kind attentive and professional. In particular Fatima Zahra receptionist from the hotel spa and Siham front desk. Fatima Zahra encouraged me to have a massage at the Spa and it was truly a wonderful experience. I felt so relaxed and taken care of. Siham upgraded our room so we felt no inconvenience. Also We had our 18 month old son with us the week that we stayed and every colleague went out of their way to entertain him. I can't explain how much I loved staying at this hotel and how kind everyone was. I will definitely stay with Radisson Blu Carre Eden again in the future :)

Hotel_Name: Radisson Blu Hotel, Marrakech Carre Eden
Review_Text: Ok so first thoughts on approach to the hotel was nothing special in Fact I think I was just expecting more!!!    However the concierge greeted us outside and brought Alexander everyone was pleasant there was a bit of a delay with the registration I think people trying to be extremely helpful trying to help more people than just staying with the task at hand which is an old together a bad thing so I don't office off today some put the dishes the lamb chops were amazing and absolutely needed no additional condiments they were complimentary dishes thrown in which you simply have to try the pool area is like little Oasis away from the hustle and bustle which you cannot hear at all slightly overcrowded from my my liking.... very family-orientated to be on honest not the place for quiet gets away from your type of place

Hotel_Name: Radisson Blu Hotel, Marrakech Carre Eden
Review_Date: Adil Z wrote a review Aug 2017
Review_Text: When I checked in first the person was very nice and helpful. I lost my key when I came back the reception was really rude his name Said . Said was very arrogant and not helpful at all. I felt like discriminated and felt like nobody. Said was very bad and very mean at that time. The cause of this experience I will never come back to this hot and I don't recommend this hotel at all. Needs improvement how reacts and treat good customers. When I came back asking for help that fan was working properly I had to wait for 15 minutes That he is talking to his coworker talking about little thing about life. He didn't realize that I do understand local language. I am very disappointed that they can hire someone that can have that kind of attitude. I am sorry I will never be back!

Hotel_Name: Radisson Blu Hotel, Marrakech Carre Eden
Review_Text: The rooms and pool were clean and breakfast was lovely with plenty of options. The staff tried hard to accommodate us as we have a few allergies and intolerances and they were keen to help. The spa was very relaxing and the massages were a high standard.    Only slight things were the service is quite slow by the pool and they aren't great with children's food menu options (specially for vegetarians there are none) but they do try and accommodate where they can! They also are unable to help ensure taxis are not ripping off their hotel customers which was a big issue for most guests.    Overall we did have a pleasant stay and would recommend it!

Hotel_Name: Radisson Blu Hotel, Marrakech Carre Eden
Review_Date: Samira H wrote a review Aug 2017
Review_Title: Second time visiting the luxurious hotel ( Nordine Bensar)
Review_Text: The hotel is located in the high street near the main square.  As we arrived to the astonishing hotel we were greeted by 2 wonderful employees who kindly offered to transport our luggage to our luxurious room. Our room had a beautiful view over the tantalizing pool. As we enjoyed our first night with the comfortable beds we were awaken to explore the exquisite food that was offered to us. Once we devoured the tremendous food we returned to our room to discover that our room was refurbished to perfection by the amazing room service.Personally I would like to emphasize my gratitude towards Yassir for making our stay even better.  I strongly recommend this hotel to anyone who is looking to have unforgettable moments.

Hotel_Name: Radisson Blu Hotel, Marrakech Carre Eden
Review_Text: Wow wow wow what a beautiful stunning hotel. I stayed here for a week two weeks ago it is by far one of the best hotels I have ever stayed in. The pool was AWESOME aquarium style I got some beautiful pictures in it. The staff were so friendly and polite. The location was A1 you step out right on the high street KFC and McDonald's close by and many restaurants. I am so sad I had to leave I will be returning back this year to stay at this hotel again. You MUST stay at this hotel if you visit Marrakech.

Hotel_Name: Radisson Blu Hotel, Marrakech Carre Eden
Review_Text: Hi    Returned from the Atlas Mountains after a hard four day trek to the Radisson for a few days break. Enjoyed a two night stay and this is a lovely hotel.    I don't need to go into specifics but we had a reason to complain to management and I have to say that it was dealt with in a completely professional way and to our absolute satisfaction.    The General Manager was instrumental in this and his leadership was a sign of a great hotel. I would defiantly stay again.

Hotel_Name: Radisson Blu Hotel, Marrakech Carre Eden
Review_Text: We stayed two nights at the Radisson Blu and completely enjoyed our stay. The location is ideal. If you're arriving by train you can easily walk to the Radisson. Upon arrival we had three taxi drivers quote us 70MAD----do not fall for this! Luckily we took a few minutes to study the map and realized we were very close and a 10 min walk. The room was clean cool and quiet. The pool was refreshing on a 100 degree day! The bellmen were excellent in helping us navigate Marrakech. The only suggestion for improvement I'd make is for better pillows. They are extremely flat. When we requested additional pillows that were thicker/cotton they brought up a small comforter that was rolled up into a pillow case. Not exactly what we needed but appreciated the effort.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Hotel_Name: Radisson Blu Hotel, Marrakech Carre Eden
Review_Date: Rabiha S wrote a review Jul 2017
Review_Text: Visited this hotel for my honeymoon and was not disappointed. The staff were so friendly and welcoming and were always smiling. The breakfast was so tasty too much to choose from and a great way to start the day. We had a couples Hammam at the spa which was really good and felt very relaxed after. My husband had a massage also and he commented it helped with his aches and pains (he has a shoulder injury). We were given a complimentary upgrade when the hotel found out we were on our honeymoon and the room was gorgeous such a huge and comfy bed! The pool area was nice to lounge around after breakfast and catching some sunshine. In terms of locations it's only around 12 minutes in a taxi to the main square but there are plenty of shops and great places to eat in the area around the hotel. I always stay with the Radisson group and have always have a great experience with them hence booking them for my honeymoon. Thank you to all the friendly and welcoming staff my husband and I left feeling relaxed rested and thoroughly looked after.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Hotel_Name: Radisson Blu Hotel, Marrakech Carre Eden
Review_Date: Abeer Al Dosari wrote a review Jul 2017
Review_Title: Just the hotel I was looking for
Review_Text: Prime location is the number one benefit of this hotel. Also I was very satisfied with the local knowledge of staff and connection with guests as they used to welcome me by name even the bell boy! Miss Lobna from reception took care of our check in and escorted us to our rooms and she was very helpful and patient getting our requests done. There is a nearby mall pharmacy and a Starbucks!

Hotel_Name: Radisson Blu Hotel, Marrakech Carre Eden
Review_Text: About 15 minutes walk from the central area of Marrakesh this hotel is situated in the upmarket shopping area.    More of a boutique hotel with stkish rooms and a small pool and sun deck area this is an ideal spot for a 4 or 5 night short break.

Hotel_Name: Radisson Blu Hotel, Marrakech Carre Eden
Review_Text: Brilliant location of the hotel - from airport and old town of Marrakesh.  We had the junior suite - and got a extra bed for free!!!  Really friendly staff from security bell boy reception staff house keeping. Always smiling - (keep this up guys)!  Special thanks to the following:  Zainab Ismail AbdulMajid Jamal and the night manager Illham and the breakfast team Ali and Security.  Only thing i would add to this hotel would be another pool other than that this is a family friendly hotel and I would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone when staying in Marrakesh. If I was to come back I would come here.

Hotel_Name: Radisson Blu Hotel, Marrakech Carre Eden
Review_Date: Nadim B wrote a review Jul 2017
Review_Title: Great Save of an Awful Experience
Review_Text: So the trip started well however the Spa Manager was AWFULL she demanded I paid for my guest to use the pool despite the fact 1) my guest was staying there the following night 2) the pool was empty and 3) we agreed if it became busy or we would vacate the pool area.    She refused to listen to reason so this resulted in my colleague canceling her check in and staying in her hotel...  Later that day we were spoken to realy rudely by the security...    Anyway this is the bad what saved the trip? why 4? Said who checked me in Khalid Who Checked Me out Loubna the manager who dealt with my complaint. not to mention the breakfast and cleaning staff. were all amazing.    Not only did they fully understand the complaint they went out of thier way to make it better! Loubna personally offered her apologies to my guest and went over and above to make it right. The team over all were AMAZING!    Despite the very useless Spa Manager I would highly recommend this place.  9/10!!!    If it was not for those guys I would not be staying there again however I am now booking for my next trip (I am there on business so I will be staying there every-time I go to Marroc)

Hotel_Name: Radisson Blu Hotel, Marrakech Carre Eden
Review_Text: We were travelling as a group of six friends none of whom had ever been to Marrakech before. To say we felt welcome would be an understatement.    This hotel has all the trappings of luxury without any of the stuffiness. Excellently located beautifully appointed and spotlessly clean it would be very difficult to fault the property in any way.    The pool area is beautiful and an ideal spot to avoid the midday Marrakech heat with an excellent menu of food and drinks (cocktails are outstanding). There's also a table tennis table which when a group of six are travelling together provides some intense competition!    Our business class room was very large with a huge bathroom and balcony overlooking the pool. As you'd expect towels and sheets were changed daily and the room returned to its original immaculate state.    As nice as the hotel is in itself the staff ensure it is a cut above. Absolutely everybody we came into contact with - from bar staff to reservations security etc. - was exceptionally friendly and welcoming always in a very sincere way. A special mention must go to Insaf in reservations who was very helpful in arranging everything prior to our stay.    Overall an excellent property in the heart of an excellent city - will definitely return.

Hotel_Name: Radisson Blu Hotel, Marrakech Carre Eden
Review_Text: I don't really write reviews but me and my best friend stayed at the raddisson blu hotel in Gueliz for 4 days & 5 nights. I can only use one word to describe the past few days EXPECTIONAL. All of the staff members made us feel welcomed & safe. Especially being two young females travelling alone.    Looks exactly like the photos.  The hotel was very clean and modern.  We visited during Ramadan which meant that most of the clubs and restaurants were close . So we just relax and stay in hotel. But thank God for the hotel's DJ playlist we didn't feel like we missed out at all lol.    The only downside was the food  don't get me wrong the food was lovely but the hotel really lack on vegetarian/vegan options I was eating the same meal for 2 days because of the limited choices and most restaurants were close .    But apart from that I would like to thank all the staff members for making my birthday week so special.    Definitely would recommend this hotel  I can't wait to return back to Marrakech.    Tosin & Tshika x

Hotel_Name: Radisson Blu Hotel, Marrakech Carre Eden
Review_Text: we have dinner with our morrocan friends they were very happy  staff very kind including reception  room clean and quiet  dinner very good  breakfast perfect again  and again staff very helpfull  so we finally found the perfect hotel in maraks
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Hotel_Name: Radisson Blu Hotel, Marrakech Carre Eden
Review_Date: Yariv S wrote a review Jun 2017
Review_Title: Rashid Oubassou the face of Radisson!
Review_Text: So this is the hotel that opened recently and is definitely a welcoming hotel. It has on the one hand a quality of interesting and calm design and on the other hand a warm atmosphere with easy access to all facilities. The hotel is very clean and the rooms are definitely pampering. You should note the charming Mr. Rashid Oubassou who is in every corner of the hotel and takes care of the guests from the moment they arrive. He is a professional and amazing person and it's fun to meet such a professional at the Radisson. Well done. Rashid!

Hotel_Name: Radisson Blu Hotel, Marrakech Carre Eden
Review_Title: Stylish Hotel, Great Service, Short Ride Away from the Center
Review_Text: We stayed at the Radisson Blu Hotel Marrakech Carre Eden during our trip to Morocco in April 2017. About a 25-30 minute taxi ride from the airport it is situated on the very busy Avenue Mohamed V in the Gueliz section of Marrakesh. The way we planned our trip meant we had three days here at the beginning our trip and two towards the end as we spent the middle part of our stay was spent in the Atlas Mountains and the Sahara.    The only minor blip in our stay here happened on our first day. We had requested a cot in our room for our 14 year old son on our reservation and mentioned it again at check in. The front desk assured us it would be placed in the room shortly after we moved our bags in. We planned to explore the city stay awake and stay out all day on our first day so we were in no hurry. However after arriving back at the hotel after dinner the cot was still not delivered. (The method to contact the front desk is through an app that was impossible to navigate) I went back down to the front desk to mention the cot and they assured it would be up soon. About an hour or so went by and it required another trip back to the front desk and waiting while they made a call for the cot to appear.    Besides the issue of the cot the stay was great. The rooms were spacious the amenities were great and we had a view of the main street from the balcony. Note that the door to balcony is double glazed and street noise is virtually impossible to hear from the inside. The balcony also provides some great people watching as it overlooked the Starbucks on the other side of the street. This may be the only one in Marrakesh (or it seemed like one as it was packed both inside and outside until 11 pm every night). For young Moroccans it was the place to see and be seen. Surprisingly each morning the streets (especially outside the Starbucks) was spotlessly clean.    There is a breakfast buffet provided and it is very extensive - inducing pork products! I was surprised they actually catered to western pork needs (I stayed away). There is a cost associated with the buffet (although we were not charged for one of the days we ate there). There are plenty of cafe's serving traditional and French style breakfast and pastries about a 5 minute walk up Avenue Mohamed V.    On our return to the hotel for the tail end of our trip our rooms were not ready so the front desk staff took our luggage and asked us to stay by the pool and offered us free drinks (the drinks took a while to arrive and the thoughtful front desk staff member who helped us initially noticed we were still waiting and instructed the bar staff to bring us drinks).    Overall it was a pleasant experience. The staff have been trained well in the hospitality trade and we would stay here once again if visiting Marrakesh.    Other Tips  - There is live music on the second floor lobby by the bar. Sound carries so you may want to choose a room wisely.  - There is metal detector and a guard at the front entrance 24-7  - Bottled water was provided in the room as complimentary on arrival - though it was not replenished on day 2 and 3.  - if you decide to walk to Jamaa el Fna be aware it will take about 35 minutes but there is no shade.  - The pool is great and welcome on hot days.  - There is a Carrefour located in the shopping mall next door.
