This is a great place to buy bottled water and food for your daily trips in to the city center or before heading out to the desert or the mountains.

Hotel_Name: Radisson Blu Hotel, Marrakech Carre Eden
Review_Date: Joe C wrote a review Jun 2017
Review_Text: Radisson Blu Hotel Marrakech Carr√® Eden    1) Room - Very big room with view to the swimming pool. Bed and pillows - comfortable and cozy. Wi-Fi works OK. New and advanced equipment.    2) Bathroom -With shower. Huge room. Very good pressure and always hot water. Clean towel.    3) Breakfast - Excellent cuisine. Great selection like : Many cheeses Moroccan specialty breads omelet  pancakes coffee and juice etc. Everything is fresh and tasty. Wonderful staff.    4) Spa - Sorry. But I Never used.    5) General and summary - The staff is warm helpful and friendly. The hotel placed in an excellent location. Right in the center of Marrakech. Modern and well maintained. I really recommend you to stay at this hotel.    Clearly one of the best hotels Marrakech!!!    I would like to praise and thank especially the employee at the souvenir shop named Rashida. Thank you very much for your help and patience

Hotel_Name: Radisson Blu Hotel, Marrakech Carre Eden
Review_Date: Ronald G wrote a review May 2017
Review_Title: Great stay , Great location, Fantastic Staff!
Review_Text: My wife and I just came back from a long weekend in Marrakech and we enjoyed our stay at the Radisson Blu. The hotel was cozy easy walking distance to the Medina actually it was so nice to be outside of the chaos of the Medina that the Hotel was our oasis from the busy day exploring. Easy walking distance. Pool was great and the breakfast was really nice offering with a variety of items we did not want for anything nor did we go away hungry! The whole place was a great value!!    I gave this Hotel 5 stars more so for the Staff then anything else. The service was phenomenal the Staff super friendly and always attentive to our needs and to the details I cannot say enough good things about this staff. I used to work in the industry and their service was exemplary. Thank you!    I also wanted to mention the Concierge Ismail what a super nice and super helpful young man such a pleasure to work with and he took care of all of our needs perfectly! Thank you Ismail!! and Thanks to all the staff.  Ronald and Maureen Girard
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Hotel_Name: Radisson Blu Hotel, Marrakech Carre Eden
Review_Text: We stayed here for one night to celebrate in-laws's and our son's birthday. The staff in the Radisson in Marrakech is fantastic: they did more than needed throughout our stay fixed a cake for our son gym teacher played ping-pong with our kids extra beds were fixed rapidly. The hotel itself is also great lovely pool (closes at sunset) great patio terrace. In my top 5 of all times.

Hotel_Name: Radisson Blu Hotel, Marrakech Carre Eden
Review_Date: Veronica W wrote a review May 2017
Review_Text: The only thing that I missed was some details regarding service such as offering you bread and snacks while waiting for the food for instance. Service was also slow. Likewise I missed a business room with normal chairs to do an improvised meeting. Breakfast is great specially omelettes and staff extremely kind.

Hotel_Name: Radisson Blu Hotel, Marrakech Carre Eden
Review_Text: Beautiful NEW hotel in the heart of Marrakesh. Staff absolutely fabulous- literally would do everything for you. Pool is v.relaxing. Booked for 4 nights originally but decided to extend our stay and book for a further 3nights. We got to keep our same room and have breakfast included. Breakfast was amazing - fresh orange juice omelettes- v.good variety. Couldn't fault this hotel one bit.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Hotel_Name: Radisson Blu Hotel, Marrakech Carre Eden
Review_Text: The Radisson Blu Hotel was our base for 3 great days in Marrakech. Good location with respect to things to see & restaurants. Good value for money. We were not looking for a resort but a convenient hotel.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Hotel_Name: Radisson Blu Hotel, Marrakech Carre Eden
Review_Text: Stayed in the hotel for a 3 day conference. Efficient check in process and pleasant and welcoming staff. Interesting aquarium style pool. Breakfast buffet was okay with a good choice of food. The bars service was very slow and you need to be careful you order exactly what you want - ask for a gin and it will come with water rather than tonic. The rooms are large well appointed air conditioned and comfortable.

Hotel_Name: Radisson Blu Hotel, Marrakech Carre Eden
Review_Title: Worth another visit for a more relaxing holiday
Review_Text: I really enjoyed this hotel staff were helpful lovely views and the pool was aquarium style...a first... and best of the best ...shopping was close by...lol as there was actually a mall under the hotel a MacDonalds and KFC and loads of Cafes around. . what was amazing was the facade is so different from what was inside the hotel was a very busy street. Definitely worth a stay. Make sure you take a swim and visit the spa. every room as its own balcony for relaxing and an eclectic looking bar. My only down side was the food is not labelled...being gluten sensitive i had to keep asking for what was in each meal. BTW the sweets on the dessert section are to die for! :) Hope to be back for a more relaxing holiday!

Hotel_Name: Radisson Blu Hotel, Marrakech Carre Eden
Review_Title: Nice, but I prefer the Riad's
Review_Text: Dinner and a drink pleasant hotel bar and restaurant next to the pool. Seating inside and outside on the terrace. (Second floor)    The Pink Prawn was looking for beer and as we were staying in a Riad close to the Jemaa El Fna alcohol was in short supply. We walked approximately 20 minutes towards the Gueliz area of Marrakesh which is much more modern and cosmopolitan than the Medina area inside the city walls.    For dinner we shared a mixed grill which was very nice. Service was great.    In truth although I couldn't fault the Radisson Blu it is very cosmopolitan but once inside the door we could have been anywhere in the world. Not a typical Moroccan/Marrakeshian establishment. Because of the pool and the 'continental' feel it's probably better if you're staying with kids.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Hotel_Name: Radisson Blu Hotel, Marrakech Carre Eden
Review_Text: This is a new very nicely decorated hotel right in the center of Marrakech. Spacious and clean rooms with all amenities. Modern style but with a typically Moroccan touch. Very friendly service. There is a beautiful swimming pool very quiet and peaceful in spite of the central location of the hotel. Conference space is available too. And the price is very reasonable. Stayed there for a conference but would definitely go back again for a private weekend getaway.

Hotel_Name: Radisson Blu Hotel, Marrakech Carre Eden
Review_Date: Nozrul I wrote a review May 2017
Review_Title: Best place to stat in marrakech!
Review_Text: I booked this hotel for 4 nights in may for me and my wife  We arrived a couple of hours earlier than check in time but were given a room straightaway with an upgrade!  The staff were amazing always polite and helpful.  The actual hotel was beautifully decorated and the rooms exceeded our expectations.  I also experienced the Eden spa which was so good i fell asleep during the treatment!  I have been marrakech many times and stayed in apartments and villas but my stay at radisson blu hotel was by far the best.  I will be recommending radisson blu to all my friends and i will be back very soon!  Thank you Team Radisson for a wonderful experience hopefully will see you soon!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Hotel_Name: Radisson Blu Hotel, Marrakech Carre Eden
Review_Title: Luxury hotel in the center of Marrakech
Review_Text: This hotel is well situated in the center of the city. Restaurants and shopping stores are all withing working distance. Although I have not visited other rooms the one I stayed in was spacious with two toilets (one in the leaving room and the other in the bedroom). Yes it was a nice Suite room... Love it.

Hotel_Name: Radisson Blu Hotel, Marrakech Carre Eden
Review_Text: The hotel is situated at walking distance from the main city center ( Medina & Market). Room are spacious and clean with all the expected amenities. The beakfast is excellent the bar area is spacious and they have live music someties. THere is a pool and a nice Spa. Their conference service is quite good nothis very luxurous but totally fair for the price you pay. Very friendly  polite and professional staff.

Hotel_Name: Radisson Blu Hotel, Marrakech Carre Eden
Review_Text: Incredible design feat the hotel restaurant and bar are set around a see-through pool. Cocktails were fabulous the service good although waiters could maybe benefit from a little more training in terms of drinks availability. A definite return venue!

Hotel_Name: Radisson Blu Hotel, Marrakech Carre Eden
Review_Date: Robert Z wrote a review May 2017
Review_Text: We can say only one- fantastic people great place! We spent 3 amazing days in this hotel. Breakfast was outstanding with great local food. Live station was serving perfect omlet. Outside pool with relaxation area- best place to relax! Thank you girls from the reception for all your kindness and help. This is real hospitality!!  Pozdrawiamy z Polski (Best regards from Poland)

Hotel_Name: Radisson Blu Hotel, Marrakech Carre Eden
Review_Title: Nice hotel, restaurant can be better
Review_Text: the hotel itself is in the main street. good area with starbucks coffee next door and small shopping center. the room is pretty nice including the spa area. people english is not bad but not 100% fluent which make communication a little hard. Front desk service are excellent. they even went to get phone card since our doesnt work in morroco. one night we want to get a nice quick dinner so we decided to have a dinner in the hotel. This is the worst experience. took 45 minutes to get our food and the temperature of the food is cold. there are many people working but they seems doesnt know what to do.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Hotel_Name: Radisson Blu Hotel, Marrakech Carre Eden
Review_Text: Best hotel gym I have ever experienced which was great for morocco! Also ate at Italian restaurant which was a nice break from Moroccan food. Location is ok- main things we wanted to see were medina and tannery- about a 10 minute cab ride but would have been a rather long walk.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Hotel_Name: Radisson Blu Hotel, Marrakech Carre Eden
Review_Text: We only stayed here for one night but after a whirlwind trip though the Sahara Desert the Marrakech medina and Essaouria this hotel was the perfect place to land! While we greatly appreciated the stunning beauty terrain history and antiquity of our travels through Morocco this brand new clean fresh and modern hotel was a slice of heaven for weary travelers! From check in to check out and everything in between our brief stay here was flawless. Every staff member was kind and helpful the pool area was beautiful great cocktails on the terrace and our early departure and car service was hassle free. The rooms were so plush and comfortable and it was nice to have a balcony overlooking the pool. A great location too - we walked a few blocks to the fabulous Grand Cafe de la Post for dinner and our kids liked having a shopping mall right next door. We've stayed in several meh Radisson Blus throughout Scandinavia and we felt this was the crown jewel of the chain. Although it's not a typical riad experience we were so happy to have ended our Moroccan adventure here at this beautiful comfortable and wonderful hotel.

Hotel_Name: Radisson Blu Hotel, Marrakech Carre Eden
Review_Text: We stayed in this hotel with our 2 boys (aged 3 and 5) for 3 nights.  The hotel has the perfect location in the modern Gueliz area near a shopping centre which made it easier when we needed to buy things for the boys.  We stayed in a suite which was beautiful and spacious (with a bathroom and a separate toilet).  It had a huge size balcony with table and chairs.  The rooms were very clean beds were comfortable bedsheets were changed daily.  Breakfast was amazing - huge selection and super tasty. Pastries were baked on the premises.  We were lucky to be there on Sunday when we had the Sunday brunch - absolutely incredible. Starters salads tagines BBQ fresh juices.  And deserts - lots of them and soooooo delicious!  We did have lunches and dinners at the hotel too - the quality is superb! Ambiance is very tranquil super enjoyable!  And staff - the most polite attentive friendly helpful! And so kind to the boys!  We all loved it so much!  And the biggest surprise for me was when on my birthday we got back to the room in the evening to find the most amazing cake made for me!  I could not tell you how tasty it was and how touched I felt by their kindness!  It just made our experience unforgettable.  We will definitely go back!  Just one little thing that could be improved - if the swimming pool could be heated :)  The boys did go swimming but the water temperature was 17C so my husband and I restrained from jumping in :)    Such a memorable experience!    Thank you all for making it happen!    Mari and Mark Gibbon ( and 2 super happy boys)

Hotel_Name: Radisson Blu Hotel, Marrakech Carre Eden
Review_Text: Booked two nights on the 14th April showed up at the hotel 22.30 only to be told we don't have your reservation being the busy night I suspected they sold my room at higher price. why because the online web I used never in 10 years disappointed me. I called the agency but they were closed so I went to another hotel. I got a call in the morning from the agency saying your reservation is there go back to the hotel and get refund for one night which they didn't refund me yet. I talked to amina and yasser in reservation to no avail every one pass it to another. Not a good treatment for some one who stayed three times at this hotel in less than a year .

Hotel_Name: Radisson Blu Hotel, Marrakech Carre Eden
Review_Text: We stayed at the hotel for 7 days with my family from 3rd April to 10 April 2017  The hotel is a fantastic place to stay in not far from the Airport and situated in Gueliz near shops and Restaurants.  Top security from the front of the hotel till the car park the parking was free you feel very secure the security staff were friendly and polite.  The room we stayed in was the junior suite it was nice and big had a bath and shower very clean and had a fantastic view of the pool.  The breakfast was really fantastic there was so much to choose from.  The Restaurant provide excellent food.  They have live music in the evening  The swimming pool is a good size the children loved itcouldn't get them out of there.  The staff there are so welcoming and go out of their way to make you feel happy and are very friendly. They made us feel like royalty.  We rented a car from the hotel services they provide.  We also used their drop off services to the Airport.    We would like say a massive Thank you to Abderrahamane BENMANSOUR Front office Manager for everything he done for us he made us feel at home and provided us with excellent servicevery professional at his job he was very welcoming friendly and always smilingüòÄ  Provided us with information on Renting a car in Marrakesh and places to visit.    A massive Thank you to Loubna Eddaoudi Front office team leader  She's very professional at her job she's providing the yes I can service.  made us feel very welcome and provided us with excellent service always smilingshe's very politefriendly and enthusiasticwent out of her way to make us feel happy and made us feel at home.  we were always happy to see her at the front desk.  We love her so much.üòò    A big Thank you to Ismail at Guest relation he was very polite and friendly went out of his way to help us and give us excellent service and all the information we asked for.üòÄ    A big Thank you to Yasir at Reservations  Very friendly and welcoming on the phone when I made my reservation.  He made me feel very welcome when we met in person and made our stay a wonderful one.üòÄ    We Would like to Thank khalid on the Front desk and all the staff on the front desk for all their services they provided.  Thank you to everyone on the concierge they were very polite and friendly always happy to help.    A big Thank you to Ilham at breakfast she always gave us a big welcome in the Mornings always smiling and greeting us and made us feel very happy it was nice to see her happy face in the mornings.üòç    We would like to say a massive Thank you to Fatima Zohra at the restaurant she provided us with excellent service The yes I can service.  she made us feel very welcome.  She's very polite always smiling went out of her way to make us feel at home and made us feel very happyshe's very enthusiastic she's that kind of staff the hotel needs.üòç    Thank you To Hind Restaurant manager for her services very welcomingpolite and friendly made us feel very happy.üòò    Thank you Asma restaurant supervisor very friendly politewelcoming great service.üòò    Thank you to walid he was very politefriendly and enthusiastic greeted us at the pool and provided us with excellent service.üòÄ    Thank you to all the housekeeping for their services.    We would recommend this hotel to anyone visiting Marrakech on their own or with family.  They would have the best experience ever.    We would be staying here again next time we come back.  We would never change this hotel for another one.    We loved it so much.üòç  Thanks    From Attu Family  London

Hotel_Name: Radisson Blu Hotel, Marrakech Carre Eden
Review_Text: The hotel facilities are beautiful but even better is the customer service. The staff are courteous helpful and go out of their way to make a guest feel welcome. We could not have asked for a better experience!    Also it is perfectly located on Ave Mohammed V - about a 20-25 minute walk to the major site-seeing places the old medina and the souk.

Hotel_Name: Radisson Blu Hotel, Marrakech Carre Eden
Review_Title: Nice hotel with a good location but customer service needs improvement
Review_Text: The hotel is nicely situated in the city. It has a great restaurant option and I would argue someone should go to eat at the hotel even if they're not staying there overnight. The club/lounge area is fantastic and I love the live music! The rooms are spacious and clean; good air conditioning during a hot time when we visited.    I typically do not write these types of reviews but I have been at the hotel twice now and have encountered the same staff individual who is very confrontational and needs to focus on their customer service skills. This most recent time when checking out I gave my parking ticket for the staff member to validate. When I left the counter after paying my hotel bill I asked the staff member for a validated ticket. She immediately told me that it was already given to me a few minutes ago. I assured her I had never received it because I had just given her my old ticket. I made it a point to check my wallet pockets everything to show I did not have it. She responded by saying that while she had given me the ticket she would give me a new one since I did not believe her. This basically insinuated I was lying which I did not appreciate. This is unacceptable to be called a liar by a representative of a business that I have just given money to for their services.    I rate this hotel average because of the poor interaction with the front desk staff. I understand it's a new hotel so these issues may be resolved but people should be aware of the demeanor presented when they check-in or check-out.    One comment: I experienced great customer service by other staff members at the hotel; whether it be through room service the bar or restaurant. This should not reflect the entire hotel's attitude but one individual who works at the front desk.

Hotel_Name: Radisson Blu Hotel, Marrakech Carre Eden
Review_Date: Robin G wrote a review Apr 2017
Review_Text: This is a new hotel so everything is new and clean. They have the best service and go out of their way to make sure you have everything you need. The rooms are big. The breakfast greeter Ilham (not sure of the spelling) is so nice. The hotel is in a great location. It is next to a mall and cafes. The hotel is a short walk to the Medina.

Hotel_Name: Radisson Blu Hotel, Marrakech Carre Eden
Review_Text: Stayed here for 4 nights in March and I've got to say this is one of the best hotels I've stayed in. Loved the room super cosy. Perfect location only 5 minute taxi ride to jemaa el fna. The food and the restaurant was divine the steak melts in your mouth. We also had a few treatments at the spa and I've never felt that relaxed. All treatments and food was reasonably priced. The hotel also organised a suprise for my best friends birthday and I've got to say she was overwhelmed by the attention to detail and amazing cake.

Hotel_Name: Radisson Blu Hotel, Marrakech Carre Eden
Review_Date: andrew h wrote a review Mar 2017
Review_Text: A hotel regardless of the chain is only as good as it's staff. Radisson have clearly spend time and money creating a faultless team without a single weak link.    So. Why would you want to go to Marrakech to soak up the atmosphere and then hide in a western hotel.?  Well Marrakech is full on it's not Europe it's a city reinventing itself and it's noisy it's smokey it's filled with entrepreneurs wanting to improve themselves and sometimes it's just rather 'intense'  The Raddison is a great place to recenter yourself before heading back out again. Previously I have stayed in the heart of the medina and Gueliz was a pleasant change in pace.  The hotel is what you expect from Radisson. It's is beautifully built and the rooms are a good size the walk in shower is a nice touch and the air con the water pressure and the facilities all just work.  The pool was like a bath and the aquarium sides area nice touch as long as you don't let your other half take photo's. What do they say about aquarium sided pools? they make you look 10lbs heavier. Or maybe I just made that up.  The food in the Gueliz area is outstanding. There is a pizza place directly behind that serves wine stone baked pizzas and huge steaks all for very reasonable prices. Do go back a road or two and wander as the quality of cafe restaurants was extremely high.  The hotel is above a shopping mall filled with boring stores however it does have a carrefour where you can get Beer wine and crisps for the perfect balcony hour before getting ready for the night ahead.  Breakfast was fantastic with a huge selection of choices try all the fresh juices though as they are truly delicious even if I wasn't completely sure what they are.  Booked to go back again in September.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Hotel_Name: Radisson Blu Hotel, Marrakech Carre Eden
Review_Text: I stayed at this hotel for ten days in march and had a great experience. Room was big and updated! Pool is magnificent and really allows you to escape the city feel of Marrakech. I especially would like to mention Tarik (the bartender/server.)  He remembered our drinks every time. He was always friendly and he speaks multiple languages. He was so helpful and he made our stay at the Radisson Blu that much better!! Thank you Tarik!

Hotel_Name: Radisson Blu Hotel, Marrakech Carre Eden
Review_Title: Amazing stay at Radisson Blu Marrakesh
Review_Text: The staff are just fabulous and their attention to detail was wonderful they make you feel like royalty. The food was so incredible such variety with unique elements to it. A wonderful hotel in an amazing city! Overall a 5 star stay

Hotel_Name: Radisson Blu Hotel, Marrakech Carre Eden
Review_Title: Great stay at the Radiisson Blu Marrekech
Review_Text: Very New and nice best in Marrakech the staff is amazing so attentive and professional!!  We really appreciated the kindness and help from Khald and Sonia at reception and Ismail and Zineb at the concierge desk they all made our trip to Marrekesh both fun and memorable. Thanks for a terrific stay we loved the hotel and all the personal attention we received I would highly recommend this hotel to everyone it is the best!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Hotel_Name: Radisson Blu Hotel, Marrakech Carre Eden
Review_Date: Zeila Cristina O wrote a review Mar 2017
Review_Text: Big thank you to Radisson Blu Marrakech!!!!!Back in November I had a really bad experience when stay in the Radisson hotel in Copenhagen then I decided to give it another go after learning they all have different owners. The Radisson in Marrakech amazed me from the day I arrived to the day I left. They place is fantastic and the staff (the entire crew) are super friendly and professionals. I highly recommend it as it was the BEST hotel experience of my life up to this date

Hotel_Name: Radisson Blu Hotel, Marrakech Carre Eden
Review_Date: Kirsten B wrote a review Mar 2017
Review_Text: What a lovely and memorable stay one which i wont forget.The staff were incredible so efficient and friendly - this hotel knows how to deliver on service. Beautiful setting very relaxing and great conference facilities. Loved each moment as well as the incredible food and desserts on offer. Would highly recommend Radisson Blu Hotel Marrakech to everyone looking to stay in Marrakech - you wont regret it!

Hotel_Name: Radisson Blu Hotel, Marrakech Carre Eden
Review_Text: Absolutely amazing!  From food to entertainment to staff this hotel has everything right. From the moment we arrived at the entrance to the time I walked into my room I felt appreciated and welcome. The service was exceptional and the multitude of space in common areas allows you to feel free not to mention the outstanding conference facilities and attention to detail in all aspects. The breakfast and dinner at the hotel as well as the entertainment was out of this world.  I will confidently recommend this hotel to anyone visiting Marrakech.

Hotel_Name: Radisson Blu Hotel, Marrakech Carre Eden
Review_Date: Talissa B wrote a review Mar 2017
Review_Text: I had the pleasure of staying at Radisson Blu Marrakech Carre Eden - and what an absolutely treat it was staying at this wonderful hotel. I will be back again very soon in the near future.    Friendly Staff best service amazing rooms & hotel facilities delicious food/great chef.  I honestly have no complaints only

Hotel_Name: Radisson Blu Hotel, Marrakech Carre Eden
Review_Text: Stayed here for a minibreak what a gem it is. We were upgraded to a pool view room which had a lovely view of the centre of the hotel. Our room was clean comfortable and well serviced. Bed was very comfortable with crisp linen. Food was amazing and had plenty of choices for all tastes. Swimming pool was lovely and warm and loved the aquarium feel. All staff members were polite  courteous and extremely friendly they really couldn't do enough to help.. Their company motto of "yes we can" is apparent in this hotel and they all deserve a pat on the back at their next team meeting. I left my phone charger at the airport hotel but one of the receptionists was kind enough to offer me her personal one. We had a great stay and cannot recommend enough
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Hotel_Name: Radisson Blu Hotel, Marrakech Carre Eden
Review_Text: Wonderful wonderful wonderful - I didn't want to leave. What an incredible team full of friendly hospitable people a beautiful hotel and an endless variety of food. I could not recommend this hotel more if you are going either on a Business or Luxury trip to incredible Marrakech! Thank you team!

Hotel_Name: Radisson Blu Hotel, Marrakech Carre Eden
Review_Date: Uwase N wrote a review Mar 2017
Review_Text: Lovely business hotel  Very close to Marrakech Airport The ambiance in the hotel speaks for itself Staff are very friendly and mostly the spacious nice room gives an a everlasting memory and a story to tell ....I loved my stay!!!!!

Hotel_Name: Radisson Blu Hotel, Marrakech Carre Eden
Review_Date: Robynn K wrote a review Mar 2017
Review_Text: No stone was left unturned during our week long conference. The food and service was particularly excellent and don't miss the opportunity to listen to The Radisson Band in the Lila Bar they were incredible!

Hotel_Name: Radisson Blu Hotel, Marrakech Carre Eden
Review_Text: I stayed at the hotel for almost a full week and by the end of the trip I didn't want to leave. The staff food my room the conference areas and the hotel itself was absolutely incredible. For a great business or leisure trip I would definitely recommend the Radisson Blu Hotel Marrakech Carre Eden!

Hotel_Name: Radisson Blu Hotel, Marrakech Carre Eden
Review_Date: Michelle v wrote a review Mar 2017
Review_Text: Beautiful hotel delicious food great service close to the local market and airport!  Conferencing facilities are great with amazing snacks for breaks!  Marrakech is the place to be and I will definitely stay at Radisson Blu Hotel Marrakech Carre Eden again!

Hotel_Name: Radisson Blu Hotel, Marrakech Carre Eden
Review_Date: Barry S wrote a review Mar 2017
Review_Text: Just had a wonderful few days stay in the Radisson Blu Marrakech. All the hotel staff went out of their way to make this trip very special. From their friendly welcome to guiding us on local attractions nothing was too much trouble. We would really like to thank Mousaabe our waiter tonight for a fabulous meal. One of the best we've had in a long time. Mousaabe and Rida Laachari helped me with my food choices as I have a lot of food allergies. We were able to enjoy the meal and fabulous surroundings without worrying about adverse food reactions. We would really like to thank all the Radisson team for our wonderful stay. Barry & Vera Sweeney
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Hotel_Name: Radisson Blu Hotel, Marrakech Carre Eden
Review_Date: Maria M wrote a review Mar 2017
Review_Text: Our room was large and very clean and the staff were helpful with several special requests. They were accurate with billing and gave good advice about places to go.    We were concerned about the possibility of noise because they had live music in the bar but we could not hear it from our room.    There is a large heated pool in the courtyard that has glass sides.    The hotel is located in an upscale mall so on days when we did not want to hassle with finding a restaurant we just went inside the mall and got some food at Carrefour the large grocery store there. There is also a laundry in the mall where you can drop off laundry and have it done that is more cost-effective than going through the hotel if you have a lot.

Hotel_Name: Radisson Blu Hotel, Marrakech Carre Eden
Review_Date: Ioana A wrote a review Feb 2017
Review_Text: I would like to thank everyone specially Zineb Younes Mou Mouad Tarik Fatima ( and I'm sure there are allot more of them but I can't remember their names :( I apologise for that) for making my holiday special. The level of customer service and friendliness of your staff is spotless. I can't really find the words to describe the hotel and location as it's everything anyone would need on a holiday. I wish you all the best and I hope to see all of you when I'll be back. Xx

Hotel_Name: Radisson Blu Hotel, Marrakech Carre Eden
Review_Text: I travelled across the globe all the way from Melbourne Australia. Never thought I would find myself walking across the Sahara deserts of North Africa Morocco. There I am thinking I'm such a sarcastic person to ever thought that Morocco is religious muslim country. The thought of not having any alcohol served to me Oh how I was so wrong! Thumbled across the Hotel Bar that I stayed at 'Radisson Blu Hotel' meet this guy at their bar " Tarik Sami " who actually provide me excellent cocktails with good knowledge of alcohol introduce me to his crew had a awesome hospitality experience here. I will definitely recommend. High quality service with such warm welcoming staff.

Hotel_Name: Radisson Blu Hotel, Marrakech Carre Eden
Review_Text: Stayed here for one night and highly recommend it.    Staff were very friendly and helpful from waiters bell boys to the receptionist hosts and managers - superb really!    Rooms are very nice. We had a superior room it was very modernly decorated with a Morrocan twist. Very clean too.    Food in the restaurant "Lila" is execellent.    My wife used the spa which she enjoyed.    Overall it was a great experience
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Hotel_Name: Radisson Blu Hotel, Marrakech Carre Eden
Review_Text: We went there without too much expectation but overall it was a very good experience. The staff was very nice and the breakfast was very good quality thanks to Khalid at the front desk for his kindness as well as Malik the artistic director for his very warm welcome. We will go back most definitely

Hotel_Name: Radisson Blu Hotel, Marrakech Carre Eden
Review_Text: We stayed here for four nights in January. The breakfast was good - fresh omelettes pastries fruit and hot food also loved the Tchaba teas.  The room itself was comfortable it had free toiletries a good makeup mirror and a free of charge safe. However when we first arrived there were no towels robes or slippers in our room. There was a kettle and tea/coffee but no complimentary water the balcony only had one chair (majority of pool facing balconies only had one chair) and the TV had one english channel.  The hotel is above a shopping mall on a busy road but when you're around the pool it's very relaxing and peaceful - the pool is also heated.  The location was perfect for exploring - there were a number of restaurants nearby as well as shops a market and a supermarket within the mall.  We enjoyed the bands evening entertainment at the hotel. The bar area had a good atmosphere cocktails were around ¬£10 each and they came with nibbles and the saltiest olives I have ever tasted!  We used taxis a few times most are out to rip you off - ask one of the guys working for the hotel out the front to get you a taxi and agree a price through him before you get in to try and avoid getting ripped off. We paid 50 dirhams for a taxi to the medina.  Having stayed at Radisson hotels before I was slightly disappointed that there was no complimentary drink on arrival or complimentary water in the room only one chair on the balcony no towels/slippers/robes in the rooms upon arrival a lack of service at the bar during the day and a lack of aircon in the gym. We enjoyed our stay but I think these added touches would make it feel more like a 5* hotel.

Hotel_Name: Radisson Blu Hotel, Marrakech Carre Eden
Review_Date: David A wrote a review Jan 2017
Review_Title: Fabulous brand new hotel in perfect location!
Review_Text: What a pleasure it was to stay in this fabulous new hotel in an absolutely great location - in the vibrant ville nouvelle with all the restaurants cafes and gelateria near at hand but also close to the old city medina. Our room was modern spacious and filled with light looking out into the inner courtyard and pool area. Besides breakfast (which was terrific) we ate in the restaurant several times and the food was all excellent! Staff were great and made us feel right at home! We'd definitely stay here again if we're ever back in Marrakech.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Hotel_Name: Radisson Blu Hotel, Marrakech Carre Eden
Review_Text: Hotel brilliant. Lovely service.  Can't fault it.  DONT EAT IN THE MARKET.    CHECK TRIP ADVISOR OF WHERE TO EAT. MOST PLACES ARE REALLY GOOD FOOD.  Taxi drivers will always try and rip u off. Always half the price of what they quote.  Overall morocco is lovely.

Hotel_Name: Radisson Blu Hotel, Marrakech Carre Eden
Review_Title: Go see Sami at the hotel bar
Review_Text: Went for a mid week get away to Marrakech and happened upon the Radisson Blu there whilst on an evening out in Gueliz. Sami and his colleagues at the bar near the pool were extremely friendly and went out of their way to make sure our evening was special. The live music was great and the food was lovely.    Thank you to Sami for making it a memorable trip.

Hotel_Name: Radisson Blu Hotel, Marrakech Carre Eden
Review_Text: I stayed at this hotel in December 2016 and I chose it to hold a conference for about a week so I used conference facilities as well as accommodation and other services.    Staff : staff members are very very well trained and professional in this hotel. Mr. Adil Rmidi from conference and banqueting is a very very professional well-mannered gentleman who can sort out the most difficult of requests swiftly efficiently and with a smile. Nothing was too much trouble for him and he will be your companion throughout your event making sure all your requests are catered for. He followed up with each of our requests and went through thick and thin to make sure we were comfortable (he event lent me his mobile charger and never requested it back). Not only is he easy-going and professional and never says no but he is also genuinely kind. I am Moroccan and I know this is a very rare quality to find in people working in the service sector and in other hotels.    Mr. Amine el Meriague was our contact person at the sale and marketing department and was out focal point before and during the event before Adil took over upon our arrival. Amine is of utmost professionalism a very genuine humble and professional person who made sure everything was sorted and well prepared during our arrival. And when I discussed catering matters with him he even called the head chef to discuss the content of our lunches and coffee breaks making sure every palate and request is catered floor. Amine marvelously coped with last-minute changes and challenges brilliantly and professionally.    Dealing with Adil and Amine was a pleasure seamless and hassle-free. Again it's not always the case in other comparable hotels in the city where staff is either useless or arrogant or both. Management should absolutely make sure these two persons keep their high motivation as this is crucial for guest satisfaction.    Conference facilities : top-notch modern and overlooking a nice garden (it needs a bit more plans though) as well as the pool. So from the meeting rooms filled of natural daylight (no none of them is dark) participants can get out to the garden for instance during coffee breaks or sit and bask a bit in the sun. Coffee break can either be served indoors or in the garden (of course Adil was there making sure everything was perfect). Interpretation facilities can be arranged through the hotel at very reasonable costs.    Food : coffee breaks and lunches were literally handcrafted with passion. There is a very experienced Moroccan Chef supervising a motivated team and making sure food quality and presentation is top notch. Main courses including local items (yes do request Moroccan specialities for your event if you can/wish you won't be disappointed) were of the highest quality and deserts were pieces of art. Very beautiful to look at and to taste (small tartelettes aux framboises chocolate etc). Lunch is served buffet-style for groups at the main restaurant which is bright and spacey. The √†-la carte restaurant at night was very expensive though and the menu rather limited (mains costing 25 euros minimum and an orange juice 6 euros but again this is a 5 star hotel). Breakfast was loaded with fresh items including freshly sliced fruit such as orange and melon a good selection of bakery items an egg station attended with a chef and providing also Moroccan pancakes (baghrir) as well as other delicacies. Do not expect smoked salmon though as it's not in the menu.The bread selection is very very good though as well as the viennoisies or danish pastry or whatever you wish to call it. The other huuuge plus of course is the freshly squeezed orange juice which you can help yourself to every morning. The breakfast room is very nice on the ground floor and very pleasant    Location : The hotel is located in the upper floors of a small shopping centre in the modern part of town a stone throw from the main railway station. The mall has parking facilities which hotel guests could use (don't know the exact cost though) a small carrefour supermarket for essential items and a busy starbucks at the street level. The rooms are different from one another you have those overlooking the pool which are business class rooms that tend to be slightly larger with an awkward desk arrangement though (this is a matter of taste) king or twin size beds that are very comfortable and white crispy sheets. Rooms facing the street are not noisy by any means and the configuration of some of them can even be nicer than business class rooms depending on the layout. You can choose a room facing the main street on the upper floor you will have a huge terrace and you can see some of the city buildings.    Gym : there is also a fitness centre with enough machines for a workout including a smith machine with a selection of weights seated chest press machine and shoulder press. There is however no barbell for biceps curls and the selection of free weights is rather limited (up to about 24 kg per dumbbell may be enough for a shoulder workout but not for proper chest dumbbell press sets). In addition you have a few running machines and a nordic walking and some bikers. The gym is definitely much better than other Moroccan hotels but sadly not equipped enough for gym goers. There is also some cable machines (those useless techno gym ones which are mostly designed for women). All machines are technogym and towels are to be requested at the spa area just like a bottle of water (no they don't have them on display at the gym).    Pool : there is also a very nice aquarium like swimming pool of about 20 meters long which is heated (not enough for cold days though) could be pleasant if it's sunny but no when it's very cold.    Spa : all services are provided here didn't test but was told that a visit to the Moroccan bath sets you back around 10 euros this does not include any treatment of course except from the possibility to enter the facility.    Bar : the bar gets a bit lively at night with a live band playing all nights sadly though smoking is permitted in the bar (which is a pity as those wonderful sofas will end up being torn and destroyed in no time). The band is very good although the music can be a tad loud but this is a great alternative to those that wish to stay in.    All in all staff make this hotel a gem of a place whether for private or professional visits to Marrakesh look no further go straight to Radisson tell them how to make you happy and let them take care of you. Rooms are top notch food is very good quality service is excellent without being too much. It is difficult to find a similar level of quality and service in Moroccan hotels but Radisson brings things to a whole other level. I will definitely be returning for future visits.    Management should look into :    - introducing a few delicacies at breakfast to make it wonderful instead of very good such as smoked salmon for breakfast this is standard in most hotels of this category. A Nespresso machine is also standard nowadays.  - having towels and bottles of water at guests' disposal when entering the gym as most do not know where to request them.  - filling in the empty space in the gym with extra machines for fitness freaks (no running machines are not enough a few barbells and standing cable machines and ropes would be much appreciated).  - making the hotel common area smoke-free including the bar. Smoking guests do tend to adapt and can have a smoke outside if they wish.

Hotel_Name: Radisson Blu Hotel, Marrakech Carre Eden
Review_Title: Lovely hotel in the perfect location
Review_Text: Stayed here at the end of October/beining of November and overall it was a lovely stay. The staff were all very accommodating and the room was lovely and clean. Only slight negative was that the pool was being refurbished for the first two days that we were there and we had no prior warning of this. They did however have access to the pool at the movenpick hotel near by that we could use.  Would really recommend this if your looking for somewhere not in the centre of the medina. Its located in the new town which is about 5mins away so gives you the best of both worlds.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Hotel_Name: Radisson Blu Hotel, Marrakech Carre Eden
Review_Text: excelent service at the entrance reception dinner breakfast  again room was perfect clean and big  lunch very good mixedgrill was delicious breakfast becomes better every time  the maroccan hospitality in combination with the radisson blu standard a perfect marrriage
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Hotel_Name: Radisson Blu Hotel, Marrakech Carre Eden
Review_Text: I have come to realize that the hotel standards are not the same all over the world which is why many hotels in morocco are rated 5 stars when its not even close. Just because some smiles at you and greets you all the time does not make a hotel 5 star!    Radisson Blu is designed very beautifully but not practical at all. The rooms have an open plan bathroom and room. Between the sink and bedroom is a cutout screen so water splashes over onto the carpet. Shower glass doors do not close 100% so the room gets flooded unless u shower in a small tiny conner. The toilets are in a smaaaaal tiny room with no ventilation whats so ever so the entire hotel smells of stale toilet air... disgusting!    Another thing that bothered me alittle was that there was a sign that said no smoking and if you do smoke you will be charged a fee for the deep clean. I understand that you would be charged for breaking the rules - duh! But what i dont get is the deep clean only after smoking...Does that mean that they do not do a deep clean after each guest leaves? I felt really disgusted as tho i was surrounded by bacteria galore. I could not wait to get out of there and scrub myself clean.    The hotel is located in a great area right next to a mall so no problem with food options and you can walk around in that area to explore. I love that about this hotel.    There is no proper parking outside the hotel so when we were getting dropped off we were having alot of problems. Dont understand why the hotel  being 5 stars mind you did not take care of this. We went on a tour and when we got back  the police did not want us to jump off as the tour guide had to double park because there was no parking. Hotel staff or concierge were no where to be found and when they finally did appear  they were of no help.    Breakfast is average as well. Had your basics such as eggs and sausages and thats kinda the main things. The chef making the eggs is extremely rude and arrogant so go with a calm mind as he really does not listen to you and what you want. He tells you what you should put in your omelet and you cannot tell him otherwise because he then gets angry and starts cooking furiously. Bits of egg flew right at us (EW!) all because we did not want chilli powder but some of the chilli paste.    So overall this hotel is great if you plan on staying for just 1 night. Any longer and its not comfortable at all

Hotel_Name: Radisson Blu Hotel, Marrakech Carre Eden
Review_Text: My husband and I stayed at the Radisson Blu hotel Marrakech Carre Eden from December 21-29 2016 .This property is very well located clean new and stylish. The hotel staff is extremely welcoming friendly and helpful. during our entire stay we were looked after by Ismail Elbezim. He went out of his way to make our stay extremely comfortable and enjoyable. Upon arrival we were shown to our room by Ismail a pool view superior room. Ismail arranged all our tours and introduced us to an excellent guide. he also suggested some excellent restaurants both in Marrakech and Essaouira. I would highly recommend this hotel and will definitely stay here during our next visit. Thank you Ismail we look forward to seeing you again !
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Hotel_Name: Radisson Blu Hotel, Marrakech Carre Eden
Review_Text: After staying in ryads for the first part of our trip we stayed at Radisson Blu Hotel for 5 nights. It is a modern hotel that is located in a safe clean part of Marrakech. It was about a 25 minute was to Jemaa Fna square.    We booked a junior suite and this worked well for our family as there were two separate bathrooms. On some days the shower was not hot enough but it was mostly ok. Our balcony had a city view.    The hotel is next to Carre Eden mall and the food court there was useful as by this portion of the trip the kids were craving Western-style fast food after days of eating (tasty) Moroccan food.    The staff was very friendly and the concierge desk was top notch. Special thanks to Moaad who was extremely helpful with our requests!    The only downside was that our room was not vacuumed consistently despite specifically asking this to be done.

Hotel_Name: Radisson Blu Hotel, Marrakech Carre Eden
Review_Title: An oasis from the chaos of the Medina
Review_Text: A great hotel to get away from the hustle and bustle. Taxi to the Medina for 4 people was 50 dirhams. Lovely rooms and pool. Good breakfasts freshly squeezed orange juice cooked breakfasts excellent coffee. Had good music/entertainment in the evening. Would stay here again.

Hotel_Name: Radisson Blu Hotel, Marrakech Carre Eden
Review_Text: Excellent location great hotel friendly staff 5 star breakfast Shopping mall under the hotel the only things is no free water in the Rooms also no business center in the hotel the spa & laundry services quit expensive

Hotel_Name: Radisson Blu Hotel, Marrakech Carre Eden
Review_Date: Anders L wrote a review Dec 2016
Review_Text: Had a wonderful stay at this hotel. The staff were great very friendly and helpful.  The hotel was fresh and clean. I spent many hours at the bar speaking with staff and guests. I¬¥ll be back with my kids next time! ;)

Hotel_Name: Radisson Blu Hotel, Marrakech Carre Eden
Review_Text: it was a great experience  i love it  Amazing hotel  with a wonderful staff . super hospitality fresh food with lovely taste .. wonderful  great  love it and promise come back always. I love the hotel  i have really enjoyed excellent in all things . most lovely hotel i ever use.

Hotel_Name: Radisson Blu Hotel, Marrakech Carre Eden
Review_Date: Louise H wrote a review Dec 2016
Review_Text: We arrived late and were greeted by a really lovely receptionist. Lovely room unusual lay out with bathroom but all the necessary mon cons. Lovely big bed with the highest quality bed linen. Lovely view of the pool.    Staff were just fantastic and so friendly and helpful we were tourists and hotel was bust with conferences but that did not impact us and we were able to relax by and swim in the glass pool.    Interesting food offering for breakfast and if I was to have one grip it would be the coffee set up. Difficulty to get a large hot black coffee.    Would certainly like to return to this hotel in a great central location. A short taxi ride to the Medina and some lovely international restaurants within walking distance of hotel. Supermarket underneath handy to get essentials.    Staff were just great from Tariq in the bar who was good fun and the lovely lady that cleaned our room. Seemed to be great presence from management who oversaw the attention to detail.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Hotel_Name: Radisson Blu Hotel, Marrakech Carre Eden
Review_Text: Just back from Marrakech for a long weekend- Stayed at the Radisson Blu and enjoyed our stay from the fist minute we stepped in. Great new hotel in Gueliz Marrakech. Great location; fantastic and friendly staff. Modern rooms good facilities.  I will definitely come back next time i'm in Marrakech.

Hotel_Name: Radisson Blu Hotel, Marrakech Carre Eden
Review_Date: Brian E wrote a review Dec 2016
Review_Title: Nice rooms, friendly staff.....but some annoying issues. Next time, I'll stay in a nice, similarly priced riad
Review_Text: My wife and I liked the rooms of this new hotel. However there were some issues that should have been ironed out months ago. We had breakfast at the restaurant three times. It was a bit different each time. First day the food and service were both good. Second day the "hot food" was cold (the potatoes sausages etc). Also there was no staff to operate the espresso machines which was quite the problem when there is a line of 15 guests speaking different languages and none having experience operating an espresso machine. The third day my wife's omelette was waaaay undercooked. We don't mind fresh eggs that are a bit "wet." But these were egg whites that weren't whisked properly and then weren't cooked thoroughly.    This hotel was in the heart of the "new area." It was less than 10min via taxi to the medina prices ranging from 30-70 dhm ($3-7) and were never hard to find. I inquired about arranging a private taxi to Fez however the hotel front desk quoted about $200 more than our Fez riad offered to set it up for. I understand a small difference..but the hotel was clearly trying to make a good chunk of change on it (~$450 vs $260).    The pool looked really cool but we didn't get a chance to use it.    Would I stay here again? I doubt it. I'd probably just look for a nice riad in the same price range.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Hotel_Name: Radisson Blu Hotel, Marrakech Carre Eden
Review_Text: After a week in the Medina we decided to spend 2 days in this luxury hotel. If your looking for a break from the Medina this place has it all. Everything here oozes luxury even the French elites that frequent it.  Located in downtown Gueliz it is easy to pop out for good local meal the supermarket downstair or an enjoyable walk to Jardin Majorelle.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Hotel_Name: Radisson Blu Hotel, Marrakech Carre Eden
Review_Text: Pros:  New and clean with professional helpful and friendly staff. Rooms are cool looking and ok in size. Food quality is pretty good but a bit pricy when on a business trip.  Centralized location.    Cons:  Bathroom had flushing issues. Shower set up wasn't right with water flowing down the floor. Not one single English Channel apart from NEWS so a bit boring if u wanted to stay in the room and have room service.  Breakfast selection can improve

Hotel_Name: Radisson Blu Hotel, Marrakech Carre Eden
Review_Title: A cool, chic boutique hotel in the centre of town
Review_Text: The Radisson Blu Hotel Marrakech Carre Eden is a super cool chic hotel in the centre of town with wonderful food in an restaurant lively and cool bar superb state of the art glass sided swimming pool and for me the highlight the best bedrooms I've stayed in in a long time. A must visit hotel. staff ares per helpful and friendly and when you venture out you are in the heart of the town.

Hotel_Name: Radisson Blu Hotel, Marrakech Carre Eden
Review_Title: Urban Hotel Style Radisson in Heard of Gueliz
Review_Text: Hotel itself is clean and in heart of centre mattress was soft for me  rooms size can be a bit more generous and pillows were extremely soft .I wish i had mine in this trip.    Place is centrally located staff were nice and a check in was normal .    The hotels experience is normal .

Hotel_Name: Radisson Blu Hotel, Marrakech Carre Eden
Review_Title: Perfect location, very helpful staff (Loubna was incredibly helpful and professional during a busy moment)
Review_Text: Located at an ideal distance from city centre/main square. Perfect to walk in the morning and easy to catch a taxi/horse carriage back. Very clean and modern building. Front office and night staff were super helpful (especially Loubna). Will definitely stay here again.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Hotel_Name: Radisson Blu Hotel, Marrakech Carre Eden
Review_Date: Annemarie v wrote a review Nov 2016
Review_Title: Good service, friendly staff in a nice ambience.
Review_Text: Good service friendly staff in a nice ambience. Good atmosphere in the bar. Beautiful terrace with aquarium swimming pool in the mondain new city of Marrakech just 5 minutes away from the old town. The breakfast was outstanding. So many items on the buffet. Rooms are very clean and a lot of comfort

Hotel_Name: Radisson Blu Hotel, Marrakech Carre Eden
Review_Date: kuku a wrote a review Nov 2016
Review_Text: Amazing stay at this hotel. Great location and the staff was very helpful in every manner possible. Especially Tarik Sami was very kins to us and also helped us plan our trip in marrakech. Will definitely come here again.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Hotel_Name: Radisson Blu Hotel, Marrakech Carre Eden
Review_Text: We just came back from a long weekend in Marrakech where we stayed at the Radisson Blu. The hotel is very central which made it very convenient to visit the city. Staff was very helpful and always available Rooms were comfortable and nicely decorated And the breakfast was amazing i would recommend it and would definitely stay there next time i m visiting marrakech

Hotel_Name: Radisson Blu Hotel, Marrakech Carre Eden
Review_Date: David D wrote a review Nov 2016
Review_Text: Spacious room. Beautiful bathroom with double sinks rain shower. Nice balcony. Carrefour supermarket below the hotel and Starbucks next door. The patio by the pool is a great spot for a beverage. 15 minute walk to the medina.

Hotel_Name: Radisson Blu Hotel, Marrakech Carre Eden
Review_Text: I had the Pleasure to stay at your hotel from 10/30 to 11/5  my hats off to all your staff. Seham at the front desk Eman Bellmen and overnight crew. I am coming back for sure and enjoying your city again.

Hotel_Name: Radisson Blu Hotel, Marrakech Carre Eden
Review_Date: Dani P wrote a review Nov 2016
Review_Text: I stayed for 6 nights at Radisson Blu Marrakech this month November 2016. Comparing to other hotels in the city the property is great with friendly staff new rooms tasty food ( you should try Tangia ). You will have a good breakfast with different type of food. However every day is the same buffet item lineup. It would be good to change a little bit the breakfast buffet menu from time to time as long stayer guests will get bored at the end.    Overall experience was good specially that the property has fantastic location in the center of the city plus the mall Carre Eden and near famous brands shops.    One thing is to enhance the TV channel lineup. I was in a business trip and did not have alot of time to visit outside touristic places in Marrakech. My only entertainment was the TV. Unfortunately it is so sad for this amazing 5 stars hotel does not have decent movies channels. All what I needed is to watch a good latest movie before going to bed.

Hotel_Name: Radisson Blu Hotel, Marrakech Carre Eden
Review_Date: lisa L wrote a review Nov 2016
Review_Text: Lovely building good food and efficient and friendly service-Special thanks to sami who was serving us in the bar - the chef came to check everything was ok. Reasonably priced compared with other hotels in Marrakech.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Hotel_Name: Radisson Blu Hotel, Marrakech Carre Eden
Review_Text: Booked this a couple of days before arriving in Marrakech as we were going to Essaouira the next day so needed somewhere to get to quickly and not have to search in the Medina for a Riad for one night. Hotel is really beautiful and a genuine 5 star.. we had lunch and breakfast whilst there. Lunch was amazing and presented really well. Breakfast was nice too - it's a little expensive but not in the grand scheme of things. Staff were really good including Mohamed - the guy who got a taxi to get is our bus tickets and flagged us taxis from out of the front too! Pool area is awesome and I think the pool is heated too which is great for October.. location is as good as it gets and close to everything including the Medina.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Hotel_Name: Radisson Blu Hotel, Marrakech Carre Eden
Review_Date: Willetts World wrote a review Oct 2016
Review_Title: Well designed, well appointed, well managed and VERY well done
Review_Text: Stayed October 27-30 3 nights    The Good:  Where do I begin. Everything about this hotel will only enhance your Marrakech experience not to mention how well it represents the Radisson Blu brand. It must be up there with the best. The great thing about it is it is in the beautiful Red City of Marrakech. If you haven't been and are thinking about it it is chalk and cheese between Marrakech and the likes of Casablanca or Rabat.    Location: It doesn't get any closer to the city centre. It is the city centre. On the main street of town. There are malls and shops galore all within walking distance including a giant Carrefour downstairs for those essentials you might need. Plus loads of local restaurants. And the whole area is suited for outdoor dining. It's a short walking distance to everything and only an inexpensive taxi ride to the Medina.    Was met with such warmth and enthusiasm. The team made us feel very welcome and could not be more helpful. We were taken to the room by a very friendly girl who offered us any assistance we may need during the 3 days stay.    The room design is brilliant. Clearly whoever the designer was has stayed in many hotels and understands the little idiosyncrasies that guests enjoy and need. The hotel is a very modern design but with a distinctively Moroccan ambience. The rooms are spacious loads of natural light with ample working space. The bed faces the outdoor sliding doors which opens onto a large balcony so there is loads and loads of natural light. In the morning was able to slide the curtains across to have a brilliant Moroccan sunrise.    The room is very tastefully decorated and furnished in a modern Moroccan style. Soft muted colours with coloured chairs and lamps to offset it. Really tasteful. And simple. Not over the top.    There is a mini-bar fridge that is actually cold inside! ( Another pet-peeve of mine fridges in hotels that aren't cold! drives me crazy ! ha ha ) It is stocked with the usual drinks and candy but if you are like us and have a golden rule of not using mini-bars ( ever ) we simply emptied it out and loaded it up with fresh fruit and food we bought from Carrefour downstairs.    Wifi was a bit sketchy. Mostly reasonable speed except mid-evening and early-morning when there is obviously a lot of use.    You have a choice of instant coffee and tea or they have a coffee machine as well. And of course there is a safe for your valuables.    A key thing is the great amount of cupboard space and drawers in the room. How many times do you get to a hotel room and there is no where to put your stuff? Not here more than enough space.    The bathroom: Wow. Large. Natural light beaming in from the frosted glass at one end of the bathroom with natural light directly from outside. You can even open the window if you want ( except the neighbours would have a show ).    There is a rain-shower or normal hand held shower if you want. You can walk through the shower from one end to the other. It's open-ended either end. It's a really clever design.    Water pressure is medium. The floor is non - slip amazing ( why aren't all hotels doing this! ). The toilet is separated from the bathroom. There is a double sink with full size mirrors above it as well as a full length mirror on the door. Best of all large thick white towels.    Balcony: We had a business room and it had a large balcony. It was so nice to have an outdoor area. There were some chairs and a small table outside. We were on the east side of the building and got the morning sun. So nice. And of course a few pre-dinner drinks on the balcony as well.    We never tried the facilities in the hotel but the bar looked quite funky. The restaurant is quite a good size but cannot comment on the breakfast as used the balcony. I checked the gym out and it was a good size with state of the art equipment. The pool was closed during this stay but they offered an alternative pool at a sister hotel if required.    One one night room service was ordered. Stunning. From the time it didn't take ( it was delivered to the room within 20 minutes of placing the order ) the presentation of the food the quality was superb. Better than most 5 star restaurants and best of all very reasonably priced. Order the spaghetti folks. Incredible.    The not so good:  If there is one criticism it would have to be the bed. The bed linens were cotton and had a great doona but it was hard and uneven. Like most European hotels ( and I guess African as well ) it was 2 single beds joined together and covered over with a king bed protector. Everything else was king size except for the 2 beds which were uneven in the middle.    But as I write this I think to myself What a whiner.... complaining because the beds weren't even... how precious am I becoming!! Sometimes we have to keep things in perspective don't we.    Summary:  This hotel is incredible and was a joy to stay. It is ideally located centrally located a great team of people and nice contemporary rooms. It made Marrakech just that extra special because of the quality of this place. It was a flashback to the good old days when hotels treated guests as guests rather than commodities. And when hotel staff enjoyed themselves and made it about the guest rather than themselves. And it is obviously very well managed.    Would I stay again: I'll give you one guess.....  Would I recommend: I'll give you another guess..... of course
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Hotel_Name: Radisson Blu Hotel, Marrakech Carre Eden
Review_Text: This is an outstanding hotel which offers 5* comfort throughout. All the staff are very helpful. The pool was out of action which was a shame but guests were pre-warned and arrangements could be made via the hotel to use another hotel for this. The staff also upgraded my room which was amazing. The breakfast was good with a variety to cover most people's taste. I did use the inroom dining service which was quick to arrive and beautifully presented. I didn't use the bar much but it was very pleasant and had the pool been open I would have used it more. The hotel is in the middle of the city and some rooms have amazing views of the city and I loved watching the city come alive in the morning and then watching the sunset at night was great. I will return next year when hopefully the pool area will be in use. Again many thanks to the staff.

Hotel_Name: Radisson Blu Hotel, Marrakech Carre Eden
Review_Date: Halima B wrote a review Oct 2016
Review_Text: We came to celebrate our recent marriage and my husband's birthday. We were upgraded to a Junior Suite given a complimentary cake snacks and some drinks. The pool was being refurbished to Radisson paid for our taxi fares to and from another 5* hotel to use their pool. The staff are very friendly we were greeted everywhere we went from the security guards to reception to the breakfast hall everyone asked how we are and if we needed anything. The room was clean and very comfy. We slept very well! Everything was absolutely perfect and we will definitely be returning!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Hotel_Name: Radisson Blu Hotel, Marrakech Carre Eden
Review_Date: Mounir N wrote a review Oct 2016
Review_Text: Excellent location friendly and attentive staff. Very close to the main attractions clean and good choices busy bar in the evening. Wonderful pool special thanks to Mr Walid at the pool and Mr Ismail at the Reception.

Hotel_Name: Radisson Blu Hotel, Marrakech Carre Eden
Review_Text: This is a brand new hotel less then 6 months old in the new part of town. It is adjacent to a new shopping center star bucks and numerous restaurants yet a $3 cab ride to the old city. The staff were wonderful. They provided the assistance and help you would hope for in a 5* hotel including restaurants tours spas etc. The fitness center and spa were also 1st class. The pool was not open during my stay so I hesitated to stay there but no matter. Absolutely a wonderful experience!

Hotel_Name: Radisson Blu Hotel, Marrakech Carre Eden
Review_Date: Bouda A wrote a review Oct 2016
Review_Text: This is a new built hotel with wonderful facilities. We particularly enjoyed the swimming pool the restaurant bar and the fitness centre. Personnel were extremely helpful and polite. Particularly Ali who is an amazing personal trainer at the fitness centre provided wonderful private gym sessions that made our stay even more enjoyable.

Hotel_Name: Radisson Blu Hotel, Marrakech Carre Eden
Review_Date: Marie G wrote a review Oct 2016
Review_Text: Exceptional stay at the Radisson. As newlyweds our room was decorated with rose petals and the staff was incredibly caring and congratulated us. The breakfast is incredible such a broad choice and everything was very good. The rooms are beautifully decorated and spacious. The pool is heated and exceptionally beautiful you never want to leave! The gym is fully equipped and practical. Great location with tones of great restaurants and stores in the neighborhood you can easily walk to. Stop by the hotel store if you have time they have really nice designer souvenirs to take home. I highly recommend this hotel!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Hotel_Name: Radisson Blu Hotel, Marrakech Carre Eden
Review_Date: Manish S wrote a review Oct 2016
Review_Text: an ideal place to stay at for any reason in visiting marrakech as regards location food staff cleanliness facilities. staff going out of their way in guests' problem solving if any. ideally best in marrakech.

Hotel_Name: Radisson Blu Hotel, Marrakech Carre Eden
Review_Date: Tony F wrote a review Oct 2016
Review_Text: Amazing modern hotel right in the centre and a short taxi ride to the main square market and Souks which costs less than ¬£2 and a short ride from the airport. Situated right next to a shopping mall with a huge Carrefour supermarket on the lower floor. Next door to Starbucks and a row of trendy cheap restaurants and coffee shops. The hotel staff are fantastic especially Sihom who checked us in and out and was friendly funny and efficient. Lobby was lovely pool and pool area were beautiful and was quiet with most of the beds available throughout the day. Gym was huge and breakfast buffet was amazing with omelettes cooked to order and all the hot and cold food you could need. The room on the 4th floor had a balcony overlooking the pool. The pillow cases were luxurious and beds comfortable and bathroom was large with a walk-in rain shower. The flat screen TV had a 24 movie channel which was great. Free WiFi all over even around the pool which was great to have. Loved it that much i have just booked for next year in September whoop whoop !!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Hotel_Name: Radisson Blu Hotel, Marrakech Carre Eden
Review_Text: This is a contemporary hotel located in the modern part of Marrakech but it's not far from the old town / the Medina. We only stayed 1 night (Tuesday) but it was perfect for our needs. The facilities restaurant and staff were excellent. Probably more of a business hotel than anything else however the bar and poolside area are quite glitzy and seem geared up for parties.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Hotel_Name: Radisson Blu Hotel, Marrakech Carre Eden
Review_Text: We stayed 1 night at this modern contemporary hotel. The next day we were meeting friends and staying in a Riad a little way out of town. The Radisson Blu is located in the modern area of Marrakech but it is not far from the old town and the Medina. It is a new hotel with good facilities friendly staff and a good restuarant. It is quite glitzy and the pool area was illuminated with bright lights at night and dance music (not too loud) was playing through the PA system. Perhaps they were preparing for a party the next night. Anyway we were very happy with the hotel and would stay again.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Hotel_Name: Radisson Blu Hotel, Marrakech Carre Eden
Review_Text: The rooms were different. The layout does not give you privacy. As soon as u open the door you can see the whole room. It's just not a very nice sense of privacy.    The hotel was ok staff friendly location ok. Somehow we did not have the right feeling. I have stayed in better Radissons in different countries.

Hotel_Name: Radisson Blu Hotel, Marrakech Carre Eden
Review_Text: I stayed with my friends three rooms for one week at Radisson hotel Carre Eden its new hotel all staff were very nice and helpful . rooms comfortable although bathroom layout not to my taste some rooms have walk in showers and some have jump up bathtub not for the elderly breakfast is one of the best I have seen valet parking is handy and convenient the lifts are the only akward thing about the hotel only one takes you to your floor with a stop at reception presumably for security reason overall I would stay again in this hotel it's about time Marrakech gets corporate hotel like Radisson

Hotel_Name: Radisson Blu Hotel, Marrakech Carre Eden
Review_Date: Mavis H wrote a review Sep 2016
Review_Text: Amazingly professional and efficient staff namely Rachida the Miracle Worker Ismal the handsome comedian and Fatima the waitress with the biggest heart xx The food in the restaurant was delicious and all staff incredibly courteous

Hotel_Name: Radisson Blu Hotel, Marrakech Carre Eden
Review_Title: Many promises that they are unable to complete upon.
Review_Text: A reservation made at very short notice due to being let down by two other hotels in the area brought me here. The major enquiry on booking was that a fast and stable internet connection was a must. The hotel is a modern affair with decent facilities. What it does not have is what I needed - high speed internet. I was sent a technician who did not know how to resolve the problem on the first night - 1mbps for this type of hotel and cost is frankly not acceptable. The A/C did not function - promised support for that issue still had not arrived the following morning. The beds are very very hard. If you are going to advertise to put facilities in service in place - there should be the product in place to support this. The Raddison Blu has not done this.

Hotel_Name: Radisson Blu Hotel, Marrakech Carre Eden
Review_Title: Caring Staff, all the mod cons, central location and amazing pool!
Review_Text: I stayed during a week-long conference and was sad I didn't have more time to relax at the hotel. But when there staff were very friendly and attentive wifi connection strong and stable and what a fun pool. So many instagram shots taken! I would definitely recommend this hotel particularly for business travellers.

Hotel_Name: Radisson Blu Hotel, Marrakech Carre Eden
Review_Date: Nabil K wrote a review Sep 2016
Review_Title: nice business stay at radisson blu marrakech
Review_Text: a very nice hotel which respect the highest quality and best services in hospitality . Staff is very friendly and has got passion for job . breakfast is excellent  room well equiped and very clean. I'll Come back again with pleasur very soon.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Hotel_Name: Radisson Blu Hotel, Marrakech Carre Eden
Review_Text: This is a very smartsharp & modern hotel which I enjoyed for a 2 night stay. The poolside area is really well maintained with plenty of comfortable sun loungers. The restaurant & bar areas are spacious and there's plenty of capacity. Staff very helpful and kind. Note that (perhaps as it's so new) taxi drivers only seem to know it as Hotel Carre Eden.

Hotel_Name: Radisson Blu Hotel, Marrakech Carre Eden
Review_Date: Shazad S wrote a review Sep 2016
Review_Title: Brilliant place with top class service
Review_Text: Just wanted to say thank you to Rasheeda from guest relations she was brilliant made sure my daughter an I were looked after at all times. Would recommend highly brilliant location an the staff will go out of their way to make sure you are comfortable an in the case you don't like something Rasheeda will make sure it's exactly the way you want it.  Will definitely be back.

Hotel_Name: Radisson Blu Hotel, Marrakech Carre Eden
Review_Date: Kathi Black wrote a review Sep 2016
Review_Text: I had occasion to stay at this new hotel and it was wonderful. Centrally located in the new part of town on the Main Street at the mall. It is very well decorated and laid out. The bar and restaurant are perfect for entertaining groups or for a finding a quiet corner. Stop in for drinks or a meal. The included breakfast offered an omelette bar and many other choices. The pool and outdoor patio is fantastic and so quiet. An oasis in the city. Must visit of only for a meal but please stay also - the rooms are excellent.

Hotel_Name: Radisson Blu Hotel, Marrakech Carre Eden
Review_Title: Welcoming and friendly staff, new property
Review_Text: The Radisson Blu is a new clean and modern property with a very well trained friendly staff who make you feel very welcome. The rooms are comfortable and well appointed; beds were comfortable. Rooms had strong air conditioning. We arrived very tired and had dinner in the hotel dinning room. All the dishes we ordered were creative and delicious. The buffet breakfast has all the choices you could want.

Hotel_Name: Radisson Blu Hotel, Marrakech Carre Eden
Review_Text: Great central location.  Very smart modern hotel.  Super polite staff.  Lots of security.  Room smelt like a dead pigeon( maybe aircon ) but had to leave door open all night because of smell.  Room itself very smart with walk in shower. Tea/coffee facilities hairdryeriron.

Hotel_Name: Radisson Blu Hotel, Marrakech Carre Eden
Review_Date: Simon S wrote a review Sep 2016
Review_Title: Impeccable service and superb interior design
Review_Text: This hotel is brand new very centrally located and beautifully designed. But the real upside is the quality of the customer service. The staff was very attentive to our comfort and went into great lengths to help us when we were in need. I can 100% recommend this place for all occasions
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Hotel_Name: Radisson Blu Hotel, Marrakech Carre Eden
Review_Date: Bob B wrote a review Aug 2016
Review_Text: Brand new hotel. We were there the first day they opened; had a few opening day issues. Nothing major. Very nice pool area. Food was excellent. Interior layout very modern. Comfortable rooms. . Staff could not have been be nicer.

Hotel_Name: Radisson Blu Hotel, Marrakech Carre Eden
Review_Text: This was the first time we visited Marrakech with family we stayed at the raddison blu on 8/8/16 for 5 days we had the best time ever. The hotel was very secure with security guards at the front We felt very safe.The staff was very friendlypolitehelpful always smiling and welcomingalways happy to help from the moment we walked in.  The Breakfast was amazing words couldn't describe how fresh the food was and all the different choices of food there was.
